loans.name: Rocío Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rocío es una madre soltera que con 50 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo todo tipo de calzado; esta actividad la aprendió de manera empírica, pues hace aproximadamente 2 meses se le presentó la oportunidad de iniciar este negocio con productos traídos de otra ciudad donde tiene contactos que se la hacen llegar, con buena calidad y a bajo costo; ésta mercancía es vendida puerta a puerta, por lo que no posee un horario de trabajo establecido; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de sus hijos.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (tacones, sandalias, tennis, entre otros), con lo que podrá tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes en esta temporada navideña, en la que sus ventas se incrementan, mejorando el nivel de ingresos que recibe por su labor, con los cuales se enfrenta a los diversos desafíos que se le presentan, como el de darse a conocer en el mercado, ya que es todo un reto ser competitivo, pero ella lo logra ofreciendo buena calidad y buen precio y, hasta el momento ha obtenido buenos resultados.
Rocío sueña con consolidar su negocio y poder ampliar su red de comercialización, generando más oportunidades de empleo, lo que le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida a futuro.
texts.en:
Rocío is 50 years old and a single mother. She works as an independent salesperson, selling all kinds of footwear. She has learned this work through observation since approximately two months ago. It was then that the opportunity presented itself to start this business with products sourced from another city where she has contacts who can obtain for her good quality items at a low cost. She sells her products door-to-door and does not have a fixed work schedule. She earns enough money to pay for her children’s basic needs.

Rocío is requesting this loan to buy merchandise at wholesale prices, such as high-heeled shoes, sandals and tennis shoes, among others. With these products she will be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products during the Christmas season, when her sales increase. This will improve the amount of income she receives for her work, which she will use to meet the various challenges she faces, such as making herself known in the market, because she says it is a challenge to be competitive. She meets this challenge by offering good quality items at good prices, which so far has produced good results.

Rocío dreams of strengthening her business, increasing her sales network and generating more employment opportunities, which would allow her to improve her quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale prices, such as high-heeled shoes, sandals and tennis shoes, among others.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: To earn a living Irene helps her husband in running a business providing motor transportation services. She also uses this motorcycle for her dry goods business. She earns a good income for the family. She joined GDMPC recently and requested a loan to cover the costs of maintenance and licenses. Irene hopes to earn an even better living for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of maintenance and licenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition and school supplies

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь живет и работает в Новой Каховке. Она — частный предприниматель-торговец. У Любови есть торговый павильон на местном рынке, где она арендует землю у администрации, а также отдел в местном торговом центре. Любовь в основном торгует детской и подростковой одеждой. В торговле занята уже 16 лет. 
Финансовую помощь в размере 25 000 гривен Любовь планирует использовать для того, чтобы осуществить поездку за товаром и пополнить ассортимет зимней детской одежды, а именно купить брюки, куртки, юбки, свитера и кофты, а также детские игрушки.
texts.en: Lubov lives and works in Novaya Kahovka.  She is a sole proprietor, seller.  Lubov has a retail pavillion at a local market, where she leases land from the administration, and also a department at a local shopping center.  Lubov primarily sells children's and juniors' clothing.  She has been involved in sales for 16 years.  Lubov plans to use the financial aid in the amount of 25,000 hryvnia to make trip for merchandise and refill her selection with winter children's clothing, specifically pants, jackets, skirts, sweaters and shirts, and also children's toys.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as pants, jackets, skirts, sweaters and shirts, and also children's toys

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses is a member of this group from the Webuye District. He is pictured here with a group of 8 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 89 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Moses has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Moses is married and has 9 children. He is 49 years old and is known as a friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Moses has been a farmer for 16 years. Moses described his harvest as poor last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Moses first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Moses joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund. Moses plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Moses’s own life was improved because he has more profits from the harvests, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.

Moses and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is a 46-year-old married woman, living with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings he has purchased a used auto rickshaw, its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have a sufficient amount to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Asiya requested a loan for her husband so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. Asiya hopes that her husband would be able to earn more income. Asiya is very happy about taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new body for a three-wheeled auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.ru: У Фахридина большое желание работать, зарабатывать обеспечивать себя и свою семью. Фахридину 24 года. Он живет с мамой и тремя братьями на районе Шахритус. Фахириддин хочет начать свой бизнес в сфере торговли обуви. Он планирует закупать товар из рынка Корвон города Душанбе оптом и перепродать на рынке родного района Шахритус. На сумму от кредита Фахридин намерен приобрести свой первый товар. Ему будут помогать его братья. У Фахридина огромное желание работать и быть самостоятельным. Он надеется, что получит помощи и начнет бизнес.
texts.en: Fakhridin has a lot of desire to work, earn and provide for himself and his family.  Fakhridin is 24 years old.  He lives with his mother and three brothers in the Shahrituz district.  Fakhridin wants to start his own business in selling shoes.  He plans to buy merchandise wholesale at the Korvon market in the city of Dushanbe and resell it at a market of his native Shahrituz district.  Fakhridin intends to use the loan amount to purchase his first merchandise.  His brothers will be helping him.  Fakhridin has a huge desire to work and be independent.  He hopes that he will receive help and start his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and start his own shoe-selling business

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсаре 41 года. Она из города Душанбе. Гулсара мать троих детей.  Она воспитала троих замечательных сыновей. Ее сыновья живут с ней. Старшему сыну 22 года, среднему 20, младшему сыну 7 лет. Старший сын Гулсары работает в дилерском центре, он продает сим-карты и пополняет счета мобильных телефонов, средний сын работает в одном из ресторанов города. Сама Гулсара более трех лет работает в сфере торговли. Она на рынке города занимается продажей детских вещей.  Гулсара любит свою работу, и она очень рада, что уже более трех лет занимается любимым делом.  У Гулсары не хватает не много средств, чтобы купить детскую сезонную одежду, и она решила обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Gulsara is 41 years old.  She is from the city of Dushanbe.  Gulsara is a mother of three children.  She raised three wonderful sons.  Her sons live with her.  The oldest son is 22, middle is 20 and the youngest son is 7 years old.  Gulsara's oldest son works at a dealer center, where he sells SIM cards and refills mobile phone accounts, the middle son works at one of the city restaurants.  Gulsara has been working in the retail field for over three years.  She sells children's clothing at a city market.  Gulsara loves her work and is glad to have been doing what she loves for over three years.  Gulsara does not have enough money to purchase children's seasonal clothing and decided to obtain this loan.

loans.use: to purchase children's seasonal clothing

loans.name: Rosario Fatima

texts.es: Rosario es originaria de la ciudad de Jalapa, Nueva Segovia, madre soltera de un hijo ya independiente. Tiene 49 años de edad. De oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Inicio su negocio hace siete años con el fin de adquirir ingresos para su hogar. Hoy en día cuenta con un negocio prospero. Solicita el crédito para comprar una mayor variedad de productos, con el fin de ofrecer una amplia gama de productos a su clientela. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias. Su plan futuro es ofrecer otras líneas de productos varios.
texts.en:
Rosario is a native of Jalapa, Nueva Segovia. She is a single mother of one son who is now independent. She is 49 years old. She is a salesperson who works selling cosmetics. She started this business seven years ago with the goal of making money for her household. Today the business is prospering.

Rosario is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of products with the goal of offering a broad range of goods to her customers. She estimates that the loan will be very useful increasing her sales and allowing for greater profits. Her future plan is to offer other lines of various products.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Maryluz tiene 34 años y tuvo la oportunidad de iniciar los estudios con el convenio  KIVA,  gracias a ustedes está cumpliendo su mayor sueño de ser auxiliar de enfermería y así  lograr  poner la vida al servicio de la comunidad en un ámbito tan importante y fundamental como es la salud, durante el primer semestre aprendió cada parte del cuerpo del ser humano, todo lo relacionado con los cuidados que debe tener con un paciente, procedimientos como :  Enemas, Sonda nasogástricas, Sondaje vesical, Cuidados en unidades, en cama, Muestras de laboratorio, entre otros. Tuvo un cambio radical en su entorno ya que todo lo aprendido ha cambiado la forma de pensar y actuar,  las metas están más  claras y enfocadas y está más convencida que la profesión de la enfermería es lo máximo en la vida y así poder brindar un servicio a toda persona que lo necesite para convertirse en la mejor profesional donde desempeñe la labor como auxiliar de enfermería.
Necesita otra vez el convenio KIVA para poder terminar la  carrera y desempeñarse en este ámbito tan importante y soñado,  para poder obtener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
En espera de una pronta colaboración.
texts.en:
Maryluz, 34, had the opportunity to begin her studies with a loan from KIVA. Thanks to you, she's realizing her dream of becoming a nursing assistant and dedicating herself to servicing the community in such an important and fundamental area: health. In the first semester, she learned every part of the human body, everything related to taking care of a patient, including: how to administer an enema, stomach pump and bladder probe; how to provide unit care or bed care; how to handle laboratory tests, among others. Everything that she has learned has changed her way of thinking and acting, which has radically changed her outlook. Her goals are clearer, more focused and she is more convinced than ever that the nursing profession is the maximum in life. That is, being able to offer service to every person that needs it and becoming the best professional that carries out her duties as an assistant nurse.

She is requesting another loan from KIVA to finish her studies and move into this very important and dreamed-of profession, in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Awaiting a collaboration.

loans.use: pay for 1 semester of tuition.

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en:
Gunduz is a 48 year –old, married man. He is raising 2 children, who are currently in school, with his wife. Gunduz lives with his family in the Agsu region. For the past 15 years, Gunduz has been working hard to manage his electronics business, where he sells electronic items.
To help expand his business, Gunduz has requested a loan of 2000 AZN from Aqroinvest CU. The loan will be used to purchase more stock. This will help Gunduz to generate greater profits and will increase his daily sales. Gunduz hopes that, in the future, he will be able to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his electronics store.

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vuqar is a 22-year-old, single client from Agsu. For the past 2  years, he has run his  own grocery store with help from his father who works also as a private employee. This grocery store helps them move forward and it ensures another income source for the family, especially when expenses increase. 

Vuqar sells different kinds of food, like soft drinks, sugar, cake ,sweets  flour, and other kinds of supplies. He  hopes that a  loan of 1500 AZN will allow him  to buy a refrigerator, electric generator, and shelves. He needs the electric generator because electricity in the Agsu area is constantly interrupted. 

Vuqar is very grateful to everyone who helps him .

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, electric generator, and shelves.

loans.name: Rubaba

texts.en:
Rubaba is 56 year-old married woman. She has been running her general store for 15 years. It is an important source of living for her beloved family, since her husband has a very low-income business. Rubaba is requesting her first loan of 2,000 AZN from Kiva partner Aqroinvest CU to increase her business merchandise with special detergents highly requested by her customers. She might also invest part of the loan in buying other special offered products which will attract customers' attention and increase her selling.

She hopes to stay capable of responding to her customers’ needs to make sure that she can easily cover her family's needs

loans.use: to buy special detergents and other products, which will attract customers

loans.name: Madre Teresa De Calcuta Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Madre Teresa De Calcuta”  conformado por 05 socios la cual pasan a su 2do ciclo. Raquel de 47 años es separada  y tiene  03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Con los deseos de mejorar su situación económica y de esta manera aportar con los gastos del hogar Raquel inicia su negocio, la cual hace más de 03 años realiza preparaciones de buffet  para eventos como  bautizos, bodas y cumpleaños. Su reciente crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, leche, harina y así poder preparar sus comidas. Seguir mejorando su negocio es su deseo. El grupo “Madre Teresa De Calcuta” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.   Raquel es la primera del lado derecho y viste blusa floreada y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
The "Madre Teresa de Calcuta" communal bank is comprised of five members who are in their second cycle. Raquel, 47, is separated and has three children, two of whom are dependent. In the hopes of improving her economic situation, which supports her household expenses, Raquel started her business three years ago. She makes buffets for events such as baptisms, weddings, and birthdays.

Her current loan will be used to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, milk, and flour so she can make her food. She hopes to improve her business. The "Madre Teresa de Calcuta" communal bank is grateful to the people who make this loan possible. In the photo, Raquel is the first one on the right, wearing a flowered blouse and black pants.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, milk, and flour.

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.ru:
Михаил — из Хуста, где он живет с супругой и тремя детьми. На жизнь он зарабатывает тем, что покупает спутниковые антенны и тюнеры и устанавливает их клиентам. Начинал с того, что работал на частного предпринимателя, который занимался аналогичным бизнесом. Со временем Михаил все распланировал, научился работать самостоятельно, наладил связи по приобретению данного товара и потом взялся за собственное дело, решив работать из дому.  
Михаил планирует поповнить ассортимент предоставляемых товаров, для чего ему необходимы дополнительные капиталовложения. Сумма в 10 000 гривен будет использована для того, чтобы приобрести несколько тарелок с тремя транспондерами. Получив дополнительную прибыль, Михаил хотел бы вложить ее в образование детей, которое считает самым выгодным капиталовложением.
texts.en: Mikhail is from Khoost, where he lives with his wife and three children.  He earns a living by buying satellite antennas and tuners and installing them for customers.  He started with working at a private company, where he was involved in a similar business.  With time, Mikhail planned everything out, learned to work independently, established connections for purchasing this merchandise and then started his own business, working from his home.  Mikhail plans to refill his merchandise selection and needs addiitonal capital funding.  The amount of 10,000 hryvnia will be used to purchase several dishes with three transponders.  Having obtained additional profit, Mikhail wants to invest it into his children's education, which he considers the most profitable capital investment.

loans.use: to purchase several dishes with three transponders

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es una víctima más del desplazamiento forzado, debido a la violencia que se presentó en su ciudad natal; allí tenía su propio negocio, una ebanistería en la que trabaja diariamente para conseguir el sustento para la familia, pero hace muchos años se trasladó para la ciudad con su esposa y sus 5 hijos como alternativa para proteger sus vidas y dejando todo lo que habían construido con esfuerzo y sacrificio. Luego de radicarse, comenzó nuevamente su negocio en un local subarrendado, aprovechando que pudo recuperar su maquinaria; trabaja de lunes a sábado de 8 am a 6 pm y recibe el apoyo de su esposa y uno de sus hijos, cuenta con la ventaja de tener 2 clientes fijos que le solicitan muchos pedidos, su especialidad son los comedores, los cuales entrega en blanco y el cliente es quien se encarga de realizar las terminaciones; de esta manera ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y han podido construir una nueva vida.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar insumos al por mayor (madera, papel de lija, pegante, puntillas, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los encargos pendientes y mejorará las ventas e ingresos.
Carlos se proyecta para el futuro cercano, en el que desea construir su casa propia, adquirir un carro para su negocio y tener un taller bien estructurado y acreditado, para seguir generando recursos que le permitan garantizar a su familia una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is the victim of a forced displacement, due to the violence that occurred in his native city. There he had his own business, a cabinet-maker who worked daily to support his family. But many years ago they moved from the city in order to protect the lives of his wife and their 5 children. They left behind all they had constructed with effort and sacrifice. 

After moving he started business again in a sub-leased shop, taking advantage of being able to recoup his machinery. He works Monday to Saturday from 8 am until 6 pm. She has the help of his wife and one of his children. He has the advantage of having two steady clients who produce many orders. His specialty is dining room sets, which he delivers unfinished and the customer takes care of the final touches. In this manner he has been able to get ahead with his family and has been able to build a new life. 

The loan Carlos is requesting is to buy supplies wholesale (wood,sandpaper, glue, tacks, etc.). This will allow him to have sufficient material to complete the orders he has outstanding which will increase his sales and income. Carlos projects that in the near future he will build the house he wants, buy a vehicle for the business and have a well-structured and well-known business. He can then continue to generate the resources that allow his family economic stability and a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (wood,sandpaper, glue, tacks, etc.)

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
Avaz is 42 years old. He lives in a rural village with his 3 children. He is a divorcee. Avaz raises his children alone. The family gathers their main income from farming. They cultivate wheat, maize and watermelon. In addition to farming, Avaz is also involved in cattle breeding. He has applied for this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel. He has been busy with his business for many years and that’s why he manages this business successfully.
This is the 6th loan from IMON and he has a good credit story. He is asking for a loan of 12,000 TJS. He awaits your support. From the profits he is going to improve the living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn is 45 years old, married and has four children. He runs a small business of growing rice in Pursat province. He manages about two hectares of land for rice cultivation and earns a daily income of USD 10.00 per day. With help from his wife and children, Morn has been doing this for years, and it’s the major source of his family’s income.

As he doesn't have a safe latrine yet at home, he would like to acquire a loan to buy supplies for the construction and pay laborers for their services. Through the help of the loan, he hopes to improve his family’s health and sanitation. 

With another portion of the loan, he also will build water storage, so he can ensure enough water for the household in both seasons and save much time in collecting the water. 

He thanks lenders for contributing their own money in a program like Kiva via its partner, HKL, to help low-income people gain access to water and sanitation. For this kind of loan product, HKL has provided him a special interest rate than its general products.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the construction of a safe latrine and water storage, and pay laborers for their services.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store and she was also able to buy spare parts and accessories for her jeepney unit. Her loan is also helping with the education of her children, who are both in college. Her income from the business is helping cover their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their daily needs.

Mira would like to apply for a 50,000 Philippine peso loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better! More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mira dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Al-Reem Group

texts.en:
Al-Reem is a four-member group. All of them are poor ladies from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a 240,000 YER loan from AMB. 

Aftekar is a 28-year-old married woman who has a child. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and living in a poor area in Taiz. Her house is very old and in miserable condition. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. 

It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she needs more money. She needs to complete the renovation, so she asked for a loan of 60,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. 

She hopes that after the completion of her house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a savings account

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to use for renovating her house.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a 31-year-old who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He operates a phone accessory business. He has five years of experience in this business and therefore has a great deal of knowledge about the market and the demands of customers. He is a very successful entrepreneur, partly because of his shop's great location in the strategic centre.  He is the sole source of income for his family. He would like to expand his business but he doesn't have the financial capacity. He has applied for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB to purchase more products like phones, recharge cards for adding minutes, chargers, etc. to diversify the range of goods to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase more products like phones, recharge cards for adding minutes, chargers, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 39 years old and is married with three children. He has a college degree in business accounting studies. He currently operates a mobile money transfer business, which is his only source of income.

Prior to starting his mobile money business, Victor worked as an accountant for a company in his hometown. The pay was very low and he was looking for a way to better provide for his family. After a friend introduced him to Zoona mobile money he invested the money he had saved into opening an outlet. Shortly thereafter Victory applied for a Kiva loan and used the money to increase his working capital so he could serve more customers and earn additional profits. Now, Victor is able to take better care of his family and pay his boys' school fees. He finished paying off his first loans and now Victor is requesting a second loan to open a second outlet. He sees an opportunity to expand his business but has capital constraints to open the new shop and have enough working capital to service customers.

loans.use: to expand his business by opening a second  Zoona mobile money transfer shop in his hometown

loans.name: Asmat's Group

texts.en:
Asmat is a 35-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. Her husband has been driving a moto-rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bear jerking over roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles during driving. This is the reason her husband wants to buy a new body for the moto-rickshaw.

She requested a loan so that her husband can replace the rickshaw body so that he can drive it smoothly. Asmat thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 32-year-old businesswoman who is married with two children. She rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year and it has enabled her to support her family in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. Tsitsi serves as a role model for her community as is well-known for supporting vulnerable children and for her voluntary work at community centers. 

With the requested loan, Tsitsi plans on purchasing bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts to increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her children’s education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 53 years of age, married and blessed with seven children. She engaged herself in the food production business, particularly a bakery. She has been in this business for ten years. Lanie's goal in her business is to have higher sales. Income gained from her business is used for their daily consumption. 

At this moment, Lanie needs additional capital to improve her business. With regards to this matter, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy flour, sugar, eggs and yeast to bake breads to sell. 

She believes through borrowing additional capital, she will further improve her financial stability and way of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs and yeast to bake breads to sell.

loans.name: Rahoma

texts.en:
Rahoma has owned and operated a retail business in the local community for four years. Aside from this, she also has a farm harvesting coconut and selling copra (dried coconut) in town. She earns well and was able to successfully repay her previous loan, which was used to purchased goods for sale.

Recently, she requested a new loan to repair the shelter for drying copra and to buy a cart used in her coconut farm. In the future, Rahoma wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair the shelter for drying coconut and to buy a cart for the farm

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria has been  selling ready-to-wear clothes in order to make a living . With more than nine years running the business, Gloria earns well for the family and was able to repay her previous loans from GDMPC successfully. She used this previous loans as capital for her business. Recently, she requested a new loan to  purchase jeans and shirts to sell. In the future, she hopes to be more successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase jeans and shirts to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth’s group has six group-leader farmers and is located in Webuye District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 66 individual farmers (not pictured), who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Elizabeth is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised.	
						
Elizabeth is 32 years old and has been a farmer for eleven years. Elizabeth works as a farmer to provide for her three children. The community and other farmers know Elizabeth as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Elizabeth described her harvest last year as excellent, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.
	
Elizabeth first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Elizabeth joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and as an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Elizabeth plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Elizabeth’s own life was improved because she has more profits from the harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.  
							
Elizabeth and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 9 group-leader farmers in Webuye District, with Martha selected as the Kiva representative. Martha has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 99 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings each.

Martha is married and has 5 children. She is 53 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, prayer group, and burial committee. Martha has been a farmer for 31 years. Martha described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Martha first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Martha joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed her family, and send her children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and as an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.

Martha plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, repair their home, save for the future, buy a goat and invest in a business. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Martha’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.

Martha and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Jetina's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 9 group-leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Jetina selected as the Kiva representative. Jetina has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 100 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Jetina is 63 years old and has been a farmer for 23 years. Jetina works as a farmer to provide for her 9 children. The community and other farmers know Jetina as hardworking, reliable and trustworthy. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community such as the women's group and savings group. Jetina is also involved in the community as the chairlady for a merry-go-round. Jetina described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Jetina joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and will continue working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. As an active member in her community, Jetina also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. Jetina plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more farm training and was able to feed the family.

Jetina and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Xaladdin

texts.en:
Xaladdin is 35 years old, married and he has one son.  Xaladdin lives with his family in his city, his parents also lives with him because they are old and ill,  because of that Xaladdin taking care of his parents too. He is very positive man.

Xaladdin is a market vendor.  He sells food products like cakes, rice and sugar, among other items. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 

Xaladdin has had this business for 6  years. He started with his own capital. Upon seeing the good results that his sales generated for him, he decided to continue. He started in this field due to the need to have an occupation and to support his life partner with the household expenses. Also, he feels like a productive and independent person. He wishes to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that reflected in his family’s well-being.

Xaladdin is now requesting 1000 AZN. He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him in accessing the loan, which he needs to continue meeting his goals. He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client. He will use the requested loan to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store. This is his 1st loan.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married to a peasant farmer. She has 3 children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a junior high school graduate, Veronica currently sells stationeries in Ve-deme (near Hohoe).  With over 3 years of experience in this trade, Veronica sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more exercise books, studying materials/textbooks, which will help her boost her overall sales. 

Veronica wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her stationery enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more exercise books, studying materials/text books, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace operates a local chop bar.  She is involved in cooking and selling banku, fufu and plain fice and waakye in Ve-deme (near Hohoe). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a businessman) support their 6 children. She has been involved in cooking and selling a variety of food for 5 years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of rice, cooking oil, tin tomatoes, onions, corn dough and cassava for pounding fufu.   This will help her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her chop bar and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Imarat

texts.en:
Imarat is a 54-year-old married person with 3 kids.  Eleven years ago, she decided to open a business so that she could support her  family, which is comprised of her husband  and three children, ages 30, 28 & 16. She works together with her  two assistants in a small cafeteria, which she built through hard work and sacrifice. Her  business is well known due to its strategic location and good service.

Imarat's biggest dream is to expand her  business so that she can service more customers. Therefore, she has applied for a loan for AZN 1000  to remodel and buy inventory for her cafe. She hopes to send her son to college.

loans.use: to remodel her cafeteria and buy inventory

loans.name: Rouguiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sobouldé a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Ce  groupe en sein des femmes très braves et désireuses d’apporter un plus à leur foyer. Elles habitent toutes le même village. Il existe une parfaite solidarité entre les femmes. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce et la fabrication de savon traditionnel.

Madame Rouguiatou (debout à l’extrême droit), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont 01 fille. Son activité consiste à acheter de l’huile de palm, du riz et autres produits alimentaires en gros au marché central de la commune pour la revente en détail au village.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 03 bidons d’huile de palm de 20 litres à 18 000 F CFA le bidon et 05 sacs de riz à 13 500 F CFA le sac.

Les bénéfices lui permettront en plus de renforcer son épargne, d’apporter son soutien à son mari dans la gestion des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The Sobouldé group was created May 17th, 2011 at the inauguration of their banc villageois. This group consists of very brave women who want to provide more for their homes. They all live in the same village. There is a great solidarity among the women. Their main business activity is the petty trade and manufacturing of traditional soaps.

Rouguiatou (standing on the far right), is the group's featured borrower. She is married and is the mother of five children, one of whom is a girl. Her business consists of buying palm oil, rice,and other food products wholesale at the town's central marketplace to resell at retail in the village.

With this new loan, she expects to buy three 20-liter cans of palm oil at 18,000 FCFA each, and five bags of rice at 13,500 FCFA each.

The profits will allow her to strengthen her savings and help her support her husband in managing the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy three 20-liter cans of palm oil at 18,000 FCFA each, and five bags of rice at 13,500 FCFA each.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita is from the village of Centro 2 in the town of San Guillermo. She is 33 years old, married having three children. To make a living,she engaged herself in selling frozen food within her local community.Warlita usually  offers hot-dog(sausage), "toccino" and ham. According to her,she is able to earns PHP 1,000 a week.With her aim to expand her business,she decided to seek for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more ham, hot-dog(sausage), "langgonisa" and "toccino" to sell.She hopes to have continuous growth of her food production sales business in order to gain greater income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy more ham, hot-dogs, longgonisa (sausage), and tocino (sweet pork) to sell

loans.name: Zaynabjon

texts.en: Zaynabjon is smart and hardworking woman from the north part of Tajikistan. She is a married parent of 3 children. Her children are adults. She is the main bread-winner of the family as her husband is a pensioner. Zaynabjon began her business selling children's clothes 4 years ago because she needed money. Zaynabjon sells children's clothes in a local market. She has her own selling place. Zaynabjon must to buy new goods for every season. Only in this way she can to attract customers. Zaynabjon is asking for a loan to buy children's clothes. She is going to improve her living condition with the profit. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is engaged in a direct selling business, particularly beauty products,  within her locality. She offers her products on a house-to-house basis.  According to her, she gets the products in cash or through credit from the company and earns 25% from the price. Sometimes when her customers have  many orders, she can’t get it all because her credit line is not enough to purchase all her customer orders.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase perfumes, lotion, make-up, blush on and other beauty products. She hopes to purchase all her customer orders so she will be able to satisfy her customer demand and encourage more customers to buy the products she offers.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school and later learned how to sew, Francis decided to set up his own tailoring business center in Ve-deme (near Hohoe). With over 15 years worth of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help him purchase a new electric sewing machine to enable him to work more efficiently and increase his capacity. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a small trader) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 5 children are able to experience a better life. He also hopes to create a nest egg of savings for future needs.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn for her family's provision as well as selling a portion of it for their extra needs. She had successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she had used to improve her farm. Recently, she borrowed another loan  to purchase fertilizer for the next crop season. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is a small-scale trader who sells foodstuff and vegetables in Ve-deme (near Hohoe).  The types of vegetables she sells varies by the season. She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Peace has been working as a petty trader for close to twenty years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of foodstuffs such as yams, beans, maize and vegetables such as okra, etc. thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elisa pertenece al banco comunal LAMAY QOSQO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia María Elisa tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos entre otros, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes  que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracia al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,  la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maria Elisa is part of the LAMAY QOSQO communal bank, located in the Lamay district of the Calca province and Cusco department.

Maria Elisa is 28 years old, married and raises small animals such as chickens and others to resell them to customers who request them.  She has been doing this for some time and things are going well thanks to her daily efforts.  She wants to continue working and supporting her family. 

She is asking for this loan to buy chickens.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia Matilde  pertenece al banco comunal LAMAY QOSQO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Matilde tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos, cuyes entre otros, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes  que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,  la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Matilde is part of the LAMAY QOSQO communal bank, located in the Lamay district of the Calca province and Cusco department.

Matilde is 33 years old, single and raises small animals such as chickens, Guinea pigs and others to resell them to customers who request them.  She has been doing this for some time and things are going well thanks to her daily efforts.  She wants to continue working to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy chickens.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Jusley Milena

texts.es:
Un día estaba milena frente al computador sin saber que estudiar,pues estaba recién graduada del colegio y todavía no encontraba que le gustaba, cuando empezó a investigar sobre las carreras, con la cual se identifico bastante fue con salud ocupacional. 
Al consultar en que universidades estaba la carrera que ella quería, se dio cuenta que era un poco costosa, aunque los padres le colaboran con una parte, para ella era muy costoso, al buscar información sobre el programa de administración en salud se acercaba a lo que ella quería estudiar, este fue el primer paso que milena dio para empezar sus estudios en campo alto 
Al finalizar su semestre, los aspectos significativos que ella vio del programa es que desde la parte administrativa, ella pueda ayudar a los pacientes con tan solo una orden o simplemente brindando la atención y respuestas que el usuario en el momento buscara, aunque ella no le podía colaborar en todo, trataba de abarcar una gran parte.
Con esto ha aprendido que en la parte de la salud ay muchas cosas  afondo que la parte asistencial, de tras de todo se encuentra las entidades que prestan los servicios entre otros.
Con el convenio con kiva podría terminar esta carrera y mas adelante continuar con su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
One day Milena was in front of the computer not knowing what to study. She had recently graduated from school and still had not found what she was interested in, when she began to research professions. The one she identified with quite a bit was occupational health.

When she looked up which universities offered the degree that she wanted, she realized that it was a bit expensive. Even though her parents cover part of it, it was very expensive for her. When she looked for information about the health management program, she got closer to what she wanted to study. This was the first step that Milena took to begin her studies at Campo Alto.

When she finished her semester, the significant parts of the program that she saw were that from the administrative standpoint, she can help patients with just an order or simply providing attention and answers that the user is looking for. Although she couldn't cover everything, she tried to cover a significant part.

With this, she has learned that when it comes to health, there is a lot behind the actual medical care. Behind the scenes, there are a lot of organizations that provide services and other things.

With the agreement with Kiva, she could complete this degree and later continue with her professional degree.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of education.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy products for her direct selling business as well as in her variety store. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her child. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.

Grace would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Grace hopes to be successful both in life and business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and study the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, invertirá capital en la venta de calzado por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo, con el que efectuara  la compra de sandalias para adultos y niños, ya que en estas temporadas que se acercan las ventas aumentan.
Con el préstamo anterior surtió su negocio de antojitos, con lo que se ha a mantenido trabajando, ha incluido otro actividad economica en su negocio como lo es l aventa de calsado y ampliando poco a poco su negocio, sus ventas aumentaros, las ganancias son mejores, ya cancelo sus deudas.
texts.en:
Marta will invest her capital in shoe sales, so she is requesting a new loan to purchase sandals for adults and children, since the time of year when sales increase is coming.

With her last loan, she stocked her business selling snacks, which she has continued working at.  She has also included another activity in her business, which is selling shoes.  Her business is growing little by little, her sales are increasing, her income is better, and she has repaid her debts.

loans.use: to purchase sandals for adults and children.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 7 group leader farmers in Webuye District with Moses selected as the Kiva representative. Moses has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 76 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
Moses is 55 years old and has been a farmer for 36 years. Moses works as a farmer to provide for his 8 children. The community and other farmers know Moses as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community though groups such as the savings group, prayer group and burial committee.

Moses described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Moses joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Moses joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed family. Because he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Moses has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Moses's life because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and feed his family. In the future, Moses hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, repair his home, save for the future, buy a goat and invest in a business.

Moses and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is 49 years old. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen, together with his family, which is made up of his wife and his eight children.  He has been operating a bakery to which he has been devoted for more than 20 years, and it is his main source of income. He has worked hard in order to keep his business active and to be able to put the daily bread and pastries on the table at home. He gets up very early in order to have the delicious breads and pastries ready for his customers. 

Yahya has decided to invest in his business. This is why he is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to invest in buying necessary basic supplies wholesale (flour, eggs, sugar, milk, colorants, butter, etc.). His aim is to satisfy a greater demand in order to improve his sales and, in turn, his income. This would allow him to fulfill his biggest dream, which is to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy bakery supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a widow and has 10 children. After successfully graduating middle school, Francisca is now an established businesswoman. She sells smoked fish. and also processes and sells palm oil in Ve-deme (near Hohoe). She has been actively involved in this business for about 16 years.

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Francisca uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Francisca will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of assorted smoked fish and palm fruits for the palm oil production, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Francisca plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted smoked fish and palm fruits for palm oil production.

loans.name: Leslie Jocelin

texts.es:
Leslie Jocelin tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser hospitalaria, elaboración de platillos que se puedend encontrar en los restaurants de la zona, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores patos, gallinas, pavos, desde hace que se caso para contribuir con los gastos familiares, su esposo brinda servicio de jornalearía.

Leslie ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una yunta, para poder alquilarlo para el servicio de arado ya que esta próximo la campaña agrícola, preparando los terrenos para cultivos y así mismo generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Leslie Jocelin, 25, lives with her husband in the District of Oyotun where the people in her town work in agriculture, commerce and livestock breeding. It’s a community known for its hospitality, and local dishes which can be found in restaurants in the area; located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals such as ducks, chickens, and turkeys and has been doing this since she got married in order to contribute to the household expenses. Her husband is a day labourer.

Leslie has requested a loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to purchase a yoke, to be able to rent it out for ploughing since she is close to agricultural fields, preparing the lands for planting and thus generating a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a yoke.

loans.name: Fetaiai

texts.en: Fetaiai is a a 43-year-old single woman with seven children. She runs a business tailoring clothes in her community. She has three years of experience in this business. Fetaiai has requested a loan to buy needles, thread, material and a sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to not only expand her business, but to support her family and her children's education as well. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, needles, and a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a very capable and hardworking woman. She is 29 years old, married and has only one daughter. She lives with her husband in their own kachha house (mud and straw-made). She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband is 35 years old. He is also illiterate and can only sign his name. He is a mason by profession. Their daughter is only two years old. They are from the small village of Nirendrapur in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Her husband's earning is very low to meet all the needs of the family. Basanti decided to start a new business of potato cultivation.

Basanti learned about BJS and applied for a loan to buy the agricultural supplies needed for potato cultivation, like potato seeds, fertilizer, manure, etc. Her goal is to grow potatoes on a large scale and sell them in the local market, as potatoes are in great demand in that area. 

She dreams to give good financial support to her family, give her daughter a good education and buy another piece of land with the profit from her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like potato seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc. to start a potato cultivation business.

loans.name: Anatolia Blanca

texts.es:
Anatolia es una cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Mi nombre es Anatolia tengo 57 años, inicie hace 9 años vendiendo frituras y chicharrones preparados, posteriormente me dedique a la venta de banderillas de salchicha, queso y mixtas, así como hotdogs. Tengo 4 hijos que ya son independientes y me ayudan. Me considero una persona responsable y siempre he pagado mis créditos a tiempo. Mi principal logro es haber sacado a mis 4 hijos adelante. Estoy solicitando el préstamo para comprar materias primas para mi negocio lo que me permitirá vender más.
texts.en:
Anatolia is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

“My name is Anatolia and I am 57 years old. Nine years ago I started selling prepared fried foods and chicharrones [pork rinds or cracklings]. Later I started selling sausage, cheese and mixed corndogs, as well as hotdogs. I have four children who are now independent who help me. I consider myself to be a responsible person and I have always paid my loans on time. My principal achievement is to have provided for my four children. I am requesting this loan to buy ingredients for my business so that I can sell more.”

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.en:
Dovi is a small scale charcoal processor and seller in Ve-deme (near Hohoe). He has had some formal education, as he is a senior high school graduate. He is married and has two children. His wife operates a printing press. 

Dovi has been working as a charcoal seller for close to five years. His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

He plans on using his loan to purchase an increased quantity of woods for burning more charcoal, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demands. 

He hopes to use the profits from his enterprise to develop his business further, also putting some into his farming, and ensuring that all his children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Sena

texts.en:
Sena is a small scale petty trader in Ve-deme (near Hohoe). She has had some formal education, as she is a senior high school graduate. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Sena has been working as a petty trader for close to 16 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of canned tomatoes, canned fish, a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, bread, and gari, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. 

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a wooden stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned tomatoes, canned fish, a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, bread, and gari

loans.name: Alejandro De Jesús

texts.es:
Alejandro nació hace 33 años en el seno de una familia campesina muy humilde que se dedicaban a trabajar como jornaleros para adquirir el sustento diario, desde pequeño le enseñaron las labores del campo y cuando creció trabajaba con sus padres recolectando café, un tiempo después aprendió el oficio de reciclador al lado de un tío que lo involucró en la labor. Cuando tuvo la oportunidad de independizarse, montó su propia bodega en la que trabaja todos los días de 7 am a 7 pm, recolectando los artículos por las diferentes calles de la ciudad y luego lo revende como reciclaje, así genera los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia.
El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de chatarra, hierro y equipo de oficina (archivo), esto le permitirá capitalizar su negocio y luego revender a mejor precio; logrando un mayor nivel de utilidades.
Alejandro vive el día a día motivado por las ganas de salir adelante y poder seguir velando por el bienestar familiar, pues su propósito es progresar en compañía de su esposa y poder disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Thirty-three years ago, Alejandro was born into the bosom of a very modest rural family.  They made their living as day laborers to support themselves.  They taught Alejandro farm work as a young boy and when he grew, he harvested coffee with his parents.  A while later, he learned the trade of "recycler" from an  uncle, who got him into the work.  When Alejandro had the chance to go out on his own, he opened a small store, where he works every day from 7:00am to 7:00pm.  He collects items from different streets in the city and then re-sells them as recycled goods to generate the income he needs to support his family. 
The loan that Alejandro is requesting is for investing in the purchase of scrap metal, iron and office equipment (filing items).  This will allow him to capitalize on his business and later re-sell at a better price, which will give him a better profit. 
Alejandro lives day to day motivated by his desire to get ahead and to see to his family's well-bring.  His goal is to progress alongside his wife and be able to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal, iron and office equipment (filing items).

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is 45 years old, female, and married. She has 8 children, 25, 23, 21,18,16,14,12 and 9, that she supports. 

Dama runs a grocery business, which she has had for a year and a half. She earns a monthly income of ksh.6,900. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer.   

She is taking a second loan from Kadet of ksh.10,000, which she intends to use to buy more vegetables: tomatoes, potatoes, brinjals, mangos and carrots. 

Her previous loan of ksh.10,000 was paid back to KADET successfully. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by making it a wholesale business. 

Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open another grocery business, and to also make sure her children get a better education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 26 years old. She is a female, married, and has one child aged 3 and half years old, whom she supports. 

She has a nursery school which has lasted for four years now located at Timboni and earns a monthly income of KES 8,550.She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET staff and she is a taking her first loan from KADET of KES 15,000 which she intends to use in renovating the school.

Also, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her school. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open a primary school and educate her children.

loans.use: To renovate the school.

loans.name: Eliud's Group

texts.en:
Eliud is a member of this group in Webuye District.  He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of seventy individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Eliud has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seeds for one quarter acre of maize and one quarter acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Eliud is 47 years old and has been a farmer for eleven years. Eliud works as a farmer to provide for his five children.  The community and other farmers know Eliud as hardworking and trustworthy. Other than farming, he is also involved in groups in his community, such as the men's group, savings group, and burial committee.  Eliud described his harvest last year as excellent, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.	

Eliud joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Eliud joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices and get new farming methods. Eliud has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Eliud's life because he has more profits from harvest and was able to feed the family.  In the future, Eliud hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and save for the future.  	

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Eliud and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.		

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca’s group has six group leader farmers and is located in Webuye District.  The group leaders in this group represent a total of 78 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for one quarter acre of maize and one quarter acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Rebecca is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised.	
						
Rebecca is 31 years old and has been a farmer for 15 years.  Rebecca works as a farmer to provide for her three children.  The community and other farmers know Rebecca as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Rebecca described her harvest last year as excellent, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.	

Rebecca joined One Acre Fund in 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Rebecca joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family and send children to school.  Because she likes being a leader and an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Rebecca has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Rebecca's life because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and feed the family.  In the future, Rebecca hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and a goat, and invest in a business.  

Rebecca and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rider

texts.es:
