Rider vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, trabaja como obrero para una pequeña empresa ladrillera de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante sobre todo porque es padre de un pequeño de 10 años de edad, al cual quiere mucho.

Rider gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva podrá comprar materiales como madera, clavos, entre otros para realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que debido a las lluvias el techo se encuentra en mal estado, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Rider lives in the city of Pucallpa. He works in a small company in his city that makes bricks. He uses his income to provide for his 10-year-old son, whom he loves very much.

Rider is thankful for the support of Kiva lenders. He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as wood and nails, among others, to make some improvements to his home, the roof of which is in bad condition because of the rains. He hopes to improve his living conditions and continue working toward making his greatest dream a reality: “to build a house made of solid materials like brick or stone”.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood and nails.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 42-year-old married female.  She has four (4) children that are 21, 19, 14 and 12-years-old, whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and she has a cafe. She has been in this business for seven years which is located at Timboni.  In her business she earns a monthly income of 6990 KES. She is taking her first loan of 10,000 KES which she intends to use it to add stock to her business by buying wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.  Christine will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and also educate her children.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil to make food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Mary did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of having a better life. Currently, she sells clothes and baby products at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. 

She displays her goods in a round bowl, and walks distances in order to make sales. She has been involved in this enterprise for some years now. Mary is married to an electrician and has four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Mary has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. 

She aims to use her loan to purchase more clothes and baby diapers, pomade, lotions, etc to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty, and also get a fixed location for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and baby diapers, pomade, lotions, etc to sell.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
This is the fourth loan from IMON. Barno is a hardworking woman. She is married to Hasan. She has two children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Barno sells children's clothes in a local market. She buys goods from a central market and then sales in a local market. She dreams of having her own shop. She is going to buy children's clothes for the new winter season but does not have money. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy children's clothes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Even though Beatrice grew up in poverty without an education, yet this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life. She sells provisions at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. Her business has grown substantially since she began seven years ago. 

Beatrice is married to a contractor and has four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Beatrice wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of her provisions (milk, tinned tomatoes, energy drinks, etc.).  

In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of provisions like milk, tinned tomatoes, energy drinks, etc

loans.name: Shakuul

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Shakuul did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming a trader. Currently, she sells provisions and cooking ingredients at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. She is married and has three children. Her husband works at the university of Cape Coast. Her income normally goes towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. Shakuul aims to use her loan to purchase more provisions like toothpaste, Milo, biscuits and other items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Shakuul wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions like toothpaste, Milo, biscuits and other items for resale.

loans.name: Marygorety's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers in Kakamega North District.  Marygorety has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative, and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 69 other individual farmers represented by this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Marygorety is married and has eight children.  She is 60 years old, and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, and trustworthy.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, savings group, and the prayer group.  Marygorety has been a farmer for 32 years.  She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

Marygorety first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Marygorety joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers.  

Marygorety plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, save for the future, and buy a cow.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Marygorety’s own life was improved because she has more farm training, was able to save money and feed the family.  							

Marygorety and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  

Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Orata's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers in Webuye District with Orata selected as the Kiva representative.  Orata has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 88 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Orata is 55 years old, and he has been a farmer for 27 years.  Orata works as a farmer to provide for his seven children.  The community and other farmers know Orata as friendly and as an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community such as the men's group and the burial committee.  

Orata described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Orata first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers.  

Orata plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school and to invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Orata’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Orata and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 30 years old, female, and married. She has 3 children, ages 15, 10, and 7 who she supports. 

She was introduced to Kadet Ltd by a Kadet officer, and she is a fish monger. She has been in this business for six years; it is located at Kibaoni. In her business, she earns a monthly income of ksh.3,000. 

She is taking her first loan of ksh.10,000, which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying more fish. 

Eunice will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Angaza Group in Kakamega North District.  She is pictured here in a group of nine One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 90 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  

Nancy has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet or sorghum cultivation.							

Nancy is married and has four children.  She is 45 years old, and is known as reliable and trustworthy.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group.  Nancy has been a farmer for 15 years.  Nancy believes she can have an even better harvest this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Nancy first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Nancy joined One Acre Fund to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Nancy plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school and save for the future.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.

Nancy and the Angaza Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  

Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.	
.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a member of this group in Chwele District.  She is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 83 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Margaret has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Margaret is married and has five children.  She is 42 years old, and is known as hardworking, reliable, and trustworthy. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group.  Margaret has been a farmer for 20 years.  Shet described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Margaret joined One Acre Fund to get new farming methods.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member.  Margaret plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, buy a cow, and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Margaret’s own life was improved because she was able to save money and feed the family.

Margaret and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 28 years old and married.She has two children, 13 and 8 years old, whom she supports.

She is a fishmonger, and she was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer. She has been in this business for 12 years. In her business, which is located at Kibaon, she earns a monthly income of KES 4,050. 

She is taking her first loan of KES10,000, which she intends to use in adding stock to her business by buying more fish.

Joyce will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to expand and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Santos Gabino

texts.es:
Santos, es una persona que se dedica a su familia y busca su bienestar, vive junto a su esposa y uno de sus hijos, para generar los ingresos y cubrir los gastos familiares se dedica a atender una tienda y a la ganadería, tiene mucho tiempo desempeñado estas actividades con el cual tiene la suficiente experiencia para mantenerlas activas.
Invertirá en insumos para la tienda y alimento para el ganado, entre los insumos podemos mencionar azúcar, bebidas, golosinas, pan,  especias, etc., con lo que sus clientes encontraran una variedad de opciones para comprar, espera aumentar el número de clientes, tener un negocio más competitivo, así como aumentar sus ganancias.
Sueña con tener los recursos necesarios que le permitan darle a su hijo una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Santos is a person who is dedicated to his family and who works for its well-being. He lives with his wife and one of his children. In order to make a living and cover family expenses he runs a store and raises cattle. He has had these businesses for a long time and is experienced in managing them,.

He will invest the funds in his store and in feed for his cattle. The supplies he will purchase include sugar, drinks, sweets, bread, spices, etc. so that his customers will have a variety of options when they shop. He hopes to expand his customer base and make his business more competitive so that he can increase profits. He dreams of having the resources necessary to give his son a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his store and feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Mary is a petty trader. She specializes in selling cooking ingredients at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for almost 10 years.  She is married to a mason and has two children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients like garden eggs, salt, garlic, etc. 

In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands at all costs.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients like garden eggs, salt, garlic, etc

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married to a university laborer, and together they have four children. 

Currently, she sells charcoal in sacks at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. 

Abena’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses as well as their children’s school fees. 

She will use the loan to increase her existing charcoal in large capacity. 

With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Abena plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive junto a su esposo y su madre, es una persona que de muy temprana edad ha tenido que trabajara para salir adelante, se dedica a atender una tienda de artículos de consumo y a sembrar granos básicos, su horario de atención es de 6:00 a.m. hasta 7: 00 p.m., es poyada por su esposo, su ventaja es que la tienda la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, ya posee 15 años de experiencia.
Con la inversión pagara mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha y el resto lo invertirá en comprar productos como bebidas, golosinas, frijol, jabón, etc., con lo que tendrá la cosecha lista para procesarla en menor tiempo y por lo consiguiente su negocio estará surtido con productos que sus clientes necesitan, espera aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para mejorar su economía y mejorar las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
María is married and lives with her husband and mother. She has had to work from a very early age to get ahead. She has a store from which she sells food and household items. She also grows basic grains. She opens her store from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. Her husband helps her, and she says it is an advantage that the store is located in her home. She now has 15 years of experience with this business.

María is requesting a loan to pay for the labor to harvest her crops, and she will use the rest to buy merchandise such as drinks, candies, beans, ham and others. She hopes to have her crops ready to process in less time, and to have her store stocked with products her customers need. She would like to increase her sales and improve her income.

María’s dream is to continue working to improve her family’s finances and quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to harvest her crops of basic grains, and to buy merchandise for her store, such as drinks, candies, beans, ham and others.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban tiene 49 años y es casado con 2 hijos que son un varón de 15 años y una mujer de 12 años, él se dedica a la venta de verduras, legumbres y tubérculos al por mayor, en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de el alto, el vive en la zona de Topater,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Esteban va a usar este préstamo en la adquisición de un puesto de venta en la feria de la zona de Villa Dolores, donde venderá junto a su esposa su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la oportunidad que se le presenta ya que esto le permitirá tener un puesto fijo, el señor Esteban enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el cliente vende en ferias, lo que implica un constante traslado de mercadería y gasto monetario en transporte,  va a utilizar los beneficios en la  comprará de mercadería para surtir su negocio, para la venta de sus productos. Su deseo para su negocio es  mejorar sus ingresos para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Esteban is 49 years old, married, and has two children; a 15 year old son and 12 year old daughter.  He sells vegetables, beans, and tubers in quantity, at various fairs around town.  He lives in the Topater area and this is his first sequence within the institution.  Esteban will use the money from this loan to buy a stall in the Villa Dolores fair, where he and his wife will make sales.  His reason for this loan is because he has the opportunity to have a fixed stall.

Estaban has challenges in his business.  His selling in fairs requires constant transportation of merchandise, which is an expense.  He will use his benefits to buy merchandise to stock his business.  His desire for his business is to improve his income so he can offer a better quality of life to his wife and children.

loans.use: to pay for a stall.

loans.name: Dipti

texts.en:
Dipti is 27 years old, married and a mother of four children (two sons and two daughters). She studied until grade 4. Two of her children are going to school, and they are in grade 10 and grade 1 respectively. One son is in college, and the other is engaged in a wood supply business.

Dipti's husband, Niren, is 48 years old and is a farmer by profession. They have their own house in the small village of Mouyamari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Dipti is a housewife. She helps her husband in his agricultural activities. But the agribusiness is not going well, and the income is hardly sufficient to maintain all the necessities of such a big family.

Due to the lack of capital, they are unable to grow new crops in their field. Then Dipti came to know about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and has taken a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start a business of potato cultivation.

Dipti is a hardworking and sincere woman. She is very optimistic, too. She hopes that her initiative will be lucrative and will raise family funds, with which she will be able to meet all the financial needs of her family and give her children higher education.

She aspires to purchase a plot of land in the future with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Athanas' Group

texts.en:
Burudika is a group of six group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Athanas selected as the Kiva representative.  Athanas has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 61 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Athanas is 53 years old, and he has been a farmer for 16 years.  Athanas works as a farmer to provide for his five children.  The community and other farmers know Athanas as friendly and hard-working.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community such as the prayer group and burial committee.  

Athanas described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.							

Athanas first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Athanas joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member.  

Athanas plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to save for the future.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Athanas’s own life was improved because he has more farm training and was able to save money.  						

Athanas and the Burudika Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gabriella

texts.ru:
Габриэлла — из Виноградово. Она торгует одеждой секонд-хэнд. Работает сама, без помощников. Торговую точку пока арендует, занимаясь такого рода торговлей уже 6 лет, с тех пор как родители помогли ей открыть свое дело. Габриэлла — замужем, у нее двое детей. Одно из самых любимых занятий Габриэллы — это выращивать цветы. 
Габриэлла давно мечтала сделать ремонт в доме, а именно в ванной и кухне. Суммы в 24 000 гривен ей хватит для того, чтобы воплотить это в жизнь.
texts.en: Gabriella is from Vinogradovo.  She sells second-hand clothing.  She works alone, without helpers.  She leases her retail outlet for now and has been involved in this type of retail business for 6 years since her parents helped her to open her own business.  Gabriella is married and has two children.  One of Gabriella's favorite hobbies is to grow flowers.  Gabriella has been dreaming to make repairs at home, especially in the bathroom and kitchen, for a long time.  The sum of 24,000 hryvnia will be enough to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to remodel her bathroom and kitchen

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья торгует на одном из базаров своего городка Першотравенска. Она реализует садово-огородные товары. Начала заниматься этим бизнесом более 8 лет тому назад. На данный момент 1 торговая точку у нее выкуплена, еще 2 — пока в аренде. У Натальи есть  муж и сын-подросток. 
Так как уже половина зимы практически прошла, да и весна в Украине обещает быть ранней, Наталья начинает заранее планировать и готовиться к предстоящему весеннему посевному сезону. Для этого она хочет закупить сезонный товар на сумму в 40 000 гривен, а именно, приобрести семена оптом у компании «Семена Украины», ядохимикаты на оптовых базах Днепропетровска и Харькова, глиняные горшки для цветов, а также комнатные цветы.
texts.en: Natalya sells at the one of the markets of her town of Pershotravensk.  She sells gardening products.  She got involved in this business over 8 years ago.  At the present time, one of her retail outlets has been bought out and two are still under leases.  Natalya has a husband and a teenage son.  Because half of the winter has practically passed, and the spring in the Ukraine promises to come early, Natalya is starting to plan ahead and prepare for the upcoming spring sowing season.  She wants to purchase seasonal goods for this in the amount of 40,000 hryvnia.  She specifically wants to purchase seeds wholesale from the "Ukraine Seeds" company, pesticides from wholesale markets of Dnepropetrovsk and Kharkov, clay pots for flowers and also indoor flowers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides, clay pots for flowers and also indoor flowers

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.en:
Jacqline, who is in her late 20s, is married and has two kids who are in school. For nine years now, Jacqline has had a beauty salon. With this business, Jacqline is able to earn a good monthly profit by opening her business from 8am to 8pm. 

This will be her 10th loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to improve her business by purchasing new equipment.  She also sells beauty products in her salon. 

Jacqline has paid back all her loans and has used her profit to buy a TV, DVDs, a sofa set and to pay for a digital TV deck. She has paid for her kids' school fees and for home expenses. She will use this loan to starts selling products like shoes, clothes, etc. at the salon.  

She will share this loan with her group "Gold," which has two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling women's products like shoes, clothes, etc. in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Memuna is a business woman. She specializes in selling cosmetics and footwear at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. 

She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a laborer at the University of Cape Coast. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Memuna wants to use her loan to buy more cosmetics like hair pomade, body creams, spray, footwear, etc. in large quantities. Memuna plans to reinvest the future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics like hair pomade, body creams, spray, footwear, etc. in large quantities.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas sells charcoal at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. She is married to a painter, and they have five children. Her income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Dorcas will use the loan to purchase large quantities of charcoal. 

As a junior high school graduate, Dorcas understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her children remain in school and have a better future in order to avoid poverty.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hazera

texts.en:
Hazera is a 49-year-old rural housewife. She lives with her husband, Sahiruddin, aged 58 years, and two sons in their own semi-pacca house (brick-built but with thatch roof), in the small village of Madhya Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Both the husband and wife are illiterate and can only sign their names. One of their sons reads in class XI (grade 11). The other is a mason.

Hazera's husband is engaged in agriculture on their own land. He has been growing different kinds of seasonal vegetables there. He sells the crops to their customers, such as grocery stores, vegetable vendors and others. 
  
Hazera is a dynamic, active and energetic woman. She has extended her helping hands to her husband. Now they decided to grow potatoes in their field. She has chosen this business, as there is a great demand for potatoes in the present market, and it is a staple vegetable for the local people. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start to grow this crop.

Her future plans include the financial upgrade of her family, good education and a good future for their children and modernizing her cultivation business, thereby improving the quality and amount of her harvest. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is 35 years old and a mother of a daughter who is attending a local secondary school and reads in class VIII (grade 8). Jayanti lives with her daughter and husband. Her husband is a farmer who grows potatoes and sells them to the local market.  Jayanti is a housewife who helps her husband in his agricultural work. They live in their own small kachha house (mud and straw house) in the small village of Nirendrapur in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

In order to expand their business, Jayanti applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), which will enable her to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate more potatoes. She will sell their crops in the local market. The product is in great demand in the present market. So, she needs to keep the plants protected from diseases and other factors in order to make a good profit at the end of the harvest.

Jayanti's future plans are to expand her potato crops further by buying more land and to give financial sustenance to her family. She dreams of giving her daughter the opportunity to have a good education.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 51 years old. He lives in Nanyuki with his family. He is married and has one child. 

He has been a farmer for more than five years. His business has really grown over the years, and now he has two employees. He learned of Milango through friends, and he decided to join so that he can access funding for his business. He now seeks a loan to buy a water pump and a diesel generator. 

He hopes that in the next five years he will be able to buy rental houses that will generate additional income for his business. 

The major challenge he has been facing on the farm is the lack of insecticides. The income that he will raise will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and a diesel generator.

loans.name: Toaga

texts.en:
Toaga is a 35-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows yams and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 5 years.

Toaga has requested a loan to buy a weedsprayer, a wheelbarrow, a bag of fertilizer, chemicals, and bush knives. She has been a member of SBPD since December of 2013. With her profits, Toaga hopes to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a weedsprayer, a wheelbarrow, a bag of fertilizer, chemicals, and bush knives.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señorita Elizabeth tiene 23 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  magisterio en biología y química, trabaja para pagar sus estudios se dedica a ayudar a su mama en el negocio de elaboración y venta de comida, estudia en la institución educativa   instituto normal superior catolico “sedes sapientiae” este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Elizabeth va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo pagar las mensualidades correspondientes a este semestre para terminar sus estudios. que durara el tiempo 4 años, La Señorita Elizabeth enfrenta retos en su estudios que son mucha competencia en el campo laboral. vive en la zona  porvenir, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es tener un lugar de trabajo estable para poder desempeñarse como profesional.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 23 years old, single, and is studying for a master’s degree in biology and chemistry.  She works to pay for her education and helps her mother with making and selling food.  She attends the “Sedes Sapientiae” Catholic institution of higher education.  This will be her first loan through the institution and Elizabeth will use it to pay various expenses such as tuition for this semester so she can finish her studies which take four years.

Elizabeth has challenges with her studies, such as lots of competition in her field.  She lives in the Porvenir area and she wants to have a stable work area so she can work as a professional.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Blanca Agustina

texts.es: La señora blanca, es madre soltera, labora para un hospital como responsable de equipos, ella tiene bajo su cargo a su pequeña nieta de edad escolar, doña Blanca desea aprovechar un espacio disponible que tiene en su terreno para realizar un cuarto, para tener mayor comodidad junto a su familia, el crédito lo solicita para comprar los materiales como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, laminas de zinc y perlines para empezar la construcción de cuarto, gracias a este financiamiento doña Blanca podrá realizar esta mejora en su hogar ya que con su salario le será más difícil, porque tendría que pagarlo de un solo y no le es rentable.
texts.en: Blanca is a single mother and she maintains equipment in a hospital.  She has a young, school-aged granddaughter.  Blanca wants to take advantage of available area on her land to build a room so she and her family can be more comfortable.  She will use the money from this loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand, iron bars, cinder blocks, zinc metal sheeting, and beams so she can begin construction.  Thanks to this loan, Blanca will be able to improve her home, since it will be more difficult to do on her salary because she would have to pay for it all at once and she can’t afford it.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Verónica, tiene 20 años de edad está acompañada, tiene una niña de 3 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida, su hija y su mamá, trabaja sin cesar para llevar los ingresos con los cuales aporto con los gastos de su hogar, se dedica a vender ropa y artículos para el hogar de forma ambulante, es un oficio que tiene 3 años realizándolo y lo aprendió por cuenta propia, no tiene un horario establecido.
Invertirá en la compra de variedad de ropa y artículos para el hogar, con lo que surtirá el inventario con estilos, tallas, colores diferentes de ropa, también variara los tamaños y estilos de ollas, sartenes, cucharas, con lo que en estas fechas que hay más demandas su negocio responda a las necesidades de sus clientes, espera aumentar ventas y tener una economía mucho más solida para cancelar sus deudas y dar a su familia el apoyo económico que necesitan para salir adelante.
Su sueño es con seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para tener una situación economía mejor.
texts.en:
Verónica, 20, is married and the mother of a 3-year old daughter.  She lives with her husband, daughter and mother.  Verónica, a street vendor, sells clothing and household goods.  She works morning, noon and night to earn the money she needs to support her family.  She started the business 3 years ago, without any training and learning as she went along.  
Verónica will use this loan to stock her business.  She will buy a range of clothing of various styles and sizes and different sizes and types of pots, pans, tableware and other household goods.  Demand for products like those she will buy is especially high this time of year and she wants products that will appeal to her customers.  She expects the investment to lead to increased sales and enough income to both repay the loan and better provide for her family.
Verónica hopes that she will be able to grow her business and establish a solid economic base for her family.

loans.use: to stock her clothing- and household-goods-sales business.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel is a member of Imara Group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured here with some One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent 64 One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured. Daniel has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and has his hand raised in the photo. He and the other farmers each receive ¼ acre of maize, ¼ acre of sorghum or millet, and an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Daniel is married and has six children. He is 61 years old and is friendly, trustworthy, and active in his community. Daniel has been a farmer for 35 years. He described his harvest as poor last year but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with the One Acre Fund.  							

Daniel first enrolled in the One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Daniel joined to learn new farming methods. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to spread the word about the One Acre Fund. Daniel plans to use the money he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has many benefits. Daniel’s own life was improved because he has more farm training.  		

Daniel and the Imara Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of buying the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the savings on to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they repay the One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a true renaissance man. An experienced artist, sculptor, musician, and chef, he made a living most of his life as a musician playing at events and as a street performer. He supplemented his income working part-time at a local grocery store. 

Everything changed when an illness prevented Carlos from performing music and he had to leave his job. Not allowing his circumstances to dictate his life, Carlos utilized his artistic talents to start a street vendor business selling his artistic creations.   

He is currently making and selling ants, iguanas, and other "creepy crawlers” made out of river rock and wrapped with thin iron rods. Carlos has been selling his pieces of art since August at Seaport Village, a high traffic tourist area in San Diego. What Carlos appreciates most about his business is that he gets to use his artistic abilities to make money, while not incurring any overhead. 

The materials Carlos uses for his current products are heavy and he has to go to his brother's workshop in Tijuana to get them. Transporting this raw material is particularly taxing for him considering is age and health.  He is therefore seeking a $2,000 loan to purchase equipment and materials to change his product line from the metal and rock creepy crawlers to customizable small wooden ships with leather accents. 

His ultimate goal is to continue to save money from his street vending business so he can open a mobile food vending business. This will allow him to make the most of his degree in culinary arts and maximize his passion for healthy food.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and materials to create a new product line.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo  se dedica al servicio de la construccion como contra-maestro que pasara un contratista de construccion. 
El vive en casa propia, ubicada en El Alto en la z/ Alto Chijini del Departamento de La Paz a unos diez minutos de distancia  del centro de la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Pablo Policarpio es, comprar herramientas nuevas de trabajo, como palas, picotas,niveladora, que le es de mucha necesidad para mejorar su  trabajo, asi poder brindar un buen servicio.

Es la novena vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la sexta vez con KIVA.Es clienbte antiguo con buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Pablo works in construction.  He lives in a home of his own, located in El Alto, in the Alto Chijini zone of the La Paz department, ten minutes from the city of La Paz.

Pablo Policarpio want to buy new work tools, such as shovels, picks, and planers that he needs to do a better job and provide better service. 

This will be his ninth loan through IMPRO and his sixth through Kiva.  He is a previous customer with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Silviya

texts.ru:
Со времени получения предыдущей суммы от КИВА в семье Сильвии произошло большое горе — у нее умер муж. Она осталась с 6 детьми, двое дочерей вышли замуж. Несмотря на то, что после смерти мужа финансово семье было непросто, Сильвия справилась с финансовыми обязательствами и отдала деньги. 
Сумму в 10 000 гривен в этот раз Сильвия хотела бы вложить в закупку партии овощей и фруктов для последующей реализации. Разнообразие ассортимента товара поможет привлечь больше клиентов и увеличить размеры выручки.
texts.en:
At the time of receiving her previous loan from Kiva, Silviya's family was grieving - her husband died. She was left with 6 children, of which two daughters were married. Despite that after the death of her husband, the family's financial situation was difficult, Silviya dealt with her financial obligations and paid back the money. 

Silviya would like to invest the sum of 10,000 hryvnia from this loan to purchase fruit and vegetables to subsequently sell. Diversity in the product range will help attract more customers and increase the revenue.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали 47 летний житель района Бохтар. Он примерный семьянин и женатый мужчина. На сегодняшний день Сафарали является безработным. Он не хочет сидеть сложа руки, и решился начать свою деятельность. Сафарали планирует на деньги от кредита купить мотороллер для предоставления услуги по перевозке не больших грузов и товаров. Он будет брать пять заказов в день. Сафарали строить планы с надеждой на поддержку. Он не привык отступать и когда Сафарали  остался без работы. Он решил создать работу себе. Сафарали ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
Safarali is a 47 years old resident of the Bohtar region. His is married and an exemplary family man. Currently Safarali is unemployed. He would not like to sit idly and decided to start his own business. 

Safarali plans to purchase a scooter with the money from the loan, and provide a transportation service for goods and cargo. He will take five orders per day. Safarali has made plans with the hope of support. He is not accustomed to draw back and when Safarali was left without work he decided to create his own work. Safarali waits for support.

loans.use: to purchase a scooter in order to provide a transport service for goods and cargo

loans.name: Bozor

texts.ru: Этого мужчину зовут Бозор. Он из деревни района Яван. Бозор женатый мужчина и отец. Бозор всю свою жизнь жил честно. Кормил семью честно нажитым трудом. Сейчас он остался без работы, и отсутствует источника дохода. Бозор не собирается отступать и сдаваться, он решил начать собственный бизнес в сфере животноводства. Бозор планирует выращивать крупно рогатых скотов у себя дома. У него имеется коровник. Бозор рассчитал все, он приобретет скотов из скотного рынка "Панджшанбе" района Яван, после длительного откорма продаст скотов с наценкой. Такой бизнес прибыльный и начать такую деятельность требуется не мало средств. Бозор не имеет достаточную сумму денег и поэтому он просит ему помочь. На деньги от кредита он приобретет скотов и начнет бизнес и у его семьи снова появиться источник дохода.
texts.en: This man's name is Bozor.  He is from a village in the Yavan district.  Bozor is a married man and father.  Bozor lived his whole life honestly.  He fed his family with honestly earned work.  Now he was left without work, and his source of income is gone.  Bozor is not planning to retreat and give up; he decided to start his own business in animal husbandry.  Bozor plans to raise cattle at home.  He has a cowshed.  Bozor planned everything out.  He will buy livestock from the "Pandjshbe" market in the Yavan district and resell it with a markup after a long feeding period.  This business is profitable and requires a lot of means to start it.  Bozor does not have a sufficient amount of money and this is why he is asking for help.  He will use this loan to buy livestock and start the business, and his family will once again have a source of income.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start his own business

loans.name: Vaofua

texts.en:
Vaofua is a single 19-year-old lady. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Vaofua needs a loan to buy bananas, plastic bags, oil, pot, fryer, and containers. 

She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. Vaofua has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bananas, plastic bags, oil, pot, fryer, and containers

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer pujante y carismática, madre de 3 hijos y cabeza de hogar luego de haberse separado de su esposo.
Hace muchos años inició su propio negocio, motivada por la necesidad de generar recursos para dar alimento a sus hijos, inició un pequeño taller de confección en su casa, prestando el servicio a terceros, luego comenzó a confeccionar sus propios diseños y a venderlos entre sus vecinos y amigos. Con el paso del tiempo pudo adquirir un módulo en el centro de la ciudad, donde puso su negocio, allí trabaja de lunes a sábado de 9 am a 6 pm y los domingos se dedica a confeccionar.
El crédito solicitado es un apoyo para acreditar mejor su negocio, con el dinero comprará ropa ya confeccionada como jeans, bermudas, camisetas, entre otros, ya que por la época decembrina y la escolar el negocio requiere toda su atención debido al aumento de las ventas.
Ana sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su negocio de confección de línea propia y mejorar el ingreso de dinero a la economía de la familia, pues desea seguir apoyando a sus hijos menores brindándoles educación y ofreciéndoles un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Ana is a vigorous and charismatic women, the mother of 3 children and head of her household, since separating from her husband.

Some years ago, she began her own business, motivated by the necessity of generating resources to provide food for her children. She opened a small sewing shop in her home to offer her services to others. Later, she began making clothes of her own design, selling them among her neighbors and friends. With the passage of time, she acquired a location in the city center where she established her business. Here she works from Monday to Saturday, from 9:00 am until 6:00 pm, and her Sundays she dedicates to dressmaking. 

The loan Ana is soliciting is intended to help elevate her business. With this money, Ana will purchase ready-made clothing such as jeans, Bermuda shorts, and t-shirts, among other items, for the December-school-time season, when the business requires all her attention, due to increased sales.

Ana dreams of continuing to strengthen her dress-making business, producing her own line of clothes, thereby improving family income, so that she can continue helping her minor children and offer them an education as well as greater well-being.

loans.use: buy ready-made clothes such as jeans, Bermuda shorts,  and t-shirts, among other items, to sell.

loans.name: Aydee Maricela

texts.es:
Aydee, estudio hasta segundo grado, pues ella es de escasos recursos económicos y no pudo continuar con sus estudios, ya que en ese tiempo en la escuela de su lugar solo daban hasta segundo grado. Ella está acompañada, su compañero de vida,  se dedica a la agricultura y a aserrar madera, ella vive con con 2 hijos y su esposo en su casa. 

Aydee se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a su padre y ella iba a ayudarle al trabajo a él; Aydee camina 15 minutos desde su casa,  para llegar hasta el lugar de trabajo, también le ayuda su esposo y un hijo, ellos trabajan de 6.30 de la mañana hasta las 12.30 del mediodía.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en malas condiciones, comprara 800 tejas, las cuales le tienen un costo de $200 dólares, cuartones de madera 3 fletes, los cuales le tienen un costo de $240,  comprara 250 varas de tusa que le cuestan $63 y en mano de obra para que le realicen el trabajo, ella cancelara $12 dólares por cada tarea y son 35 tareas.

Desea a futuro tener una vivienda digna, que le permita darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, que les brinde seguridad, salud y protección.
texts.en:
Aydee studied through the second grade but could not continue with her studies due to being low-income and because, at that time, the school only offered up to the second grade. She lives with her partner who makes his living in agriculture and sawing lumber. She lives with her husband and two children at home.

Aydee earns her living through agriculture. She learned this trade from her father as she would help him work. Aydee has a 15 minute walk from home to her workplace. Aydee, her husband, and her son work together from 6:30 am until 12:30 pm. 

The loan she is requesting is to repair the roof of her house that is in poor condition. She bought 800 tiles which retail for $200, three loads of wooden beams that cost $240, 250 poles constructed from corncobs that cost $63, and the cost of labor to do the work. She will pay $12 per task and there are 35 tasks for the laborers to complete.

Aydee wants to have decent housing in the future that allows her to give a better life to her family and to provide them with safety, health, and protection.

loans.use: to purchase materials and pay laborers to repair her roof.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Señora Juana tiene 55 años, ella se dedica  a  la elaboración y venta de quesos, ella vive en la localidad de Cullucachi, este préstamo es primero que tiene con la institución, la Señora Juana va a usar este préstamo para compra de un ganado lechero mejorado para tener una mejor producción de leche,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos, la Señora Juana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida, la Señora Juana va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar sus ingresos, la Señora Juana desea para su negocio crecer en la producción y venta de leche, Ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana, 55, earns her living making and selling cheese. She lives in the town of Cullucachi. This is the first loan she has taken out with the institution. Juana will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow that has been bred to have improved milk production. Her reason for applying for this loan is to improve her income. Juana faces challenges in her business, such as improving her business and her quality of life. Juana will use the profits to improve her income. Juana wants to expand her business in the production and sale of milk. She is a hardworking and enterprising person wanting to move forward and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a widow, and has no children.   Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. She sells smoked fish and gari at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for four years. 

As the sole breadwinner in her family, Leila uses her income to provide for the entire family. Leila will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Leila plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Comfort did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming a petty trader. 

Currently, she prepares and sells cooked rice and vegetable stew at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. She has been in business for twenty years. She is divorced and has five children. Comfort uses all her income to feed and provide for her children. 

She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rice and other ingredients, which will aid her prepare more of her tasty foods and improve her overall sales. Comfort wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of rice and other ingredients, which will aid her prepare more of her tasty foods and improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Although Adwowa grew up in poverty without an education, yet this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life. She sells charcoal at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. She has been in business for almost four years. 

Adwowa is married to a laborer in the University of Cape Coast and they have four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Adwowa wants to use her loan to buy increased amounts of charcoal to be able to increase her sales. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of customer demands.

loans.use: to buy increased amounts of charcoal to be able to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jose Isidro

texts.es:
José, tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas las cuales están estudiando. Para cubrir las necesidades familiares posee una tienda, la cual la instalo en su casa de habitación por cuenta propia, tiene cinco años de poseer su negocio, el horario de atención al público es de 5:30 a.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra de arroz, maíz, frijol, bebidas, tomates, papas, etc., con lo que el inventario de su tienda contara con una variedad de productos que satisfagan la necesidad de sus clientes, espera atraer más clientes, fortalecer su negocio, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía.
Sueña con dar a sus hijas una mejor alimentación, salud, vestuario y una educación superior.
texts.en:
Jose is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters who attend school.  He has a store so that he can cover the household expenses.  He set it up at his house, has been doing this for five years, and it’s open from 5:30 am to 9:00 pm.

He will buy rice, corn, beans, drinks, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.  This will provide him with a variety of products that will satisfy his customers’ needs.  He hopes to attract more customers, strengthen his business, increase his sales, and improve his finances.

He wants his daughters to have better food, health, clothing, and a higher education.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Marina Noemy

texts.es:
Mirna, invertirá en su negocio por lo que nuevamente solicita capital para comprar insumos para la tienda como frijol, arroz, bebidas, dulces, jabón, aceite, etc., de esta manera podrá seguir cubriendo las necesidades de sus clientes.
Con el préstamo que se le facilito antes pudo surtir el inventario de su tienda, logro aumentar sus ventas, atraer nuevos clientes, su economía ha mejorado, ha dado mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Su familia atravesó un momento muy difícil como es el fallecimiento de su padre, pero aun así ha seguido responsablemente cumpliendo con sus compromisos económicos.
texts.en:
Mirna will use this new loan to stock her grocery business with products such as beans, rice, bottled drinks, snacks, soap, cooking oil and other products that her customers come to her to buy.
Mirna used a past loan to stock the grocery and increased her sales as a result.  She picked up new customers, as well, and the investment has improved her family's standard of living.  Mirna's father died recently.  It was a difficult loss for her family, but she has carried on the business and is committed to meeting her economic goals.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, necesita capital para continuar trabajando en su negocio en está ocasión lo utilizara para pagar mano de obra y compra de abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, con lo que podrá preparar el terreno y sembrar sin ningún problema.
Con el crédito anterior aumento su producción, sus ventas aumentaron, las ganancias son mejores con las cuales cancelo sus cuotas y sigue cubriendo los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Luis is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for labor and supplies for his farming business.  The fertilizer, insecticides, etc. that he will buy will ensure that his next planting is a success.
Luis used his last loan to increase his production.  The investment led to increased sales and the extra income he made was enough to cover payments on the loan and a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to pay for labor and supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Michael is a member of this group in Webuye District.  He is pictured here in a group of 8 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 89 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Michael has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seed for one quarter acre of maize and seed for one quarter acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Michael is married and has two children.  He is 39 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Michael has been a farmer for 15 years.  Michael described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  							
Michael first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Michael joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds,  earn enough to feed family and  send children to school.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader.  As an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Michael plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Michael’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and feed the family.  							

Michael and his group need a loan to cover for the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a farmer, and she lives in Nanyuki area in Kenya. She is 43 years old and married, with one child. 

Irene has been in farming for more than five years, and she has made this her business.She also also runs a shop that sells drinks to the locals. The shop has been keeping her busy, as it earns extra income for her family. 

She found Milango through friends, and she seeks a loan to buy farm inputs, like seed and farm tools. 

She hopes that in the next five years she will grow her business into an all-inclusive one, where she will have dairy cattle on her farm. The challenges that she faces in the business include unstable weather and competition for the available market. 

She hopes that the income will improve her standards of living and also pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, like seed and farm tools.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Even though Matilda grew up in poverty without any education,  this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life. She sells charcoal at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. Her business has grown substantially since she began four years ago. 

Matilda is married to a driver, and has four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees.  

Matilda wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of her charcoal.  In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of her charcoal.

loans.name: Hermes Felipe

texts.es: Hermes tiene la edad de 42 años, es padre de tres hijos todos estudiantes, siendo el mayor de 17 años, habita junto a su esposa e hijos en un barrio capitalino, actualmente solo  el trabaja para mantener los gastos del hogar y de la familia, pues a su esposa se le ha hecho difícil encontrar un empleo, pero gracias  al trabajo de taxi y el alquiler de cuartos que realiza Hermes, la familia puede contar con ingresos para los gastos principales. El motivo de este crédito es para comparar materiales como laminas de zinc y realizar mejora en una parte del techo de uno de los cuartos, también necesita cambiar una puerta, la que comprara ya hecha, con estas mejoras desea garantizar la tranquilidad de los inquilinos para mantener sus ingresos mensuales. En un futro Hermes desea invertirle a su unida de taxi para su respectivo mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Hermes is 42 years old and the father of three children who attend school.  The oldest is 17.  [Hermes] lives with his wife and children in a neighborhood in the capital city and he is the only one who works to support the family.  His wife has had a hard time finding a job, but thanks to his work as a taxi driver and the rooms he rents out, the family can count on an income to cover the main expenses.

He will use the money from this loan to buy zinc metal and make repairs to a part of the roof in one of the rooms.  He also needs to replace a door.  He will buy it ready-made.  In this way he can guarantee his renter’s comfort and maintain his monthly income.  In the future, Hermes wants to invest in his taxi to maintain it.

loans.use: to repair a rental unit.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: El señor Wilmer tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel bachillerato y actualmente estudia una carrera técnica. Vive por la zona oeste de la cuidad, no tiene  hijos dependientes de sus ingresos y trabaja con su hermano menor. Su principal actividad  es el servicio de decoración de vehículos, como trabajó desde muy joven, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 9 años, trabaja arduamente de lunes a sábado junto a su hermano para salir adelante.  Su segundo ingreso proviene del servicio de música, ya que toca en un grupo musical de barrio desde hace 5 años, ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para hacer crecer su actividad y pretende comprar insumos y material para decorar vehículos de todo tipo ya que cuenta con mucha creatividad y talento, así podrá generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Wilmer is 27 years old and single. He completed high school and is now studying at a technical college. He lives in the west of Cochabamba and has no children who depend on his income. Wilmer works with his younger brother. Wilmer decorates vehicles for a living. Having done this since a young age, he now has nine years experience in it. Alongside his brother, he is working hard from Monday to Saturday in order to prosper. Wilmer has a second income - he is a musician and has been playing in a local band for five years. Wilmer has now identified a need to take out a loan in order to expand his business. He intends to use it to buy supplies and materials for decorating all types of vehicles. Wilmer is very creative and talented and so he will be able to earn a higher income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and material for decorating vehicles.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda tiene 45 años, casada con dos hijos que tienen la edad de 10 y 14 años ella trabaja como profesora en uno de los colegios de la localidad de Sacaba, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, La señora Hilda va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que la señora Hilda tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Hilda is 45 years old, married and has two children, aged 14 and 10 years old each. Hilda works as a teacher in one of Sacaba's local schools. This is her first loan with the institution. Hilda will use it to finish work that will give her running water in her home. She currently has only a well but, with this loan, she will have running water for the bathroom, shower and kitchen, making her family's life more comfortable. For various reasons, Hilda does not already have basic services in her home but this will not stop her from installing running water. Hilda is very happy with this loan opportunity, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to finish work that will give her running water in her home.

loans.name: Conchán  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Conchan está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran en diferentes actividades, las mismas que les dan la oportunidad de mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, su principal actividad económica es la crianza de animales y la agricultura, aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar goza de mucha belleza natural y de verdes campos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carmen, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 25, 5 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente,  su segundo hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector, su esposo es de profesión sastre, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Carme se dedica a la costura actividad que la aprendió trabajando desde que tenía 12 años de edad, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, como labora en casa también se dedica a la crianza de pollos, borregos, cuyes y cerdos, cultiva varios productos que son  para el consumo de su casa. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar telas, hilos y alimento para animales. Su meta es arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The "Conchan" loan group has six members - five women and one man - who have different businesses. Their work allows them to maintain financial stability in their home. Their main work is raising animals and agriculture. The members keep up their towns' traditions and cultures They live in the surrounding areas of the Valle parish in Cuenca, an area with a lot of natural beauty and green fields.

One members of this group is 45-year-old Carmen. She is married and has three children, aged 25, 5, and 3 years old each. Her eldest son is married and has his own home; her second son is attending a local school. Carmen's husband is a tailor. The couple owns the house where they live.

Carmen works in dressmaking, a trade she learned from the age of 12 years old. She works from Monday to Saturday but has no fixed timetable. Given that she works at home, she also raises chickens, guinea pigs, lambs and pigs. She grows various items for consumption at home.

This loan will be used to buy threads, material and animal feed. Carmen's goal is to fix her home.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads and animal feed.

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina, estudio hasta octavo grado, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios y se dedicó mejor al cuido de animales domésticos de los cuales ella se gana la vida dignamente. Ella está acompañada actualmente, su esposo trabaja, en la agricultura sembrando granos básicos.

Como antes se mencionaba ella se dedica al cuido de cerdos, para engordarlos y venderlos, ella  aprendió este trabajo; ya que en su adolescencia cuando vivía con sus padres, se dedicaba a este trabajo, este trabajo lo tiene en su casa y también sus hijos cuando llegan de la escuela le ayudan con este trabajo. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para mejorar la vivienda, ella necesita ampliar más su casa, ella comprara 600 tejas que le cuestan 0.25ctvs de dólar  cada uno, 2 fletes de madera que le cuestan $150 los 2  y pagara $500 en mano de obra para que le construyan su casa.

  Ella desea a futuro tener una vivienda digna, que le permita darle buenas condiciones a su familia, que le permitan mejor comodidad, seguridad y salud.
texts.en:
Ernestina studied until the eighth grade, however due to having scant financial resources she was not able to continue her studies, so she began caring for domestic animals as a way to make a decent living. Ernestina now has a husband who works in agriculture sowing staple grain crops. 

As mentioned earlier, Ernestina looks after pigs, fattening them up and then selling them. She learnt this trade when she lived with her parents in her adolescence. She now works at home and her children also help her with this job when they come home from school.

Ernestina is requesting a loan to improve her home. She would like to extend her house, so she will purchase 600 tiles that cost 25 cents each, two shipments of wood which will cost $150 for the two as well as paying for labour costs of $500 to build her home.

In the future Ernestina would like to have a decent home to bring up her family in good conditions which will afford them better comfort, safety and health.

loans.use: to buy 600 tiles, two shipments of wood and pay for the cost of labour to build her home

loans.name: Miryam Soledad

texts.es:
Miryam es una mujer alegre y pujante, entregada a su familia y apasionada por su labor. Durante más de 11 años se ha dedicado a la confección de prendas de línea propia, elaborando diferentes tipos de ropa, especialmente para dama; trabaja de manera independiente desde la comodidad de la vivienda donde vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada a quien le paga por hora laborada y tiene la ventaja de poder ser productiva y pasar más tiempo con su familia.
Su tenacidad y perseverancia la impulsan a buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando con su negocio, por ello solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, cierres, accesorios, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad y colores para ofrecer a sus cliente y así satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades.
Miryam sueña con tener su casa propia y poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida, por ello sigue trabajando arduamente para lograr cumplir sus objetivos y generar la rentabilidad necesaria para poder ahorrar y tener la capacidad de adquirirla en un futuro a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Miryam is a lively and vibrant woman who is devoted to her family and passionate about her work. She has devoted over 11 years to the manufacture of her own line of clothing, producing many types, especially for women. She works independently in the comfort of the home where she lives with her husband and two children.
