She has the support of an employee who she pays an hourly wage so she can be more productive and spend time with her family.
Her tenacity, perseverance, and drive to seek new alternatives that allow her to move forward with her business have brought her to request a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale inputs (fabrics, yarn, fasteners, accessories, and more). This will allow her to have a greater variety and colors to offer her customers and satisfy their diverse tastes and needs. 
Miryam dreams of owning her own home and offering her family a better quality of life and well-being, therefore, she continues to work hard to achieve her goals and generate the profits she needs to save money and acquire her home in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sewing inputs (fabrics, yarn, fasteners, accessories, and more).

loans.name: Rita Mayolinda

texts.es: Rita es una mujer emprendedora, de 42 años de edad. Originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, casada y madre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida variada. Inicio este negocio hace muchos años; anteriormente su mama manejaba este negocio, pero ya es de tercera edad y no pudo seguir trabajando. Rita decide sacar adelante el negocio y mantener la venta de comida. Hoy en día cuenta con un negocio próspero y rentable. Su meta próxima es crecer en su negocio y tener un restaurante. Solicita el crédito para comprar: carbón, carne de res, carne de pollo, queso, repollo, arroz, entre otros, con el fin de ofertar platillos más demandado por su clientela. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá suplir con las necesidades de sus clientes y a crecer sus ventas. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Rita is an enterprising woman. Originally from the city of Boaca, she is married and a mother to one son. Rita is a businesswoman - she sells various types of food. She started the business many years ago. Her mother previously ran it but she is now older and she was unable to continue working. Rita decided to move the business forward and to keep it going after her mother stopped working. Rita now has a prosperous and profitable business. Her next goal is to expand and have a restaurant. She is applying for this loan in order to buy coal, red meat, chicken, cheese, cabbage, rice and more so as to offer more dishes for her customers. Rita thinks that this loan will be of great help as she will be able to fulfil her customers' needs and increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy coal, red meat, chicken, cheese, cabbage, rice and more.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre muy trabajador, como se le conoce en Perú es un mil oficios, ya que trabaja como chofer de transporte e pasajeros, pero los fines de semana trabaja en su parcela agrícola en la cual ha sembrado diversa variedad de cultivos; sus humildes trabajo son la única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Pedro esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar materiales para realizar mejoras en su humilde vivienda, sobre todo porque está lloviendo mucho en su ciudad y su techo se encuentra en mal estado, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a hard-working man.  He's what is known in Peru as a "mil oficios", someone who works at different jobs to make ends meet.  He drives a taxi during the week and farms a small plot of land at weekends.  His work might not sound like much to some, but it provides enough income for him to live on.

Pedro wants Kiva lenders to know that he is grateful for their support and says that he will use this loan to buy building materials for improving his small house.  The rains are hard here and he wants to repair the roof of his house so that he and his family have a safe and decent place to live.

loans.use: para la compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Nelya

texts.ru:
Неля живет в Павлограде. Она занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Неля торгует на местном рынке промышленными товарами. Торговые точки у нее выкупленные, опыт работы около 16 лет. Неля — замужем, у нее есть взрослая дочь. 
Неле нужна сумма в размере 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию полиэтиленовых пакетов, хозяйственных сумок и подарочных наборов под реализацию. Неля прекрасно себя чувствует, работая в этой сфере на рынке. Она открытая, коммуникабельная и целеустремленная, что помогает ей легко налаживать контакт с потенциальными покупателями и строить стабильный бизнес.
texts.en:
Nelya lives in Pavlograd. She has a retail business. Nelya sells varied retail items at the local market. She owns her own sales point and has around 16 years of work experience. Nelya is married and has adult children. 

Nelya needs a loan in the amount of 21,000 hryvnia to purchase plastic bags, shopping bags and gift sets to sell. Nelya is happy working in this type of area at the market. She is open, sociable and purposeful, which helps her establish contact with potential customers and build a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags, shopping bags, gift sets and other inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Corina Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Corina, se dedica a la venta de comida/almuerzos, los cuales vende en su casa de habitación y también por encargos, a través de este pequeño negocio la señora mantiene sus gastos necesarios a diario, así también con el apoyo de su esposo quien es jubilado. Doña Corina está requiriendo realizar la construcción de un muro perimetral de su casa, ya que la zona donde habita es un poco peligrosa por los delincuentes, es por eso que solicita este apoyo de crédito para poder comprar los materiales de construcción y empezar la obra. Gracias a este financiamiento ella podrá realizar esta inversión y pagar en cuotas chiquitas, mejora que es muy necesaria para tener privacidad y sobre todo seguridad en su vivienda.
texts.en: Sra. Corina has a food business.  She makes and sells lunches from a space in her house and her income from the business, along with help from her husband, covers everyday expenses.  Doña Corina lives in a tough neighborhood and wants to build a security wall around her house.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy building materials for the wall and hire workers to build it.  Thanks to this means of finance, she can fund the project and repay the loan in small monthly payments.  She will have more privacy when the wall is finished and, more importantly, her house will be more secure.

loans.use: to buy building supplies for a house improvement project.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.ru:
Алексей занимается укладкой тротуарной плитки в своем родном городе Мелитополе. Вместе с супругой и тремя детьми он живет в собственном доме.  
Алексей намерен использовать финансовую помощь КИВА в размере 24 000 гривен на ремонт кухни в своем доме, который давно был насущным вопросом для его семьи. Он планирует сделать капитальный ремонт в кухне, заменив окна, двери, газовую печь и вытяжку, а также сделать облицовку стен кафелем, поклеить обои и натянуть потолок из гипсокартона. Ремонт стал неотложным так как давно уже ничего не обновлялось и состояние помещения обветшало.
texts.en:
Alexei works with laying paving tiles in his native city of Melitopol. Together with his wife and three children he lives in his own house. Alexei intends to use the financial support from Kiva, in the amount of 24,000 hryvnia, to remodel the kitchen in his house, which has been an urgent issue for him for a long time. 

Alexei plans to do a major overhaul of the kitchen, changing windows, doors, gas stove and hood, and also to install cladding tiles, paste wallpaper and make a plasterboard ceiling. The repair became urgent as nothing has been done for a long time and the state of the room has decayed.

loans.use: to remodel the kitchen in his house

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor is from Meghri city of the Syuniq region. He lives with his wife, one-year-old daughter, and his parents. He is a contractual serviceman in the army and is the only breadwinner of the family.

He is also engaged in beekeeping. Gor’s father assists him greatly in his daily activities related to beekeeping. The honey of the region, where Gor comes from, has a very high demand in the local market. 

Gor is eager to expand his beekeeping business. To reach that goal, he needs a loan of USD 3,000 to buy 30 new beehives. It will help him expand and develop his agribusiness further. 

Gor and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders.  They will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy 30 new beehives

loans.name: Bertha Elena

texts.es:
Bertha es una microempresaria que lleva 15 años de trayectoria como fabricante y comercializadora de arepas, el oficio lo inició con el ánimo de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar y brindar sustento a sus 4 hijos. Trabaja sola todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana, para sacar la producción y luego venderlas en diferentes tiendas y a vecinos del sector.
Su empuje y perseverancia la impulsan a buscar nuevas opciones que le permitan seguir acreditando su negocio, por ello solicita el crédito como apoyo, con el dinero realizará mejoras locativas (ampliación del espacio de trabajo) y comprará insumos al por mayor (maíz y carbón para el asador), esto le permitirá optimizar el espacio y mejorará las condiciones de trabajo, además tendrá disponibilidad de materia prima para seguir produciendo y cumplir con los pedidos de manera oportuna a sus clientes; dando como resultado un incremento en ventas y en las utilidades que su labor le brinda.
Bertha tiene como propósito para un futuro cercano, ampliar su negocio para que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo y le brinde la posibilidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida para disfrutar con su familia un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Bertha is a micro-entrepreneur who has been making and selling corn cakes for 15 years. She started this business with the intention of generating income to pay for basic household expenses, and to support her 4 children.

She works alone every day, starting in the early morning hours, in order to make her products and sell them later in different shops and to neighbors in the area.

Her drive and determination motivate her to seek new options that will allow her to continue strengthening her business, and this is the reason that she is seeking a loan. With the money, she will make improvements and renovations (expand her work space), and purchase supplies wholesale (corn and charcoal for the oven). This will allow her to optimize the space and improve working conditions.

Additionally, she will have the basic ingredients available that she needs to keep making her products and fill her customers’ orders in a timely manner, giving her increased sales and profits from her work. 

Bertha’s goal for the near future is to expand her business so that she can generate employment opportunities, making it possible for her to improve the quality of life and well-being for herself and her family.

loans.use: to make improvements and renovations (expand her work space) and to purchase basic supplies wholesale (corn and charcoal for the oven).

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José tiene 45 años, es soltero, y  tiene dos hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos con sus padres.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Son 21 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Pecuaria en su mayoría.

José trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia, los productos los vende en San Carlos Y Mocache.

En sus tiempos libres le gusta la pelea de gallos. El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura para la compra de herbicidas, urea, abonos, fertilizantes. Su meta es tener un mejor futuro.  Los desafíos que enfrenta es cambiar su estado de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old, single, and has two children.  He lives in the Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos settlement with his parents.

He is a member of the “10 de Septiembre” rural association, located in Lechugalito, part of the Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos settlement.  There are 21 members and this is mainly a farming and livestock community.

Jose is a farmer to support his family and sells his products in San Carlos and Mocache.

He likes to watch the cock fights in his spare time and is asking for a loan to buy herbicide, urea, compost, and fertilizer.  His goal is to have a better future.  His challenge is to change his life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six group leader farmers in Webuye District, with Francis selected as the Kiva representative.  Francis has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative, and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 70 other individual farmers represented by this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.					

Francis is married, and has 16 children.  He is 53 years old, and is known as friendly and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and burial committee.  Francis has been a farmer for 32 years.  Francis described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  				

Francis first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season.  Francis joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, who wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. 

 Francis plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Francis’s own life was improved because he had more profits from his harvest, and was able to save money.	

Francis and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low, and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo, and is standing at the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde, es madre soltera de dos hijos, tiene 52 años de edad, para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de petates, es una actividad que realiza de desde 20 años, es un oficio que aprendió de familia, trabaja todos los días, y vende su producto en la zona donde reside.
Invertirá en la compra de tule, ya que es su materia prima, espera tener una buena producción, aumentar sus ventas, cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, atraer más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos con los que tiene pensado seguir apoyando con los gastos familiares y cancelar las cuotas de una manera puntual.
Aspira con hacer crecer su negocio para tener los recursos para mejorar su vivienda y darles un estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Matilde is the single mother of two children.  She is 52 years old, makes and sells bedrolls, has been doing this for 20 years, and learned it from her family.  She works every day and sells her products in the area where she lives.

She will buy cattail, which is her main raw material, and she expects to have good production, increase her sales, meet her customer orders, attract new customers, and improve her income to pay her household expenses and make her debt payments on time.

She wants to grow her business so she can have resources to make home improvements and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattail.

loans.name: Bodaboda Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her early 30's, is single with a boy and girl, who are in school. Anna has managed her family by putting her effort towards clothes selling. Anna, who has been in this business for seven years now, works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily, and is able to earn a very small profit per month. 

This is Anna's second loan requested from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use the loan to buy a plot of land to build a house for her family. Anna's previous loan, which has paid back in full, was used to buy new clothes, which were highly demanded by customers.   With her profit earned from the business, she covered school fees and household expenses.  Anna is full of hope, and she dreams that one day she will be able to build a new, modern house for her children.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "BODABODA, " which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is 36 years old. She is a female, married, and has four children whom she supports, ages 12,10, 8 and 5 years old. Tabu was introduced to KADET Ltd. by Kadet staff and she is a taking her first loan from KADET of ksh15,000. She runs a café business which has lasted for twelve years now, located at Kibaoni, and she earns a monthly income of approximately ksh 5,350. 

She will use the loan to add stock to her business, including wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil. Also, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her cafe. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to expand her business by making it into a hotel. She also plans to educate her children and make sure they live well.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil to make food for her customers.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel tiene 29 años, está casada con Etsenia y tiene una hija de 6 años que vive junto a el en su casa hecha a base de adobe. Desde muy joven se caracterizó por ser muy trabajador apoyando a sus padres en las tareas agrícolas correspondientes a la producción de cacao orgánico siendo este el sustento para su economía familiar. Con el paso de los años y viéndose obligado a buscar un ingreso económico fijo a propósito de su unión conyugal y nacimiento de su pequeña  optó en ocuparse laboralmente como jornalero logrando con el paso de unos años acumular dinero y  adquirir su propio terreno, posteriormente convoco al apoyo de Etsenia con quien hasta hoy desempeña las diversas tareas productivas  brindándole el mantenimiento respectivo a sus plantaciones de cacao. Para el normal desempeño de su trabajo constantemente debe de contar con el apoyo de jornaleros, especialmente en la época de cosecha para comercializar las almendras secas de cacao en menor tiempo. Finalmente lleva sus sacos con sus productos hasta los centros de venta de su localidad donde tras pesar y venderlos recupera el dinero que invirtió retornando con una gran satisfacción de haber dedicado todo su esfuerzo en la campaña productiva. En esta ocasión desea contar con  2,000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en el mantenimiento de sus terrenos contratando trabajadores para el retiro de maleza y la compra de almácigos para renovar sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Abel is 29 years old. He is married to Etsenia, and they live together with their six-year-old daughter in their adobe house. Abel has been known for being very hardworking since he was very young, when he helped his parents with the agricultural work related to producing organic cacao, which was his family’s means of support.

As the years passed and Abel found himself needing to find a source of fixed income for his marriage and the birth of his daughter, he decided to work as a day laborer. As more years passed, he was able to save some money and buy some land. Etsenia then began to help him with the various tasks related to producing and maintaining his fields of cacao. She continues to help him to this day.

The regular work of producing his cacao requires the support of day laborers, and even more during the harvest season, in order to sell the dry cacao beans quickly. The final step is to carry the sacks of cacao beans to the sales centers in his area where, after weighing and selling them, he recovers the money he invested in the production. He gains great satisfaction from having devoted all of his effort to the production.

Abel is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN to invest in the maintenance of his land. He will hire workers to remove weeds, and he will buy seedlings to renew his cacao fields.

loans.use: to hire workers to remove weeds and to buy seedlings to renew his cacao fields.

loans.name: Mahrambi

texts.ru:
Махрамби приветливая, отзывчивая, вежливая и милая женщина из города Курган-Тюбе. Она вместе с мужем воспитывает троих сыновей и дочку. Старшему сыну 21 год он находится на заработках за приделами страны. Другие дети Махрамби учатся в школе. Махрамби более 10 лет занимается торговлей. На данный момент она занимается продажей хозяйственных товаров. Она продает самые различные товары, в том числе плоскогубцы, ножницы, щипцы, розетки, вилки для проводов, счетчики, различные фонари на батареях и многое другое. 
  Зимой в Таджикистане электричество подают лимитом, поэтому большую часть ее товара занимает фонари на батареях. Махрамби готовится к зиме очень хорошо. Она хочет привести новый товар предназначенные зимнему сезону. Но для приобретения нового товара, у Махрамби не достаточно средств. Поэтому она попросила помочь ей.
texts.en:
Mahrambi is a friendly, sympathetic, polite and sweet woman from the city of Kurgan-Tube. Together with her husband, she raises three sons and one daughter. The eldest son is 21 years old and is a migrant worker outside the country. The rest of Mahrambi's children go to school. 

Mahrambi has worked in retail for more than 10 years. Currently she sells household goods. She sells a variety of goods, such as pliers, scissors, tongs, sockets, plugs for cables, meters, various battery-driven lights and more. In the winter, electricity is limited in Tajikistan, and therefore a large part of her goods are battery-driven lights. 

Mahrambi is preparing well for the winter. She would like to bring in new goods intended for the winter season, however she does not have enough money to purchase new goods. Therefore she has asked for help.

loans.use: to purchase new goods for the winter season

loans.name: Kinereta

texts.en:
Kinereta is a 41-year-old woman who is married, with three children. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has ten years of experience with this business. 

Kinereta has requested a loan to buy scissors, a new sewing machine, and fabrics, and to buy iron roofing for home improvement. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to pay her children's school fees. 

She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy scissors, a new sewing machine, and fabrics, and to buy iron roofing for home improvement.

loans.name: Mildren Midey

texts.es:
Mildren, solicita capital para invertir en la compra de nacazcol, barro y arcilla, son sus implementos para realizar los diferentes productos de loza con los que espera tener una buena producción, entregar en un menor tiempo los pedidos de sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas. 
Con el crédito anterior adquirió los materiales necesarios para trabajar y fortalecer el inventario de su negocio, aumento sus ventas su economía ha mejorado, su familia recibe mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mildren is asking for a loan to buy nacazcol, mud and clay.  These are the materials she needs to make different pottery items and for which she expects a good production run, deliver her customer orders in less time and increase her sales.

She used the money from the previous loan to buy supplies so that she could work and increase her inventory.  She increased her sales and her finances and her family has better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mafutaga

texts.en:
Mafutaga is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. For more than five years she has had a small plantation upon which she grows taro to earn a living.

Mafutaga has been a member of SBPD since 2012. She is applying for a 1,500 WST loan to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer and chemicals. With her profits Mafutaga hopes to save more for her children's education and unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Ifo

texts.en:
Ifo is 45 years old and married with six children. For more than ten years she has had a huge plantation where she grows taro and bananas which she sells in her community or at the market.

Ifo has been a member of SBPD since 2011. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and chemicals. She will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and chemicals

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is 22 years old and single. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community.

Miriama joined SPBD in December, 2013 to take advantage of its financial services. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil and a fryer.

With her anticipated profits Miriama plans to expand her business and save more for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil and a fryer

loans.name: Evotia

texts.en:
Evotia is a single 19-year-old lady with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Evotia needs a loan to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Evotia will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to save more for her child.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: After leaving school after first grade, Mary decided to set up her own charcoal business at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. With over twelve years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her business further. Unfortunately, Mary is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more bags of charcoal for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a steel burner) with the upkeep of their house, whilst also ensuring that their eight children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a small scale ‘Kenkey’ seller (Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She can usually be found selling her ‘Kenkey’ in Ve-deme (near Hohoe).  She has had some form of formal education as she is a middle school level graduate. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a peasant farmer. Patience has been preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for close to 7 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of maize, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Samirah

texts.en:
Samirah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Samirah is a 41-year-old married woman from Attel village near Tulkarem city. She is a mother of six sons and three daughters. Samirah's husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers the family needs. 

Five years ago, Samirah and her husband started to raise sheep on a small farm they own. They sell dairy products in the local market. It is a good business and helps the family with part of their expenses. Samirah and her husband would like to improve their project, so she took a USD 2,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more sheep to improve their farm. By taking this loan, the productivity of their farm will increase and also their income.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to improve their farm.

loans.name: Prosper

texts.en: Prosper is a small scale petty trader and a farmer in Ve-deme (near Hohoe).  He has had some form of formal education as he is a middle school level graduate. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is also a petty trader. Prosper has been working as a petty trader for close to 11 years as a middleman. (A middleman buys foodstuffs from farmers to resell to market women.)  His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. He plans on using his loan to purchase an increased quantity of okra, beans, maize and rice, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand. He hopes to use the profits from his enterprise to fulfill his dream of building a warehouse where he can store his goods. He also wants to acquire a tricycle in the near future, which would help him sell from a fixed location in the future, and also use to transport his goods to the market.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of okra, beans, maize and rice, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa (in the photo), age 31, is a garment worker. She lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has two children: one son and one daughter. One of her children attends school, and the other one is still young. 

Channa does not have her own transportation to get work; she always rides with her relatives. She decided to request a loan to buy a motorcycle. With the motorbike, Channa will have her own transportation to get to work and she will not need to ride with her relatives any more.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Banco Mujer La Brigada Group

texts.es: Kelineth es una joven de 23 años de edad, divorciada, actualmente vive con sus padres adultos mayores a los cuales apoya económicamente gracias a su actividad productiva, ella se dedica a vender productos como maquillaje, cremas, ropa interior y blusas de catálogos, son productos que gustan mucho a sus clientas, las cuales no pueden pagarles de contado por lo que ella les permite que paguen en un plazo de treinta días. Kelineth desea este crédito para comprar más de su mercadería y vender a diferentes clientas. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
Kelineth, 23, is a young divorced woman, who currently lives with her parents who she helps economically thanks to her work. She sells products like make-up, creams, underwear and tops from catalogues. The products are in high demand from her customers, who cannot pay her in cash so she gives them a 30 day payment plan. 

Kelineth wants this loan in order to buy more merchandise and to sell to different customers. She says she chose Fundación Mujer because of its low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as make up, creams and underwear

loans.name: Levi's Group

texts.en:
Levi is a member of a Group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured here in a group of 7 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 69 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Levi has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Levi is married and has 6 children. He is 61 years old and is known as friendly and trustworthy. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and prayer group. Levi has been a farmer for 23 years. He described his harvest as poor last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Levi first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2008 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Levi joined One Acre Fund in order to learn new farming methods. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. Levi plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Levi’s own life was improved because he was able to save money and was able to feed the family.  		

Levi and the Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, soltera de 29 años, nacida en la provincia Andres Ibáñez de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia ha culminado sus estudios de pregrado en Economía y ha optado por una modalidad especial de titulación, para lo cual debe realizar un diplomado, es así que desea acceder a un crédito educativo lo que le permitirá terminar su carrera.

Silvia no trabaja y vive con sus padres que son de escasos recursos. Comenta que a lo largo de sus estudios no tuvo mayores inconvenientes, pero ahora si ha tropezado con la falta de recursos económicos, ya que si bien la Universidad en la que estudia es estatal y no tiene costo de colegiatura, la obtención de la titulación conlleva un costo muy alto para ella y sin el acceso al financiamiento le es imposible obtener su título profesional.

El mayor ejemplo e inspiración que tiene en la vida es su Padre cuyo nivel académico es técnico medio y con un gran esfuerzo logra sacar a su familia adelante. 

Una vez concluidos sus estudios Silvia quisiera poder conseguir un trabajo y retribuir el gran esfuerzo de sus padres, demostrando su capacidad profesional a través de buenas ideas y compromiso con la institución que le permita ejercer su carrera. Asimismo señala que a futuro quiere formar su propia familia y llegar a realizar un emprendimiento propio. 

Silvia se siente muy agradecida de saber que existen personas que pueden ayudarla a realizar sus sueños pues cree que esto motiva a más personas a titularse y no buscar el camino de la deserción por falta de dinero. Está muy esperanzada de poder conseguir pronto el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Silvia is 29 years old and was born in Andres Ibáñez de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia.  She has completed her studies in Economics and has opted for a special title and she must complete the requirements for a diploma.  She is seeking a loan so that she can complete her education.

Silvia doesn’t work and lives with her parents, who have limited resources.  She says that she didn’t have any major inconveniences when she completed her studies, but now she is faced with a lack of financial resources, but she attends a state university and although there is no cost for classes, it there is a high cost to obtain a title and she doesn’t have access to finances.

Her father is her main example and inspiration in her life.  He is a medical technician and manages to get the family ahead with great effort.

Once Silvia completes her education, she will get a job and return the great effort that her parents made, demonstrating her professional training through good ideas and commitment.  She also says that she wants to start a family of her own in the future and start her own business.

Silvia is grateful to know that there are people who can help her realize her dreams.  She believes that this motivates more people to seek titles and not give up because of a lack of money.  She is hopeful about getting financing soon.

loans.use: to pay for a diploma.

loans.name: Ana Aida

texts.es:
Ana, es casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, se dedica a vender diferentes productos lácteos y granos básicos, en sus inicios solo vendía lácteos, con el tiempo amplio su negocio e incluyo la venta de granos básicos, no se le dificulta realizar esta actividad ya que cuenta con mucha experiencia.
Comprará maíz, frijol, quesos y leche, para que su inventario se fortalezca y siga cumpliendo con las expectativas de sus clientes, espera ofrecer productos de calidad, atraer nuevos clientes, mejorar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
Tener un negocio más amplio y aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
Ana is married and lives with her husband and children.  She sells dairy products and basic grains.  She started out with just dairy, but in time expanded her business and added basic grains.  She doesn’t find this to be difficult and has lots of experience.

She will buy corn, beans, cheeses, and milk to increase her inventory, strengthen her business and continue meeting her customers’ expectations.  She will offer quality products, attract new customers, improve her sales, and have a better income.

She wants a larger business with more customers.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Jacinto  Alberto

texts.es:
Jacinto radica en Santo Domingo de los Colorados, zona cálida húmeda y conocida en el país por la etnia Tsáchila que habita en el sector.  Con 33 años, él  vive con sus padres,  Jacinto tiene dos hijos que  están con su madre ya que  se encuentran separados hace más de un año.
Jacinto de igual manera busca el bienestar para sus hijos, es por ello que cuenta con su propio negocio, una vulcanizadora ubicada en un sector estratégico de la ciudad, esta profesión la aprendió de sus padres y  cuenta  ya con 15 años de experiencia. Poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio y ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, ahora quiere comprar un compresor que es muy importante para su trabajo diario, por ello acudió a Fundación Alternativa a informase como se lo podría ayudar y se fue fascinado por los productos y el servicio que la organización brinda. Se siente muy agradecido con la institución y Kiva por ayudarle con el crédito para la compra de su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jacinto lives in Santo Domingo de los Colorados, which is located in a warm, humid area of the country that is known for the ethnic group Tsáchila, who live in the area. Jacinto is 33 years old and lives with his parents. He has two children, who live with their mother, from whom he separated more than a year ago.

Jacinto is looking out for his children’s wellbeing, and it is for this reason that he has his own business, a tire repair shop located in a strategic area of the city. He learned this profession from his parents, and he now has 15 years of experience in it. He has gradually been improving his business and has been able to provide for his family. Now he would like to buy a compressor that is very important for his daily work. He went to Fundación Alternativa to get information about how they could help him help himself, and he liked the products and services that the organization provides. He is very grateful to the institution and to Kiva for helping him with this loan to buy this tool he needs for his work.

loans.use: to buy a compressor that is very important for his daily work.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is a housewife and a mother of two children living in Bandung, a city located about a three-hour drive from Jakarta. Ria's husband is a private worker. In order to support her family, she manages a small stall called a "warung", a typical corner store in Indonesia that sells snacks, drinks, and consumer products
. 
She joined Ruma because she wanted to try selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last one month, she has had an average of $30-$31/day sales just by selling mobile phone airtime credits. Currently, Ria is taking a working capital loan from Kiva to process more transactions. In the future, Ria plans to expand her business even more and put aside the extra cash for her children's education. Ria is standing in front of her small stall in the picture. She really thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credits sales and bill payments transactions

loans.name: Dubian De Jesús

texts.es:
Dubian comenzó a trabajar como comerciante independiente desde hace 3 años; con un dinero que había ahorrado durante sus años de trabajo como empleado, inició una tienda y miscelánea que ubicó en un espacio de su vivienda, allí ofrece productos de la canasta familiar y además también ofrece productos de papelería, trabaja con el apoyo de su esposa y juntos han sacado adelante a sus 2 hijos; su horario de atención es de lunes a domingo de 7 am a 10 pm y así ha generado ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. El oficio lo aprendió de un primo que tiene un negocio similar hace muchos años y siguiendo sus consejos ha logrado tener buena acogida en el sector.
Con el fin de seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, Dubian se ve motivado para solicitar el crédito e invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, granos, gaseosas, dulces y productos de papelería), esto le permitirá tener la disponibilidad de artículos suficientes para satisfacer la demanda en la temporada escolar y así ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio, esto aumentará sus ventas y las ganancias que éstas le generan.
El cliente manifiesta que seguirá trabajando con empeño y mucha constancia pues el negocio está en proceso de posicionamiento y requiere tener muy buen inventario de productos para que le permitan fidelizar su clientela y en un futuro tener la capacidad para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dubian started working as an independent shop owner three years ago.  With some money that he had saved during his years working as an employee, he opened a corner store in a space in his home.  In his store, Dubian sells basic household goods as well as paper products.  He works with his wife, and together they have been able to get their two children ahead.  Dubian's store is open from Monday to Sunday from 7:00am to 10:00pm, and he has been able to generate enough income to meet his family's expenses.  Dubian learned this line of work many years ago from a cousin who has a similar business.  By following his cousin's advice, Dubian has had a positive reception in his neighborhood.
With the goal of continuing to strengthen his business, Dubian was motivated to request a loan.  The loan is for investing in the purchase of wholesale supplies (pastries, grains, sodas, sweets and paper products.)  This will allow him to have enough items available to meet the school-year demand and offer his customers a better service.  This will also increase his sales and the earnings his sales are generating. 
This clients says that he will keep working hard and with a lot of perseverance.  His business is in the process of positioning and he needs to have a lot of good inventory to allow him to build up customer loyalty and, in the future, have the capacity to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies (pastries, grains, sweets and paper products).

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Haneen is a 29-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother to two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a lawyer in his small office, which has been open for three years. It is a good business and earns a good income. Haneen and her husband would like to improve the law office by buying all the needed stuff.

Haneen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy new copier and printer machines for his office. By taking this loan, Haneen's husband will work on the cases and problems in an easier way.

loans.use: to buy new copier and printer machines for his office.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school and learning how to weave Kente, a Ghanaian traditional cloth, Francis decided to set up his own Kente weaving center/business in Ve-deme (near Hohoe). With over 5 years' worth of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. (Kente cloth is made by weaving long strips that contain symbolic patterns and joining them together.)

As a result, this loan will be used to help him to purchase various colors of yarn threads to enable him to produce more Kente cloth to meet his increasing market demand. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is into petty trading) with the upkeep of their house while  also ensuring that their 2 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help him purchase various colors of yarn of threads to enable him to produce more Kente cloth to meet his increasing market demand.

loans.name: Rodayna

texts.en:
Rodayna is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Rodayna is a 34-year-old married woman from Attel village near Tulkarm city. She is a mother of four sons and two daughters. Rodayna's husband is a Poet, and a very talented man. He also has a small kids' clothing shop. Rodayna and her husband work in their store. It is a good business and earns a good income but still needs some improvement.
 
Rodayna took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy a new collection of winter clothes for kids. This will increase their sales and also their income.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of winter clothes for kids.

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en:
Faustine is a small scale ‘Red-Red’ seller (Red-Red is a traditional Ghanaian staple food that is largely made from spiced cow-peas, ripped plantains and palm oil). She can usually be found selling her ‘Red-Red’ in Ve-deme (near Hohoe). She has had some form of formal education as she is a middle school graduate. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Faustine has been preparing and selling ‘Red-Red’ for close to 10 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of Red-Red ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of Red-Red ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Ruth Estela

texts.es: La Señora Ruth sigue con la misma actividad de la confección de vestidos para novias cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de tela al por mayor para la confección de sus vestidos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de tela como también accesorios para confeccionar sus vestidos, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer y  seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Ruth continues making wedding dresses and things went well for her with the previous loan.  She used it to buy fabric in quantity to make her dresses.  She is asking for a loan to buy fabric and accessories to make her dresses.  She feels happy and grateful to the Kiva lenders for the opportunity to grow and continue her business and income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies.

loans.name: Maota

texts.en:
Maota is a 32-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 5 years.

Maota has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, and a weedsprayer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010.

With her profits, Maota hopes to save more for her childrens' educations and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, and a weedsprayer.

loans.name: Motu

texts.en: Motu is a 52-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. Motu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a weed-sprayer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Motu hopes to buy a new iron roof for her house and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a weedsprayer.

loans.name: Susiana

texts.en: Susiana is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Susiana needs a loan to buy a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a weedsprayer and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Susiana will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a weedsprayer and chemicals.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is a 35-year-old married woman with only 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 5 years. Mariana has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer and a weedsprayer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Mariana hopes to buy cement for her house and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer and a weedsprayer.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio Rolando pertenece al banco comunal LAMAY QOSQO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 29 años y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como mecánico, el socio repara diferentes autos de sus clientes que le solicitan sus servicios, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas tuercas, martillo entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rolando is a member belonging to the Lamay Qosqo communal bank.  The bank is located in the Lamay district, Calca province, Cusco region.

Rolando is 29 years old and single.  He alternates his time between his daily activities and his work as a mechanic.  He repairs the different cars that his clients ask him to fix.  He has been doing this work for a good while now.  It’s going well for him, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day.  He is a responsible and diligent person, and because of this he is getting ahead.

Rolando is asking for a loan to buy wrenches and a hammer, among other items.  He feels thankful for the loan and is committed to making his assigned payments.

loans.use: to buy wrenches and a hammer, among other items.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto es un humilde señor originario de la ciudad de Boaco, de 57 años de edad. Casado y padre de cuatro hijos. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica al acarreo de cargas y venta de cerdos. Negocio que inicio hace muchos años; el cual trabajo desde pequeño, su padre tenía este tipo de negocio, así fue a prendiendo poco a poco. Solía salir a venden leche en las zonas cercanas de la ciudad. Actualmente tiene un negocio más práctico y cercano a su familia, sobre todo, le ha generado ingresos a su hogar. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y apoyar a sus hijas en sus estudios. Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos y revenderlos. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que obtendrá mejores ganancias para cumplir sus metas y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su plan futuro es seguir mejorando las condiciones de su casa e instalar una pulpería.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a humble 57-year-old gentlemen originally from the city of Boaco.  He is married and has four children.  He makes his living by transporting goods and selling pigs.  He has had this business for many years.  He has worked from the time he was a child, and his father also had this type of business. As Rigoberto grew up he learned the business little by little.

He used to go to sell milk in the areas surrounding the city.  Currently he has a business that is more practical and allows him to be closer to his family.  Above all, it has brought income to his household.  His next goal is to improve the infrastructure of his house and support his daughters in their studies.

He is seeking a loan in order to buy pigs for resale.  He believes that the loan will be beneficial since he will be able to obtain better income, which will in turn allow him to complete his goals and improve his quality of his life.  His plan is to continue making improvements to his home and to install a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy pigs for resale.

loans.name: Purnalaxmi

texts.en:
Purnalaxmi; her husband, Subhash; and her two sons live in the small town of Dhupguri. All of her children are receiving education. Purnalaxmi takes care of animals in her animal husbandry and earns money by selling the animal products. Her husband is engaged in farming vegetables on their own plot of land. Both of them are illiterate but know how to sign their names. She and her husband struggle a lot to earn money so that their children do not get affected by any problems.

Now Purnalaxmi wants to grow potatoes on their agricultural land and sell the harvest in the market. She has given preference to this business, as potatos are a valuable crop in West Bengal. She hopes it will be a profitable business for them. She has applied for a loan to Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) for 15,000 Indian rupees to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to farm potatoes on their land. She is a very optimistic and courageous woman. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of potatoes

loans.name: León Darío

texts.es:
León es un hombre trabajador de 54 años de edad, que durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en el área comercial, administrando diferentes negocios pero, desde hace aproximadamente 1 año, alquiló un local y montó su propio negocio, una cafetería y charcutería en la que ofrece mecato, gaseosas, alimentos fritos, café, dulces, entre otros, trabaja todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana y de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para su sustento. 
Su objetivo es utilizar el crédito que solicita en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, salsas, dulces, entre otros), así podrá tener bien abastecido su negocio para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de fin de año, lo que le permitirá tener mejores ventas y un nivel mayor de ingresos.
León desea seguir luchando para lograr sus metas, fortalecer su negocio, acreditarlo y posicionarlo en el mercado, para que en un futuro le permita cumplir el sueño de montar otro negocio y así poder generar una rentabilidad económica que le permita disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Leon is a hardworking 54 year old man who has dedicated himself to managing different businesses during a productive life, but he rented a shop and opened his own business, a café, about a year ago.  He sells pastries, soft drinks, fried foods, coffee, candy, and other things.  He works every day from early morning and in this way generates enough to support himself. 

His goal is to use the money from this loan to buy inventory in quantity (pastries, soft drinks, sauces, candy, and other things).  In this way he will be able to stock his business well and satisfy the increased demand at the end of year season so he can increase his sales and income.

Leon wants to continue working toward his goals, strengthen his business, grow it, and eventually set up in the market so that he can start another business in the future, create financial stability, and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Faviola Cecilia

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón que se encuentra ubicado al Noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha a este Cantón se lo conoce como el Cantón del amor, en el mismo vive y tiene su negocio la señora Faviola tiene 34 años es madre soltera tiene una hija de 4 años por la que día a día continua con su incansable lucha de mejorar su calidad de vida he ingresos económicos. 
Tiene un negocio de venta de artículos plásticos este negocio lo aprendió cuando trabajaba en la cuidad de quito en una distribuidora de los mismos, trabaja un promedio de 12 horas diarias por lo que no le queda mucho tiempo libre pero aprovecha cada minuto que puede para compartir momento agradables con su pequeña hija.
Tiene varios sueños que quisiera realizar, quisiera incrementar notablemente su negocio, le gustaría ser una gran distribuidora de estos artículos, este préstamo ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos ya que lo invertirá en arreglar el local para que se vea más llamativo para captar más clientela, la Sra. Fabiola agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a Canton in the northwestern part of the Pichincha province. It is known as the canton of love. Faviola, 34, lives and works here. She is a single mother with a 4-year-old daughter. Every day, she works endlessly to improve her daughter's quality of life and economic income.

She has a business in selling plastic products. She learned about this business when she worked in the city of Quito for a plastic products distributor. She works an average of 12 hours per day, which doesn't leave her much free time. However, she takes advantage of every minute she can to share happy moments with her young daughter.

She has various dreams she wants to fulfill. She would like to notably grow her business—she would like to be a large distributor of these products. This loan will help her to improve her income since she will invest it in fixing up her shop so it will attract more attention and bring in more customers. Fabiola is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support they provide.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and increase her income.

loans.name: Jaime Rober

texts.es:
Jaime vive en la ciudad de  Pucallpa, trabaja como vendedor en una pequeña panadería de su ciudad, con la cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque es padre de un niño de 1 año de edad; asimismo Jaime tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, con lo cual puede tener un ingreso extra para los gastos del hogar.
Jaime está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha n brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa como polos, short, bividis, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in the city of Pucallpa, where he works as a sales clerk in a small bakery. With his income he is able to provide for his one-year-old son. At the same time, Jaime has a small clothing sales business, from which he earns extra income for household expenses.

Jaime is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they have given him to buy merchandise for his clothing business, such as polo shirts, shorts and undershirts, among others. This will allow him to offer a greater variety of products and better meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his clothing sales business, such as polo shirts, shorts and undershirts.

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es:
Jessica, es casada, tiene una hija la cual estudia, vive junto a su familia, por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares se dedica vender ropa, forros para muebles y electrodomésticos, lo aprendió por su cuenta y no tiene un horario establecido para atender el negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de ropa para ambos sexos y telas para elaborar los diferentes tipos de forros para muebles y electrodomésticos, surtirá su inventario con diferentes estilos de blusas, camisas, pantalones, con lo que espera estar preparada para estas fechas en las que los clientes tienen mayores demandas, aumentar sus ventas, atraer nuevos clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
 Aspira seguir ampliando su negocio y que sea rentable para trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Jessica is married, has a daughter who attends school, and lives with her family.  She sells clothing, furniture covers, and appliances in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She doesn’t have a set schedule and learned this on her own.

She will buy clothing for men and women, appliances, and fabric to make different kinds of furniture covers.  She will stock up on different styles of blouses, shirts, and pants so she can be prepared for the season when her customer demand goes up and her sales increase, and so she can attract new customers and increase her earnings. 

She wants to continue expanding her business so that it is more profitable so she can work with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy inventory and supplies.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, es soltera, de 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos varones; actualmente vive  junto a su familia en el departamento de Sololá. 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de hortalizas); lo cual lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive. Tiene 11 años de estar realizando esta actividad. Se inclinó por esta labor  porque se dio cuenta que es algo muy rentable, y también porque tiene terreno apto para el cultivo. La producción que obtiene la vende en Sololá, lo cual le genera los ingresos con los cuales puede aportar a la economía de su familia, lo que le llena de mucha satisfacción.
Además de la agricultura, ella es mesera de un restaurante en Sololá, lo que también le genera otros ingresos que complementan el presupuesto familiar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de semilla de papa y fertilizante.
Sueña con equipar su casa y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 36 years old and single. She has two boys. She lives with her family in the department of Sololá.

She works in agriculture, growing vegetables in the community where she lives for 11 years now. She decided to pursue this work because she noticed that it was very profitable, and also because she has land that is suitable for cultivation. She sells her crops in Sololá, and she uses the income she earns for her family’s expenses, which gives her a lot of satisfaction.

In addition to her agricultural work, Candelaria waits tables in a restaurant in Sololá. This work provides her with additional income for her family’s budget.

Candelaria is requesting a loan of 3,000 GTQ to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. She dreams of furnishing her home and improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Diana Alexandra

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón que día con día va creciendo este Cantón es uno de los que demuestra mayor movimiento comercial al a nivel del noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha 
En este Cantón vive y trabaja la señora Diana estrada un mujer de 31 años, ella mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre con el señor Vismar él trabaja como maestro albañil, ellos tiene 2 hijos uno de 11 años y de 2 años,
Ha tenido varios obstáculos en su vida uno de ellos fue el no haber podido continuar con sus estudios por la mala situación económica y por la faltad de apoyo, ella se crio con sus abuelos Ella tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en el terreno de su casa, aprendió de esta actividad desde muy niña, aprendió con su abuela en la finca en la que se crio,
Trabaja un promedio de 6 horas diarias entre su negocio y todos los trabajos que hay que hacer en una finca, lo más difícil en esta actividad es cuando los pollos son bebes porque hay que ponerles mucho cuidado para evitar y combatir muchas enfermedades a los que están propensos.
Tiene muchas sueños que quisiera realizar uno de ellos es incrementar su granja de pollos para lograr una mejor y mayor rentabilidad, este préstamo ayudara a cumplir su sueño ya que lo invertirá en agrandar he incrementar su negocio, Diana agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo y la gran ayuda que le darán para empezar a construir uno de sus sueños.
texts.en:
“Pedro Vicente Maldonado” is a settlement that grows daily.  This settlement has lots of commercial activity in the northwest part of the Pichincha province.  Diana lives here.  She is 31 years old, is in a common law marriage with Vismar, who works as a master mason.  They have two children, ages 11 and 2.

She has had various obstacles in her life, one of which was not being able to continue with school because of the poor financial situation and lack of support; she was raised by her grandparents.  She has a small chicken farm on land at her home.  She began doing this when she was very young and learned from her grandmother.

She works an average of six hour a day between her business and all the other work she has to do on a farm.  The most difficult part is caring for the chicks because she must prevent and fight many diseases that they are prone to.

She has many dreams, one of which is to expand her chicken farm to increase her profit.  This loan will help her achieve that dream.  Diana is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the support and the help she will get to help build one of her dreams.

loans.use: to expand her chicken farm.

loans.name: Sergio Alvaro

texts.es: El Señor  Álvaro tiene 23 años, él se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, tiene su taller en la zona de Horizontes,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Señor  Álvaro va a usar este préstamo para compra de telas, fibra e hilos para la confección de variedad de ropa, su razón para solicitar es que tiene muchos pedidos para esta época,  el Señor  Álvaro enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar la calidad de sus prendas de vestir,  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar de Máquinas de coser para la realización de su trabajo, el Señor  Álvaro es una persona con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Álvaro is twenty-three years old. He works as a tailor. His workshop is located in the Horizontes neighborhood. This is his first loan cycle with the institution. Álvaro will use this loan to buy fabric, fibers, and thread to make a variety of clothing. His reason for applying for a loan is that he has a lot of orders for this season. Álvaro faces challenges in his business such as improving the quality of his clothing products. He will use his profits to buy sewing machines for his business. Álvaro has a desire to succeed. He is happy for this provided opportunity to improve his business and, as a result, his earnings.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 28-year-old university graduate from Mbeya, Tanzania.  In the region where she comes from, many people live in rural areas where they don't have access to electricity.  This is a common situation in Tanzania, where the national grid reaches only 14% of the population: that means 38 million people are without electricity.  Jane knows that solar power can be an affordable and efficient solution to get access to energy.  

The impact that solar power can have is huge and varied: with solar products the people of Mbeya will be able to light their homes at night; to charge their mobile phones for free in their own home; to keep businesses running after sunset; and their children will be able to study in the evening without having to use harmful kerosene lamps.  As of today all of this is impossible, as people have to walk, sometimes for hours, just to charge their phone, and pay for it as well.  After sunset there is no light if not that provided by kerosene, which is dangerous for people's health, especially children, and for the environment. 

Jane's objective is to use a Kiva loan to start her own business and provide solar power products to the people in her community.  Part of the loan will go towards the purchase of products.  The rest will be used to cover the costs of running the business, such as transportation and marketing.  Eventually, Jane wants to set up a solar shop in her hometown.  

As a university graduate who has already gained retail experience in the renewable energy sector, Jane understands very well how to run a business, to keep track of her revenues and expenses, and to reach out to customers.  She has been working with African Solar Rise for over 3 months now, and has demonstrated her reliability and motivation.  She has already brought power to many families, teaching them how to use the products and installing them herself on the roofs of the houses.  Jane has received training within the Solar Village project of African Solar Rise, and she therefore has the technical knowledge of solar power products needed to install them and to provide after-sales services to a high standard.  With all of these assets, she is confident she can run her activity successfully, and maintain a high level of sales.

A Kiva loan will give Jane the opportunity to start a new stage in her life, and to have a truly significant impact on her community.

loans.use: to buy solar products and establish her own solar business

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte del grupo de crédito El Cisne desde hace 10 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una belleza natural y de verdes campos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, su mayor fuente de ingresos es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.
La Señora Rosa tiene 57 años de  edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 6 de ellos son casados, un hijo trabaja pero solo para solventar sus gastos personales, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio del sector, su esposo labora en la construcción, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa, pero aportar económicamente a su hogar cría cerdos, pollos, cuyes y ganado, tambien cultiva su terreno y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y para la venta.
El dinero de su crédito a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y alimento para animales. Su meta es tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the communal bank "El Cisne" for 10 years. During this time, she has developed very close friendships with all of the other members.  She lives in the parish of Valle in Cuenca, Ecuador.  This is an area of great natural beauty and green fields.  The architecture is a blend of the ancient and the modern.  The local people still maintain their culture and traditions.  The main sources of income in the area are agriculture, livestock and other forms of commerce.

Rosa is 57 years old and has had nine children with her husband, who works in construction.  Six of the children are now married, one of their sons is working and supporting himself, and the remaining two children are still attending a local school.  Rosa and her husband own their own home.

She is in charge of the household chores, and to support the family economically, she raises chickens, pigs, cows and Guinea pigs.  She also grows crops for sale and for household consumption.

She will invest the loan proceeds in chickens and Guinea pigs, as well as animal feed.  Her goal is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy chickens and Guinea pigs, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is a 23-year-old married woman who has one child.  She has a small plantation and grows bananas, taamu (a large root vegetable similar to taro), yams and taro to earn a living.  She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Makerita has requested a loan to purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer and a spade.  She has been a member of SBPD since 2011.  With her profit, Makerita hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer and a spade.

loans.name: Jose Camilo

texts.es:
José, se decidió por otro crédito debido a que se acerca el momento preciso para recolectar la cosecha de maíz, lo invertirá en el pago de mano de obra y una maquina desgranadora, con lo que continuara cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes y generando los ingresos que tanto necesita para sacar a su familia adelante y continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior su producción fue abundante, las ventas han sido mejores, sus ganancias extras le permitieron cambiar su economía, cancelo sus deudas, y le ofrece a su familia una alimentación más adecuada.
texts.en:
Jose decided to ask for another loan because the time to harvest his corn is coming up. He will use it to pay for laborers and a shelling machine, which will help him to meet his customers' orders and generate the income that he needs to be able to get his family ahead and continue investing in his business.

With the previous loan he was able to produce a lot, his sales have improved, and his extra profits allowed him to change his financial situation, cancel his debts and feed his family more adequately.

loans.use: to pay for labor and a shelling machine.

loans.name: Orlando Octavio

texts.es: El señor Orlando tiene un nivel de educación bachiller y viene de una familia trabajadora con buenos valores y buena administración de recursos económicos. Comenzó en su actividad desde hace 8 años, trabajando como chofer de taxi y poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia hasta que se volvió taxista independiente contando con su propia herramienta de trabajo la cual fue conseguida con sus recursos. Actualmente solicita un crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo, de esta forma lo tendrá en buenas condiciones y lograra ofrecer un servicio más eficiente para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Orlando, who has a high school diploma, comes from a hard-working family with good values and good financial management. 
 
He started working as a taxi driver 8 years ago, and little by little he gained experience until he became an independent driver with his own vehicle that he got with his earnings.

He is seeking a loan in order to perform maintenance on his vehicle so that he will have it in good condition.  This way, he will be able to offer more efficient service and improve his income.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Veronica Ormecinda

texts.es:
Verónica Ormecinda tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y esposo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pollos, patos y cuyes para cubrir parte de los gastos familiares, son una familia unida su esposo se dedica a brindar servicio de labores agrícolas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevo soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales así como para construir corrales para una mejor distribución de los mismos.
texts.en:
Verónica Ormecinda is 33 years old and lives with her son and husband in the Oyotun district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's northern coast. The people in Verónica's local area have businesses and work in agriculture and cattle raising. 

Verónica makes a living raising and selling young animals, such as chickens, ducks and guinea pigs, in order to cover some household costs. Verónica's family is very close; her husband does farming work. Verónica has applied for a loan of 3000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy feed to fatten up her animals. She will also build pens in order to have more space for the animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus menores hijos en el caserío de Contando, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso, su población dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios como maestro de obra en construcción civil, realizando tarrajeo, acentado de ladrillo, llenado de bases, enchapado de cerámica, entre otras actividades, desde hace 13 años por lo que es muy conocido en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas que le permitan realizar de una mejor manera su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jesús is 37 years old and lives with his wife and young children in Contando village, a rural area in the Pucará district two hours from the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern highlands.
