Here the climate is warm and the people make a living with businesses and in agriculture and cattle raising.

Jesús makes a living as a builder. He does threading work, brick-laying, tiling and other work. He has been doing this for 13 years and so is well-known in the area. Jesús has applied for a loan of 800 Nuevo Soles in order to buy tools that will allow him to do his job better.

loans.use: to buy building tools.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll, age 41, is from Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a parent bravely raising 2 children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Cheryll is now trying to expand her pig business. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of  50,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to purchase piglets to raise. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well-known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers. 

With her extra income, she wishes to send all of her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Eddy Enrique

texts.es: Eddy tiene 36 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Casado y padre de cuatro hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta y compra de piedra canteras. Negocio que inicio hace varios años;  con dinero propio obtenido en su trabajo en el exterior, el cual logro comprar un camión. Tiempo después, decide tener su propio negocio. Hoy en día cuenta con su negocio de piedras canteras, el cual sale a vender con su camión. Su meta próxima es seguir vendiendo piedras canteras. Solicita un crédito para la comprar de un turbo, con el fin de que su camión tenga la potencia necesaria para cargar las piedras que vende. Estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá salir a vender a otros lugares de la ciudad y así, podrá crecer aún más en el negocio. Su plan futuro es tener un nuevo crédito para comprar una camioneta.
texts.en: Eddy is 36 years old and originally from the city of Boaca. He is married and has four children. He is a businessman, making a living buying and selling quarry stones. Eddy started this business some years ago. With money which he had earned working abroad, Eddy was able to buy a lorry and some time after buying it he started the business. He now goes out to sell the quarry stones in his vehicle. Eddy's goal is to continue with his business. He is applying for a loan in order to buy a turbocharger so that his vehicle will be powerful enough to carry the stones. Eddy thinks that this loan will help him to head out to other areas of the city and, thus, his business will grow even more. Eddy's future plan is to applying for a new loan to buy a small lorry.

loans.use: to buy a turbocharger.

loans.name: Lauren Teresa

texts.es: Lauren es una joven de 21 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos a cargo. Originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de cosméticos. Inicio este negocio hace cuatro años, con el apoyo de sus papas. Con pocas mercaderías de cosméticos, instala su negocio, y poco a poco fue comprando productos para su pulpería. Hoy en día cuenta con dos negocios prósperos y muy demandados. Su meta próxima es expandir su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: cosméticos, joyería de plata, perfumes, cremas para la piel, entre otros, con el fin de ofertar una variedad de productos. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá abastecer con los pedidos de sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es poner una librería y mantener siempre su pulpería.
texts.en: Laura is 21 years old, single and has no children. She is originally from the city of Managua and is now a businesswoman, with a grocery store and also selling make-up. Laura started her business four years with her parents' support. With just a few cosmetic products, she opened her business and, little by little, started buying items for her grocery store. Laura now has two popular and prosperous businesses. Her next goal is to expand her business. She is applying for this loan in order to buy make-up, silver jewellery, perfumes, skin creams and more. With these items she can offer variety of products to her customers. Laura thinks that this loan will be of great help as she will be able to stock up with order for her customers and earn better profits. Laura's plan for the future is to keep her grocery store going and to have a bookshop.

loans.use: to buy make-up, silver jewellery, perfumes, skin creams and more.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Najah is a 34-year-old married woman from Attel village near Tulkarm city. She is a mother for six sons and three daughters. Najah's husband is a construction worker. He takes a low and unstable income because the demand decreases in the winter. He also has a small gifts shop where he sells some stationary and other cosmetics products. Najah and her husband works in their store. It is a good business and earns a good income, but still needs some improvements.
 
Najah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband buy more products for their gifts store to resell. This will increase their sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more products for the gift store to resell.

loans.name: Etelvina De Jesus

texts.es:
Etelvina, necesita capital para invertir en la siembra de verano compra semilla, abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes y plaguicidas, ya que son los insumos necesarios para dar mantenimiento al terreno donde cultiva maíz.
La ayuda que obtuvo al hacer uso del crédito anterior ha sido una abundante producción, granos de calidad, sus ganancias son mayores, su familia se encuentra muy saludable brindándole apoyo para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Etelvina needs capital to invest in her summer planting. She will buy seeds, compost, insecticides, fertilizers and pesticides, since those are the inputs she needs to maintain the land where she grows corn.

The previous loan helped her to produce a lot of high-quality grains and her income increased. Her family is very healthy, giving her support to continue working.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, insecticides, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Lex Tony

texts.es:
Lex vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, es profesor de un instituto técnico de su ciudad, pero para poder tener más ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia y poder solventar los gastos del hogar, tiene su negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos, entre otros artículos de vestir, con lo cual tiene un ingresos mas para su familia.

Lex está agradecido con los prestamistas ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para si negocio como sandalias, polos, entre otros, así podrá atender los pedidos de sus clientes y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una casa de material noble”.
texts.en: Lex lives in Pucallpa and is a teacher at a technical institute in the city. In order to earn more money to help out his family and cover their household costs, he also has a business selling clothing, shoes and other garments. Lex is grateful to the lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy more merchandise for his business, like sandals, t-shirts and other things so that he can meet the demands of his customers and keep working to realize his dream of having a home made out of durable materials.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Lenie

texts.en:
Maria Lenie is 45 years old.  She is married and a resident of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She earns a living through fish vending and uses the proceeds from her business to sustain the needs of her family.  She has been a fish vendor for almost three years.

She has been a member of PMPC for almost four years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative.  At this time, she is applying for a loan of 14,500 PHP in order to purchase "banyeras" (big basin) of fish to sell through her business, which is the primary source of her livelihood.

Maria Lenie deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: América Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora América se encuentra 5 años formando parte del grupo de crédito El Cisne, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una belleza natural y de verdes campos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, su mayor fuente de ingresos es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.
La Señora América tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en escuela, su esposo es albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña América se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, como pasa en casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos, también a la agricultura que es para su hogar y también vende. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción para terminar su casa. Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
América has been a part of the credit union, El Cisne [The Swan], for five years. During this time, she has become good friends with the other members. She lives in Parroquia del Valle [Parish of the Valley] in Cuenca; a place that reaps natural beauty, green countrysides, and a architecture mixed of modern and traditional styles.Her people maintain their culture and traditions.

America is 31 years old and married. Throughout her marriage, she has born three children who are now 13, 10 and six years old. Her eldest daughter is in high school and her younger two children are in primary school. Her husband is a construction worker and they live in their own home.

Her strongest source of income is farming, breeding animals, and sales. América takes care of the household chores, breeds guinea pigs and chickens, and grows food for her home and for sale. 

The money from her loan will be used to buy construction materials to finish their house. Her dream is for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is divorced and has three children. After completing primary school, Comfort couldn't continue her education because of financial constraints. She is now an established petty trader. Comfort is involved in preparing and selling palm oil in Ve-deme (near Hohoe). She has been actively involved in this business for about 15 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Comfort uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Comfort will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of palm fruits, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to diversify the profit to selling plastic bowls and containers, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruits, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Rarotonga

texts.en: Rarotonga is 38 years old and married with eight children. She owns and operates a small store selling items such as sugar, salt, tauaga, vegetables, handicrafts and products used daily.  She has been doing this for many years. Rarotonga needs a loan to buy cement, iron roofing, wire, nails and timber. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business."

loans.use: to buy cement, iron roofing, wire, nails and timber.

loans.name: Siamoa

texts.en: Siamoa is a 31-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Siamoa has requested a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, filings, bush knives and a rake. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Siamoa hopes to improve her savings to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, filings, bush knives and a rake

loans.name: Maaola

texts.en: Maaola is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Maaola has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, spades and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Maaola hopes to improve her business and support her parents.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, spades and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en: Vasati is a 37-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Vasati has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, spades and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Vasati hopes to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, spades and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Puniloa

texts.en: Puniloa is a 67-year-old woman who is widowed with 3 children. She runs a small sewing business in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Puniloa has requested a loan to buy materials, sewing machine, timber, nails, cement and iron roofing. She plans to use her profits to improve her housing and pay for her fees. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, a sewing machine, timber, nails, cement and iron roofing

loans.name: Galu

texts.en: Galu is a 73-year-old widowed woman with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Galu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an ax.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Galu hopes to improve her housing and support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, timber, nails, bush knives and an ax.

loans.name: Gerald's Group

texts.en:
Bidii is a group of seven group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Gerald selected as the Kiva representative. Gerald has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 58 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Gerald is 50 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years. Gerald works as a farmer to provide for his six children. The community and other farmers know Gerald as friendly and hardworking. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community, such as in the men's group and the savings group.  Gerald described his harvest last year as good, but he hopes that he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.							

Gerald first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Gerald joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods and earn enough to feed his family  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. Gerald plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Gerald’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest and was able to save money. 

Gerald and the Bidii Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Martha Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por tener suelos fértiles, también se puede encontrar grandes depósitos de ripio, arena y piedra, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región del mismo nombre, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodega donde vende abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa y artículos de aseo, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace más de 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercaderia para abastecer su negocio y atender las diversas necesidades de sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 39, lives with her children in the Nueva Arica district.  The residents of this area work in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.  This community is known for its fertile soil, and also has large deposits of gravel, sand and stone.  It is located in Chiclayo province in the region of the same name, on the northern coast of Peru.

Genoveva has a store where she sells groceries such as: milk, cooking oil, rice, sugar, soft drinks, and toiletries.  She's had this business for more than 10 years.  Genoveva is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy merchandise to stock her store so that she can meet the diverse needs of her customers and in doing so earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, es una joven de 31 años de edad, estudia la carrera de Lic. en administración turística y hotelera, cuenta con el respaldo y  apoyo económico de sus padres, en la actualidad no ha podido encontrar un empleo formal por no contar con un titulo universitaria, y ella tiene muchos deseos de obtener sus propios ingresos para apoya a su familia. Por este motivo solicita el apoyo de crédito para el pago del curso de titulación, y poder salir adelante por sus propios meritos.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a young woman of 31. She is enrolled in an undergraduate program in tourism and hotel administration. She depends on her parents for financial support. She has been unable to find formal employment due to not having a university degree, but she has a strong desire to earn her own income and support her family. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to pay for her tuition, and thus be able to get ahead through her own achievements.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Imelda is borrowing PHP 7,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stock of personal products to sell to customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Wilmer Mauricio

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 38 años de edad, padre soltero de un hijo. Originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repuestos para vehículos. Negocio que inicio hace varios años; como ayudante de su papa, luego decide independizarse y tener su propio negocio en otra ciudad. Hoy en día cuenta con su local diversificado y rentable. Su meta próxima es tener otro local de repuesto en otra ciudad. Solicita un crédito para comprar: aceite, lubricantes, bomba de  frenos para vehículo, mangueras para frenos de vehículo, entre otros, con el fin de garantizar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que crecerá su negocio y podrá obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Wilmer is 38-years old and the single father of one son.  He is a native of Boaco.  He is a shop owner.  He makes his living selling spare parts for vehicles, a business he started a few years ago.  He started out helping his father, then later decided to go out on his own and have his own business in another city.  Today, Wilmer's shop is diversified and profitable.  His next goal is to have another spare parts shop in another city.  He is requesting the loan to purchase oil, lubricants, a brake booster, brake hoses and other items, to the end of guaranteeing good service to his customers.  Wilmer thinks that the loan will be helpful to him as it will grow his business and he will be able to earn a better profit.  Wilmer's plan for the future is to keep growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase oil, lubricants, a brake booster, brake hoses and other items.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 50-year-old married man from Deir el Balah city. He is a father for three sons and one daughter. Two of his sons work in the construction field. For the past two years, Mustafa has been working on a rickshaw he partially owns. He transfers goods for wholesale traders and distributes to the retailers. He works very long hours to provide his family all they need.

Mustafa took a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay for the rest of the rickshaw he works on so he will own it completely. By taking this loan, Mustafa's income will increase.

Mustafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for the rest of the rickshaw he works on so he will own it completely.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 48-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father for two sons and one daughter. Abdallah works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Abdallah has some health problems, especially in his back. He needs to do an urgent surgery to get back to work. 

Abdallah took a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the hospital expenses and the travel costs. By taking this loan, Abdallah's health situation will be better, and he can get back to work and do his daily activity.

Abdallah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay hospital expenses and the travel costs.

loans.name: Qusay

texts.en:
Qusay is a 45-year-old married man from Attel village, Near Tulkarem. He is a father of five sons and three daughters. Qusay is a worker in the construction field. His income is low and unstable. Three years ago, Qusay opened a linen store. He imports his products from outside of Palestine. It is a good business and it is the only store of this kind in his area.
 
Qusay took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more linen products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Qusay's sales and income will increase.

Qusay appears in the photo while he was in his store.

loans.use: to buy more linen products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Kudawu

texts.en:
Kudawu is involved in selling cassava and corn dough in Ve-deme (near Hohoe). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a petty trader) support their four children. She has been involved in selling cassava and corn dough and charcoal for five years now. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of bags of maize and charcoal, thus helping her to sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her charcoal enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and charcoal.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Aba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba sells charcoal at Abura Edukrom, Cape Coast. She has been doing so for about 25 years. As a widow with four children, she uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

Aba will use the loan to purchase large bags of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase large bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is 31 years old, female and married. She has three children, 17, 15 and 10 years old respectively, whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, and she is a fishmonger. She has been in this business for 13 years, and it is located at Marereni. In her business, she earns a monthly income of 7,550 KES (Kenyan shillings). She is taking her second loan of 20,000 KES, which she intends to use for adding stock to her business by buying more fish. 

Sidi will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es: Israel, es habitante del municipio de Juigalpa, un joven que a sus 28 años es un padre responsable, tiene 2 hijos pequeños,  que asisten a la escuela, es casado su esposa es ama de casa y se dedica a criar gallinas y cerdos, Israel trabaja como comerciante que en su gran mayoría vende productos perecederos como frutas y verduras en el poblado de manera ambulante, también viaja a los pueblos cercanos, a veces le va bien y otras con costo obtiene para el pasaje de regreso. Actualmente se encuentra escaso de productos, por el cual solicita el crédito para invertir y poder expandirse y hacer nueva clientela para incrementar las ventas, de esta manera mejorar su economía y apoyar más a su familia.
texts.en:
Israel lives in the municipality of Juigalpa, He is a 28 year old responsible father of two small children who go to school. He is married and his wife takes care of the house and  raises chickens and pigs. Israel works as a businessperson who mainly sell perishables like fruit and vegetables door-to-door in the community. He also goes to the surrounding villages. Sometimes it goes well and other times he barely makes the money to pay for his way home. 

At this time he is short of produce so he is requesting a loan to invest and be able to expand his business. He can find new customers and increase his sales. In this way he can improve his finances and provide for his family better.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and basic grains.

loans.name: Komiti

texts.en: Komiti is a 34-year-old woman, who is single with three children.  She runs a business designing elei materials in her community. She has many years of experience with this business.  Komiti has requested a loan to buy materials, paints, brushes and a board.  She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, materials, brushes and a design board.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en: Lesina is a 42-year-old, married woman with six children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living.  She has been doing this for many years.  Lesina has requested a loan to buy chemicals, filings, a wheelbarrow and some taro roots. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Lesina hopes to improve her housing and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, filings, a wheelbarrow and some taro roots.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, opta por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de repollo, plátano, aceite, yuca, vinagre, con lo que seguirá aumentado su producción de antojitos típicos y por consiguiente se mantendrá trabajando sin ninguna limitante.
Con el préstamo anterior el servicio que da a sus clientes es mucho mejor, tiene muchos clientes nuevos, sus ventas aumentaron, su situación económica ha mejorado y con esto puede continuar cumpliendo con los diferentes compromisos económicos que tiene.
texts.en: Ana has decided to request another loan to invest in buying cabbage, plantains, oil, yucca and vinegar. She wants to continue to expand her production of traditional food and as a result be able to continue working without restrictions. With the last loan she improved the service offered to her clients a lot. She has many new customers, her sales increased and her economic situation is better. So she was able to meet all the economic commitments that she had.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, plantain, oil, yucca and vinegar.

loans.name: Annis Navel

texts.es:
Annis Navel tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el Caserío La Toma, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Piura, que pertenece a la Región del mismo nombre, en la costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedican a la preparación y venta de alimentos y bebidas, cuantan con clientela fija, son una familia que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, su esposo también se dedica a la venta de plátano, Annis ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos y de esta manera poder atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Annis Navel is 52 years old and lives with her husband in Caserío La Toma, a rural area in the Buenos Aires district, belonging to the Piura region and province which is located on the northern coast of Peru. Her village works in agriculture, business and ranching. 

Alongside her husband, Annis works preparing and selling food and drinks to an established group of customers. They are family who works hard at what they do. Her husband also works selling plantains.

Annis has applied for a loan of 3000 Nuevo Soles to buy food provisions to prepare food so that she can attend to her customers.

loans.use: to buy food provisions to prepare meals

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
This is Bernarda. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used buy different products like vegetables, vinegar, dried fish and some grocery items for her store. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
Bernarda would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more products like vegetables, vinegar, dried fish and some grocery items for her store. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bernarda hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different products like vegetables, vinegar, dried fish and some grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel has been restoring vehicles since the age of 15, and with your help, he hopes to make his favorite hobby into his livelihood! Alchemy Motorcycles started when Michel’s brother purchased several 1970s “Café Racers” from a scrap yard. These small, yet nimble motorcycles were often used to navigate the narrow streets and alleyways of Europeans cities. Though the motorcycles were beat up, Michel quickly saw that with a little tender love and care, these old eyesores could be restored and sold as classic beauties.

The entire restoration process of chroming parts, leather-working and engine construction takes as long as eighty hours per vehicle. Michel is able to complete two motorcycles restorations per month, doing all of the work by hand. 

Michel’s venture has not been without its challenges. Most of the parts required to restore the bikes have been obsolete for decades, and the learning curve on some of the repair processes for them is tremendous. Still, there is nothing more satisfying for Michel than to see a finished bike restored to its former glory.

“I love seeing the final result of all my hard work,” he says. “I’m just a simple guy trying to do simple things.”

With business slowly growing, Michel hopes to expand, and will use his $5,000 Kiva loan to purchase additional fabrication equipment and accounting software, and to overhaul his website. He also plans to teach his brother the skills he has learned in order to increase his rate of production.

Michel dreams of one day having his own shop with his brother, from which he can fully provide for his wife and two children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrication equipment and accounting software, and to overhaul his website.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra tiene 26 años y es casada con 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa infantil que se encuentran en zona Pacajes, este préstamo este prestamos es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Sandra invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería de temporada por las fiestas de fin de año para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo, señora Sandra enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que tiene que luchar contra la competencia que existe en la  zona, especialmente en las ferias que es cuando tiene que realizar el doble de esfuerzo en atraer clientes,  va a utilizar los beneficios en abastecerse de mercadería, como ropa, prendas navideñas, etc. la señora Sandra desea que su negocio vaya en crecimiento, de esta manera podrá generar mejores ingresos y reinvertirlos en el mismo negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Sandra is 26 years old, married and has four children.  She sells children’s clothing in the Pacajes zone.  This is her first loan through the institution and Sandra will use the money to buy seasonal merchandise for the end of year festivals.  She asked for the loan because she needs capital.  Sandra has challenges in her business, such as having to deal with the competition in the area, especially at the fairs.  This is when she has to double her effort to attract customers.  She will use the benefits to stock up on merchandise such as clothing, Christmas outfits, etc.  Sandra wants her business to grow and in this way she can generate more income and reinvest into her business to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, está dispuesta a invertir en su negocio de sastrería por lo que comprara botones, hilos, zipper, broches y telas, para continuar realizando su trabajo, con estos implementos podrá seguir cumpliendo a tiempo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Para María fue de mucho beneficio el préstamo anterior, ya que pudo adquirir los insumos necesarios para continuar laborando, sus ganancias aumentaron lo que le ha ayudado a cancelar sus deudas y mejorar las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Maria is ready to invest into her tailoring business and will buy buttons, thread, zippers, fasteners, and fabrics to continue her work.  These things will allow her to complete her customer orders on time.

The previous loan was of great benefit to Maria and she was able to buy the necessary supplies to continue working.  Her earnings increased and it helped her pay off her debts and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa is a 63-year-old married woman with one child. 

Temukisa has a small plantation and grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Temukisa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed-sprayer, fertilizers, banana and taro crops, bush knives, a backpack sprayer and boots.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Temukisa hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weedspray, fertilizers, banana/taro crops, bush knives, a backpack sprayer and boots

loans.name: Moana

texts.en:
Moana is 37 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. Moana has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, a torch, hooks, goggles and a spear. 

Moana joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Moana will improve her house and save more for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, a torch, hooks, goggles, and a spear

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn owns a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell in the local community to earn a living. She has been engaged in farming for more than four years, earning well to provide the family, and has successfully repaid her previous loan used on the farm. 

Jonalyn has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. To improve their living, Jonalyn and her partner have decided to engage in a fishing business. Without hesitation, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy a new fishing boat.

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing boat

loans.name: Cecilia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Cecilia, se dispone mejorar el inventario de su comedor y la tienda, es por eso que solicita un nuevo crédito para adquirir carnes arroz, frijol, aceite, sal y azúcar, le servirá para ofrecer nuevos productos a sus clientes, seguir manteniendo su fidelidad y continuar creciendo económicamente.
Con el crédito anterior mejoro la atención hacia sus clientes, aumento sus ventas y sus ganancias aumentaron y le están permitiendo cancelar de manera responsable las deudas y continua luchando por dar un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Cecilia is ready to increase the inventory of her eatery and store. So she is requesting a new loan to acquire meat, rice, oil, beans, salt and sugar. She can then offer new products to her customers, maintain their loyalty and continue growing economically.  With the previous loan she was able to improve the service for her customers, increasing her sales and profits. This allowed her to pay off her debt in a responsible manner and continue to struggle to give a better lifestyle to her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more eggs and grocery items for her business. She has this business for ten years now. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her child. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more eggs and grocery items needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more eggs and grocery items needed in her business.

loans.name: Manoka

texts.en: Manoka is 45 years old and married with three children. She is married to 52-year-old Somaru. Manoka is illiterate but knows how to sign her name while her husband passed class VI (grade 6). All of their children are studying in school. Manoka has an animal husbandry business where she works sincerely and her husband is a farmer. They live in a small village at Dhupguri in a Kaccha house made of straw and mud. They have a small plot of land where her husband cultivates crops. As the plot is their own, the entire profit is theirs. Manoka has taken the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to grow potatoes to enhance their business. She dreams of giving a good and bright future to her children and she wants to shift to a pakka house (made of bricks) with the profit from her business. She is also interested in buying a tractor for her cultivation. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for extending their helping hand.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Liai

texts.en: Liai is a 37-year-old, married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Liai has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, filings, bush knives and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Liai hopes to improve her house and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, filings, bush knives and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 55-year-old married man from Attel village near Tulkarm. He is a father of one son and four daughters. Saleh is a worker in the construction field. His income is low and unstable due to the low demand in the winter. His son helps him with his work. They work in construction workshops inside and outside Tulkarm.
 
Saleh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new cement mixer for his business. He will use it in his business instead of renting one. By taking this loan, Saleh's business and his income will improve.

Saleh appears in the photo at the worksite.

loans.use: to buy a new cement mixer for his business

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is 53 years old, female and married. She has one child who is 20 years old, whom she supports. She has run a grocery business for twelve years now.  She earns a monthly income of ksh 4500.  She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a Kadet officer, and she is taking a first loan of Ksh 10,000 from Kadet. She intends to use it to buy more coconuts, tomatoes, potatoes, peppers and onions.   She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open another grocery business and also make sure her child gets an education.

loans.use: To buy coconuts, tomatoes, potatoes, peppers and onions to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline owns and operates a dressmaking business, where she manufactures and sells clothing products and has been doing this for more than twenty one years. She sells bed sheets, curtains and pillow cases as ordered by her customers and she earns well that she had successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used her previous loan in purchasing some materials used in her sewing business. Recently, she borrowed another loan in order to buy fabrics. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna has owned and operated a retail store, selling some fruits and grocery products, for more than seven years, earning well for the family. She was able to successfully repay her previous loan from GDMPC used for the business. 

Aside from this, she was also engaged in the breeding business using her boar in their community, and she earns a good income from this. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to repair the existing motor for boar breeding services. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair the existing motor for boar breeding services.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Isatu. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 11. In 2006, Isatu established her food stuff business. She began her business just to actualize her dreams of independence. Her business is located at a city center, and her main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 650,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Isatu has already received, and successfully repaid, four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy onions (for 2,000,000 SLL) and sacks of groundnuts (for 2,000,000 SLL). She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level, and hence her profit.

In the future, Isatu plans to educate her children, start selling on a wholesale basis, and complete the construction of her house. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and beans.

loans.name: Aleksan

texts.en:
Aleksan lives in the village of Gandzaqar in Tavush region. He works at the local radio station.  Aleksan is not married and he lives with his parents and grandfather, who is a pensioner and a very famous bee keeper in their village. Aleksan’s father from time to time goes to the Russian Federation to do  some construction work, but mainly he and his wife are engaged in farming.  Aleksan joins them also. On their farm they have cows, calves and chickens, but they have also another occupation in which they all are engaged.  They have a small workshop where they produce lemonade. Aleksan sells this lemonade to his region’s food markets and to a few fast food centers. Now Aleksan has some plans connected with both their farm and with their lemonade production.
He asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a cow, some animal fodder and also, with the coming of the New Year, to enlarge their business of lemonade production.

loans.use: to buy a cow, some animal fodder and also with coming of New Year and Christmas holidays to enlarge their business of lemonade production

loans.name: Mercedes Estela

texts.es:
Mercedes Estela tiene 24 años de edad vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Chulucanas, una comunidad que se caracteriza por la elaboración y venta de artesanías, agricultura y comercio, perteneciendo a la provincia de Morropon, que se encuentra en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una tienda ubicada en su domicilio, que se dedican a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropa de temporada primavera – verano y de esta manera poder abastecer su negocio para atender a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes Estela is 24 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Chulucanas district, a community known for its art creation and sales, farming, and other merchants.  It’s part of the Morropon province and is located in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

She has a store in her home, where she sells men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing.  She is a very enterprising mother and is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to buy seasonal spring-summer clothing and in this way be able to stock her store so she can serve her customers and generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy farming materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and for their personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy  fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cecilia hopes to have more seeds and crops to plant and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also, to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a member of this group in Kakamega North District.  She is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 56 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Margaret has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Margaret is married and has two children.  She is 45 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and savings group.  Margaret has been a farmer for 22 years.  Margaret described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and send children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member, who wants to help more farmers.  Margaret plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school and save for the future.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Margaret’s own life was improved because she has more farm training, able to save money and feed the family. 
 							
Margaret and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John was born in Kisii, Kenya, and moved to Nairobi, the capitol city, in 2007 in search of a job. He settled in the expansive informal settlement of Mukuru Kwa Njenga with his family. He currently owns several businesses and intends to start a new partnership in the sanitation sector. 

John noticed the sanitation issue in his area and wanted to be a part of the solution to this issue. He intends to install one Fresh Life toilet for his tenants in Mukuru kwa Njenga informal settlement in Nairobi. He hopes that his tenants will lead a more comfortable life once the toilet is built. John hopes that in future he will own more rental property and install more Fresh Life sanitation facilities for his tenants.

loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet

loans.name: Umee  Kalsoom

texts.en:
Umee Kalsoom is a 48-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband from the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and grain to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and grain

loans.name: Anaiz

texts.es:
Anaiz es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Me llamo Anaiz, tengo 21 años, mi estado civil es soltera, mexicana, estudiante de la licenciatura de derecho, vivo en el Estado de México en casa de mis padres. Necesito el crédito para invertir en, abarrotes, cerveza y verdura. El negocio es una tienda de abarrotes donde vendemos abarrotes, cremería, verdura, cerveza en algunas ocasiones pollo y dulces, el negocio esta ubicado en una avenida principal y lo iniciamos hace hace 5 años, afortunadamente tenemos muchos clientes. Mis padres se dedican desde hace 10 años a la venta de abarrotes y yo inicie desde hace 5 años. Mis principales logros son que el negocio ha crecido y sigue prosperando, los retos son seguir creccindo como negocio y tener otra tienda.
texts.en:
Anaiz is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

My name is Anaiz.  I’m 21 years old, single, Mexican, a law student, and I live in the State of Mexico with my parents.  I need this loan to buy groceries, beer, and vegetables.  My business is a grocery store where we sell groceries, cream, vegetables, beer, and sometimes chicken and candy.  The business is located on a main street and we started it five years ago.  Fortunately we have many customers.  My parents have been selling groceries for ten years and I started five years ago.  My main achievements are having grown this business and I continued to succeed.  The challenges are continuing to grow as a business and opening another store.

loans.use: to buy groceries and vegetables.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Debora, who is in her mid 30s, is single with a son and daughter, both of whom are in school. For eight years now, Debora has had a fresh water fish-selling business where she buys and fries them from noon until midnight. She own two fish-selling branches where is able to generate an excellent monthly profit. Debora is working hard to see her business doing great.

This will be her seventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she bought stock for her business, paid business helpers and opened her second fish-selling branch.

She used her business profit to build a house, buy a TV, cupboard, sofa set, nice table and digital TV deck. She is so proud with Tujijenge's financial support which has improved her family and business. 

Debora will use her share of this loan to buy a business freezer. She dreams of opening a wholesale fish butcher shop. She will share this loan with her loan group "Kilombero" which consist of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy a business freezer.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a provisions seller located in Twifo praso. She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a draftsman. She has been selling provisions for some years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of soft drinks, groceries, biscuits, Milo, milk, and sweets, etc, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. Janet hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of soft drinks, groceries, biscuits, Milo, milk, and sweets, etc, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Musu. She is married and has three children, ages 12, 20, and 26. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to help a sister with her education. 

In 2005, Musu established her provisions, beverages, cosmetics, drinks and toiletries business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant and help the retired husband with running the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are adults.

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,098,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Musu has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy drinks. 

She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and increase the profit. In the future, Musu plans to expand the business to sell and recharge cards. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks, cosmetics, beverages and toiletries.

loans.name: Avetis

texts.en:
Avetis lives in Kapan, which is in Syunik region. Avetis is married and he has two daughters, both of whom work at the shop as managers. His wife works at the social fast food center as a chef’s assistant. Avetis works at the ambulance service as a driver. He works four days a week. Days that he does not work he rents a car and gives taxi services, but, as he says, the income is just miserable.  Nearly half of the income he pays to the owner of the car. So like many other families, his family finds it hard to make a living and still lives with a shortage of money.
He asks for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a car of his own. In this way he can work on his own and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy a car of his own and in this way to work on his own and earn more money

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en: Zahara is 36 years old, female and married. She has four children, 14,12, 9 and 4 years, respectively whom she supports. She runs a grocery business which has lasted for four years now.  She earns a monthly income of ksh 3500.  She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a Kadet officer and she is taking a first loan from Kadet of ksh.10,000.  She intends to use it to buy more vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, peppers and onions.  She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.  Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open another grocery business and also make sure her children  are educated.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, peppers and onions to sell to her buyers.

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of eight group leader farmers in Chwele District, with Janepher selected as the Kiva representative.  Janepher has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 96 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Janepher is married and has five children. She is 39 years old and is known as hardworking. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, and she is also a community health worker. Janepher has been a farmer for 10 years.  Janepher described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre fund.  Janepher’s life has improved because she bought a cow.  							
							
Janepher first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2007 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Janepher joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and new farming methods.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and  spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Janepher plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Janepher’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, and was able to save money.  			

Janepher and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to have access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma operates a retail business selling homemade products in her village to make a living. She has been doing this for more than two years, earning enough for her daily needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used in her business. Recently, she had borrowed a new loan to purchase additional raw ingredients in order to cater orders from customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia has always dreamed of one day owning her own business. Growing up as a child in Tijuana, she actively participated in many initiatives to keep her city clean. After moving to the United States, she worked as a cleaner for a property manager but ultimately felt that the quality of service they provided to customers left much to be desired. This motivated her to launch her own janitorial service, Cleaning San Diego, an eco-friendly cleaning service where customer satisfaction is top priority.

Since starting, Sofia has experienced steady growth in her business, and although she admits to having growing pains with budgeting for equipment, she is optimistic that her uniquely green cleaning service will ultimately be a success. She said, “I love helping promote going green and cleanliness in the community.” 

Sofia is also a graduate of the Accion Academy for Entrepreneurial Success, an 8-week entrepreneurship course that walks students from business plan to launch. Upon successful completion of the course, students receive a business loan of up to $5,000. Sofia is confident that the academy has given her the boost needed to make her start-up a success.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Sofia will use her $2,500 Kiva loan to purchase additional cleaning equipment that will enable her to service larger spaces. Your contribution will help this budding entrepreneur achieve financial independence! 

In the future, Sofia hopes to have up to 10 cleaners working with her, expanding the services her company offers to commercial cleaning, solar panel cleaning and government contracts.

loans.use: to purchase additional cleaning equipment

loans.name: Monica Patricia

texts.es:
Monica es una joven con muchas ganas de mejorar cada día, trabaja como obrera en una pequeña fábrica de sacos, con lo cual reunió dinero y pudo con mucho esfuerzo, iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual ya lleva un año de funcionamiento, Monica cree que le está yendo bien porque es amable con los clientes.

Monica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, pro saco y comprar productos para bazar como adornos, regalos, entre otros, ya que esta próxima la campaña navideña y de esta manera quiere mejorar sus ventas, así ella seguirá trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”
texts.en:
Monica is a young woman with a great desire to improve herself every day.  She works in a small suit factory where she was able to save up money and with great effort was able to start her grocery store business one year ago.  Monica believes that things have been going well for her because she is friendly to her customers.

Monica is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to them she will be able to buy rice, sugar, noodles, pro saco, decorations, gifts, and other things for the upcoming Christmas campaign.  She wants to improve her sales and continue working to make her greatest dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs and to repair her sandwich cart.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is a 41-year-old married woman and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for ten years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Sakina was not earning her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner, as her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Sakina felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders so she applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes  qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente et solidarité les membres. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ramatoulaye  (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 28 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02enfants  (01 garçon et 01 fille). Elle fait des jus de fruit à base de produits locaux feuille de bissap, pain de singe, racine de gingembre et de tamarin qu’elle vent chez elle dans son quartier et au marché central. Elle vend aussi de la glace dans son quartier. 

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en bissap pour un demi-sac à 9 000 Frs CFA, en pain de singe par sac de 8 000 Frs CFA caisse, du sucre pour 22 500 Frs CFA et des emballages et divers ingrédients.
 
Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari  dans la gestion des besoins de la famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en: This group is made up of very active women in a banc villageois created in December 2010. They meet under the protective wing of the women, who all come from the same neighborhood and who have good understanding and solidarity between the members. As their main money-making activity, they have small businesses. Ms. Ramatoulaye (seated to the far right with her left hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 28 years of age, married and the mother of two children (one boy and one girl). She makes fruit juice from local produce, like hibiscus flowers, baobab fruit, ginger root and tamarin, which she sells from her home in her neighborhood and at the central market. She also sells ice cream in her neighborhood. With this loan, she expects to stock up on a half of a bag of hibiscus flowers at 9,000 francs CFA, baobab fruit by the bag for 8,000 francs CFA, a crate of sugar for 22,500 francs CFA, some packaging and various other ingredients. The profits from her business allow her to support her husband in the management of the needs of her family and to reinforce her savings.

loans.use: to stock up on half of a bag of hibiscus flowers at 9,000 francs CFA, baobab fruit by the bag for 8,000 francs CFA, a crate of sugar for 22,500 francs CFA, some packaging and various other ingredients.

loans.name: Laine

texts.en: Laine is a 55-year-old single woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years. Laine has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knives, weedkillers, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Laine hopes to improve her business in order to gain more money to support her family as well as her children.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weedkillers, axes, rakes, etc

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna helps her husband to earn a living by operating their pedicab rental business in their village. She has been doing this for many years. She used her previous loan in this business and she has successfully repaid it. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase tires and accessories to improve their services. In the future, Lorna wants to make improvements to her house in order to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tires and accessories

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 36 years old, female and married. She has five (5) children that she supports. They are 11, 8, 5, 3 and 2 years, respectively.  She runs a grocery business that has lasted for 13 years now. .She earns a monthly income of KSHS 3,300. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer and she is taking her first loan of KSHS 10,000 to buy more vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, peppers, garlic, mangoes and carrots. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by making it into a wholesale business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open another grocery business and to make sure her children get a better education.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Musu Juliana

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Juliana. She is married and has one child, age 23. In 2000, Juliana established her patient medicines business. She began her business just to enable her to independently provide her household needs. Her business is located on the outskirts of town, and her main customers are all classes of business people. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 500,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.

Juliana has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy patient drugs. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level. In the future, Juliana plans to complete the construction of her home and to develop her drugstore into a pharmacy. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy patient drugs.

loans.name: Sayvali

texts.ru: Сайвали 64 года. Он из района Хамадони. Сайвали из тех людей, которые живут по-честному, и ведут законный образ жизни. У него есть семья, жена и семеро детей. Он работал в государственном учреждении 25 лет своей жизни. Сейчас он вышел на пенсию. Теперь у него много времени. Сайвали хочет начать бизнес по купле и продажи скотов, обоснования его вида деятельности требует немало денег. Чтобы купить не обходимое количество скотов понадобиться деньги, которых  у него не хватает. Сайвали просит в займы для приобретения скотов и начала бизнеса.
texts.en: Sayvali, age 64, comes from the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  He is one of those people who live an honest life and he always abides by the law.  He has a wife and seven children.  He has spent 25 years of his life working for a public administration. Now that he is retired, he has a lot of time on his hands.  He wants to get involved in buying and selling livestock, but launching such a business requires quite a bit of money.  Sayvali doesn't have enough money to buy the necessary number of animals to start his business, and this is why he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a new business.

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en: "Leonesa is a 19 year old single woman with 1 child. She has a small business selling earrings, clothes, shoes, and toys to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Leonesa has requested a loan to extend her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013 . With her profits, Leonesa hopes to support her family and extend her business."

loans.use: to buy for earings,clothes,shoes,sunglass,toys,etc

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en: Jovito is single. He worked in a private company to earn an income and now, he studies criminology. His father earns income from his work as a foreman so he find ways to pursue his dream. Jovito borrowed a loan from GDMPC to pay the school tuition fees; he has been a member for more than three years. Jovito hopes to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora has owned and managed her own farmland for many years, earning well for her family. She has also successfully repaid her previous loans used for her farm. Her determination to improve her farm encouraged her to apply for another loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. Flora is confident that she will have an abundant harvest and thereby gain more income, which will allow her to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita has sold fish in the market for many years and she earns well to support her family's needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC, which she used for business capital. Recently, she took another loan to purchase more variety of fish to resell. Being a member of GDMPC helps her improve her ability to engage in business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Jimsher

texts.en:
Jimsher, age 28, is a very kind and hardworking married man. He lives with his wife, parents and two children. The only one who makes money in the household is Jimsher’s father, who serves local people as a taxi driver with his own car. 

Jimsher is a manufacturer and used to work as a hired employee at a metal and plastic workshop. Now, he plans to start his own one and generate monthly income. To be able to start up his business, he is requesting a $1250 loan. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. With the amount he is asking for, Jimsher will buy materials for making doors and windows. He owns all the needed equipment for manufacturing and hopes his business will be lucrative. He will manufacture and sell them at a good price, because demand is high in the region. This loan will be a great help for Jimsher, to generate revenue and give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase materials for manufacturing windows and doors.

loans.name: Dickson's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four group leader farmers in Webuye District with Dickson selected as the Kiva representative.  Dickson has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right in the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 51 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
					
Dickson is 59 years old and has been a farmer for 30 years. Dickson works as a farmer to provide for his 10 children.  The community and other farmers know Dickson as hardworking, reliable and an experienced farmer.  In addition to farming, he is involved in his community's men's group and the burial committee.  Dickson described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Dickson joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Dickson joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices and send his children to school.  Because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Dickson has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Dickson's life because he has more profits from harvest and has more farm training. He was able to save money and feed the family.  In the future, Dickson hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and invest in a business.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Dickson and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.
