One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Samwel's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Samwel selected as the Kiva representative.  Samwel has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 58 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Samwel is 61 years old and has been a farmer for 35 years. Samwel works as a farmer to provide for his 10 children.  The community and other farmers know Samwel as friendly, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group.  Samwel described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.
							
Samwel joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Samwel joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  Because he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers, so Samwel has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Samwel's life because he has more profits from the harvest, has more farm training, and was able to save money and feed the family. In the future, Samwel hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, save for the future and buy a cow.  							

Samwel and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Benjamin's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six group leader farmers in Chwele District with Benjamin selected as the Kiva representative. Benjamin has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Benjamin also became a One Acre Fund group leader because he was chosen. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 60 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.	

Benjamin is a reliable member of the community. He is married with five children. Benjamin is 35 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 13 years to support his family. In addition to this, Benjamin is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group. He described his harvest last year as good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Benjamin’s first season with One Acre Fund. He first joined One Acre Fund in 2009 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. As an active member in his community, Benjamin also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers. Benjamin plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from his harvests and was able to save money.						

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Benjamin and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.		

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 55-year-old married woman. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Perveen is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history. Perveen expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend a part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттору 39 лет. Он из города Душанбе. В Душанбе у него есть жена и трое детей. Жизнь Абдусаттора связанна с дорогой. Он работает водителем маршрутки. По мнению Абдусаттора это хорошая работа с хорошим доходом. Он занимается этим делом более семи лет. Накопив деньги, собирается сделать ремонт своей маршрутки марки «Starex». Но финансово он не в состоянии реализовать задуманное. Абдусаттор просит в займы для того чтобы купить необходимые запчасти и доход от его деятельности вложить в бюджет семьи.
texts.en: Abdusattor, age 39, comes from the city of Dushanbe where he lives with his wife and his three children.  He spends much of his life on the road, working as a driver and transporting passengers in his mini-van.  Abdusattor is happy with his job and with the salary he makes.  He has been involved in this business for more than seven years.  He has already saved some money and would like to repair his "Starex" mini-van, but he is still not in a financial position to do so.  He is taking a loan to buy the necessary spare parts and will invest the earnings from his business to take care of his family's budget.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts in order to repair his mini-van.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: "Sau is a 50 year old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Sau has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011 . With the profits from her business Sau hopes to support her family, extend her business, and to save for emergencies."

loans.use: to buy for chemicals,bush knives,weed killer,axes,rakes etc

loans.name: Tevaga

texts.en: "Tevaga is a 32 year-old single woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Tevaga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knives, weedkiller, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits Tevaga hopes to improve her business and gain more money to support her family and her childrenl."

loans.use: to buy for chemicals,bush knives,weed killer,axes,rakes etc

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma raises livestock for sale and has been doing this for many years. She earns enough for their daily needs and she had successfully repaid her previous loan used for this business. Recently, she took another loan to purchase feed and additional mallards to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional mallards to raise

loans.name: Emie

texts.en: Emie operates a dried fish vending business to earn a living for more than six years. She has earned well for the family and she has successfully repaid her previous loans used for the business. To  purchase additional varieties of dried fish to resell, she took another loan from GDMPC micro finance recently. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of dried fish to resell

loans.name: Kaiyrkul

texts.ru: Кайыркул 59  лет, разведена, одна воспитала 4 детей. Все дети самостоятельные, женаты, проживают отдельно, только самый младший живет с Кайыркул и помогает по хозяйству. У Кайыркул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кайыркул занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кайыркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 12 овец, 23 козы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,0 ГА, на которой выращивает сено. Хозяйство хорошее, имеются все условия для содержания скота. Заготовлены 3 тележки сена и одна тонна ячменя для скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кайыркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -  покупку телят для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Кайыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kaiyrkul is 59, divorced, and raised four children by herself. All of her children are independent, married, and live on their own except for the youngest, who lives with Kaiyrkul and helps around the house. Kaiyrkul has a high school education and earns her living raising farm animals, which she began 13 years ago when she purchased cattle for 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Kaiyrkul now has 3 dairy cows, 12 sheep, 23 goats, and a one hectare plot for growing hay. It is a good farm with the right conditions for livestock. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her farm, Kaiyrkul asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase calves for fattening and resale. Kaiyrkul plans to invest the profits in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita has been selling vegetables in the market for more than six years, earning well for the family. She always finds ways to improve her garden and with Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) her needs are easier met. She took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides. In the future, she wants to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.ru: Ганчина 32 летняя жительница района Рудаки. Ганчина свободная девушка и  живет с родителями. Она ответственная и самостоятельная. Она работает продавщицей в одном из магазинов района Рудаки. Около 6 лет, Ганчина работает в сфере торговли, она арендовала место в магазине и занимается продажей одежды, детскими игрушками и парфюмерией. За столь время она успела освоить свою работу и получать от такой деятельности выгоду. Теперь Ганчина решила расширить свою деятельность, путем увеличения различности товара. Она собирается привести новый товар из рынка Корвон, города Душанбе и реализовать дальнейшую продажу в своей точке продажи. Но для привозки и купли товара у Ганчины не хватает средств, поэтому она решила обратиться за кредитом, с надеждой на помощь.
texts.en:
Ganjina is a 32-year-old resident of the Rudaki region. She is a free spirit who lives with her parents. She is also responsible and independent. Ganjina works as a saleswoman in one of the shops in the Rudaki region. For about six years, she has been in the business and has rented a space in a store where she sells clothing, children's toys and perfume.

During this time, she succeeded in mastering her work and making a good profit. Now she has decided to expand her business by enlarging her inventory. She plans to bring new goods from the Korvon market in Dushanbe. She doesn't have the means to buy more goods, so she decided to apply for a loan and hopes for your help.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: "Elisapeta is a 38 year old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy a chain saw, bush knives, axe, chemicals and to pay extra men to help out. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits Elisapeta hopes to improve her house and support her family."

loans.use: to buy a chain saw, bush knives, axe, chemicals and to pay workers

loans.name: Daniella

texts.en: "Daniella is a 19 year old single woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years . Daniella has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knives, weedkiller, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011 . With her profits Daniella hopes to improve her business to gain more money to support her family and her children."

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes etc

loans.name: Maria Olimpia

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar por iniciativa propia emprendió su negocio propio, el cual consiste en vender pupusas y comida, lo hace desde hace mucho tiempo, en sus inicios vendía solo pupusas pero poco a poco fue invirtiendo hasta que logro incluir la venta de comida.
Necesita invertir en la compra de frijol, arroz, maíz, chicharrón, aceite, bebidas, carnes, etc., que son parte de la materia prima para realizar ambas actividades, con lo que espera ofrecer un mejor servicio, aumentar sus ventas, continuar ampliando el negocio, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar su economía.
Aspira tener los recursos necesarios para comprar su propia casa y darles una educación universitaria a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is married and lives with her husband and children.  She started her own business so she could help with the household expenses.  She sells pupusas and food and has done so for a long time.  At first she only sold pupusas but little by little she invested and was able to add food sales.

She needs to buy beans, rice, corn, fried pork rinds, cooking oil, drinks, meats, etc., which are part of the supplies she needs for both activities, with which she expects to provide better service, increase her sales, continue to expand her business, attract new customers, and improve her finances.

She aspires to have the necessary resources with which to buy her own home and provide a university education for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rougui's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes  qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente et solidarité les membres. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Rougui (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 51 ans,  est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 garçons et 02 filles. Elle est vendeuse de tissus teintés. Elle achète le produit dans un pays de la sous région pour la revente soit au comptant ou à crédit de deux échéances selon les clients. Ce travail elle le fait avec l’appui de sa fille.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter au moins deux lots de six pièces pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’apporter son soutien à son mari en retraite dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group comprises women who are actively involved in their "banc villageois", created in December 2010.  All the members of the group come from the same neighborhood.  They get along well with one another and show great solidarity among themselves.  Their main activity is small retail business.

Rougui is the group's featured borrower.  In the photo, she is seated at the far right and raising her hand.  She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children (three boys and two girls).  She sells dyed fabrics.  She buys her goods in a village in her region and resells them for cash or on credit (with two installments) depending on her customers' needs.  She works with her daughter who assists her.

She plans to use her loan to buy two sets of textiles, each containing six pieces of fabric, for resale.

With the profits from her business, she will be able to help her husband who is retired, and contribute to the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy at least two sets of textiles, each set containing six pieces of fabric, for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2008 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 
She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 intended to buy materials for her metal craft business. She has been in the business for 5 years. To answer the needs of the increasing demand of her family, she also plans to have a sari-sari (general) store business.
Rosa dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for the metal craft business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general) store, selling both food & daily use products in the local community for more than six years. She earns well for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in her business for capital. 

In 2009, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Recently, she took a new loan again to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem, 33, is married and the mother of four children. She started her business selling bangles a year ago and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She buys bangles from wholesale markets at lower rates and sells them to the people of her community at a profit. By this time, she has developed a regular list of customers. 

Shameem has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colours and designs. This investment will help her increase her sales.  

She is in her seventh loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colours and designs.

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Al noroccidente de La  Provincia de Pichincha tenemos el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos en el mismo vive y trabaja Mariela una joven de 21 años, ella mantiene una relación en unión libre de la cual tienen una hija de 4 años.  Ella viene de una familia humilde de bajos recursos, ha tenido varios obstáculos uno de ellos fue el no haber podido estudiar, por la mala situación económica por la que atravesaba su familia. 
En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos por catálogo a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 5 horas diarias, tiene que ajustar el tiempo para poder realizar su trabajo sin descuidar a su hija, ella siempre aprovecha al máximo el tiempo que puede pasar con su hija y salir a caminar y jugar al parque del Cantón en esta actividad lo más difícil es cuando se tiene que cobrar.
Tiene varios sueños que quisiera realizar uno de ellos es poder comprarse un lote aquí en el Cantón para construir su casita propia y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, este préstamo ayudara a Mariela a mejorar sus ingresos ya que el mismo lo invertirá en pedidos de mercadería para lograr mayores y mejores ventas, Mariela agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo y la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The San Miguel de los Bancos settlement is located in the northwest part of the Pichincha province.  Mariela lives here.  She is a 21 year old young woman, is in a common law marriage, and has a four year old daughter.  She comes from a humble family of limited resources and has had several obstacles, one of which is not having been able to attend school because of the bad financial situation facing her family.

She sells perfumes and cosmetics via catalog and spends an average of five hours a week on this and has to adjust her schedule so she can do her work and still care for her daughter.  She always makes the best use of the time she spends with her daughter and goes out to walk and play in the park.  This is most difficult to do when she has to go out and make collections.

She has several dreams and one is to be able to buy a lot within the settlement so she can build a small house or her own so she can give her daughter a better quality of life.  This loan will help Mariela improve her income because she will invest the money into filling customer orders to make better sales.  Mariela is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the support and opportunity to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia, age 41, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to pay her household expenses. For this reason, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another calf. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for four years. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Fidelia Maria

texts.es:
Fidelia, es casada, de 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos: dos mujeres y un varón; actualmente vive en el departamento de Sololá. 
Ella se dedica a oficios domésticos (lavado de ropa ajena). Cuenta que esta labor la realiza desde hace 24 años y lo realiza porque es el medio por el cual genera los ingresos que necesita para su sobrevivencia y también con los mismos ingresos ha podido cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. A pesar que ella ya es una persona de avanzada edad todavía se siente con energías para seguir adelante.
Además de los ingresos que ella obtiene, también tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien es bodeguero en una venta de  materiales de construcción, y sus ingresos complementan el presupuesto familiar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de materiales de construcción.
Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y asi mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 42 years old, married, and has three children, two girls and a boy.  She lives in the Solola department.

She is a domestic employee (doing laundry for others) and says that she has been doing this for 24 years and this is how she generates the income that she needs to support herself.  It has also allowed her to cover her children’s basic needs.  Even though she is elderly, she has the energy to move ahead.

Aside from the income she obtains, she also gets support from her husband who is a storekeeper and sells building materials.  His income completes the family income.  She is asking or a loan of Q 3,000 to buy building materials.  She dreams of making improvements to her home and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is married with many children, and he provides for his family's needs through his service business that offers motor transportation in their village. He earns well for their needs. To buy new tires, Martin took out a new loan from GDMPC where he had joined a year ago. He wants to give his family a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth operates a family business venture: she sells fish while her husband goes fishing. Aside from this business, she also manages her retail store in their village, and she earns well for a living. She successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used in her business as additional capital. Recently, she took a new loan out to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. In the future, Elizabeth wants to build a house and to support her children in finishing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Жамиле 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. Старшие четыре дочери -замужем, остальные школьники. У Жамилы очень большая семья, дети растут трудолюбивыми, умными и послушными. Жамила очень гордится своими детьми, супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. У всех работа по дому и хозяйству распределена. У Жамилы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жамила занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жамилы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 12 овец, 13 коз, а также имеет небольшой земельный надел на котором выращивают кукурузу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного использования для своего скота. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имелось: 700 снопов кукурузы и 600 снопов клевера. Супруг занимается частным извозом пассажиров, имеет определенный доход. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамила обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Jamila is 43 years old and married. They have seven children. The four oldest daughters are married. The rest are in school. Jamila has a very big family; the kids are growing up hardworking, intelligent and obedient. Jamila is proud of her children; her husband and children all help with the housework.

Jamila has a high school education. Her main income for the family comes from managing livestock and agriculture. She started 12 years ago by buying cattle for 10,000 KGS. With hard work Jamila now has three dairy cows, three calves, 12 sheep, 13 goats and a small plot of land to grow corn and clover for their livestock. To date they have produced 700 sheaves of corn and 600 sheaves of clover. Her husband runs a private taxi and makes a certain income. 

Their combined monthly income is 15,000 KGS. To grow their farm, Jamila applied for a loan from microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy cattle for breeding. Jamila plans to use the profit to invest in improving their domestic cattle and further educating their children.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Ayabaca Group

texts.es:
ELSA INES, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, los cuales son su motor para realizar su trabajo. Ella forma parte del grupo "Las Triunfadoras de Ayabaca" formado por seis socias, las cuales se reunieron para formar éste grupo para poder conjuntamente cumplir sus metas de crecimiento en sus respectivos negocios.
Elsa Ines,tiene un poco mas de un año dedicándose a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir, inició solo ofreciendo ropa para niños, actualmente debido al requerimiento de sus mismos clientes aumentó la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de vestir para adultos, para poder cumplir con pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa Ines is 42 years old. She has 3 children who are her drive to carry out her work. She is part of the group "Las Triunfadoras de Ayabaca" (The Winners of Ayabaca). It is made up of six members who got together to create this group in order to together be able to reach their goals of growth in their respective businesses.

For a little over a year, Elsa Ines has worked buying and selling clothing. She started out only offering children's clothing. Currently, due to the requests of her customers, she expanded to selling garments for men and women.

She will invest the received loan in the purchase of clothing for adults in order to be able to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Eva Isidra

texts.es: La señora Eva tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de sus ingresos. Se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y tiene una experiencia de 34 años en la actividad, pero su ganado se enfermó y tuvo que hacerles varios tratamientos para no perderlos, ahora solicita un crédito para comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno lechero, de esta manera lograra mantener su nivel de producción y podrá salir adelante pese a las complicaciones que se le presentaron, buscando siempre el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva is 47 years old, married, and has two children who are dependent on her income.  She produces raw milk and has 34 years of experience in this line of work.  However, her cows have been ill and she has had to give them several treatments in order to prevent them from dying.  

Eva is now requesting a loan to buy another dairy cow so that she can maintain her level of production.  This will help her press forward despite the complications she has encountered.  She is always looking for ways to provide for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргиз замужняя женщина из города Душанбе. Ей 34 года. Наргиз замужем за Амина. Они вместе воспитывают троих детей. У них два сына и дочка. Сыновьям 10 и 8 лет, а младшей дочке 3 года. Муж Наргиза работает в службе охраны рынка Корвон. Наргиз раньше работала учительницей в школе, но сейчас она без работная, и сидит дома. Из-за финансового положения семьи, Наргиз решила выйти на работу. Она собирается заняться маленьким бизнесом. Наргиза хочет купить будку рядом с одним из рынков города и заниматься изготовлением и продажей хот-догов. Наргиза считает, что такая работа прибыльная, и она улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Но из-за нехватки средств для покупки будки Наргиза не может реализовать задуманное. Она просит помощи и верит, что ей помогут.
texts.en:
Nargis is a married woman from Dushanbe. She is 34 years old with three children. They have two sons (10 and eight years old) and a daughter (three years old). Her husband works in security at the Korvon market. Nargis used to be a school teacher, but is now unemployed. 

Because of their family's financial situation, she has decided to go back to work and start a small business. Nargis wants to buy a booth next to one of the town markets, and prepare and sell hotdogs. She figures that this business is profitable and will improve the family's financial situation. They don't have the means to buy the booth so Nargis is not able to realize her idea. She asks for help and believes that people will help her.

loans.use: to buy booths to prepare and sell hot dogs.

loans.name: Sonik

texts.en:
Sonik lives in Gavar in Gegharkunik region. She has two sons who are already married. One of her sons lives and works with his family in the Russian Federation and her smaller son lives with her and works as a distributor. Sonik works at the musical school as an accountant. Lately Sonik has had some problems connected with her teeth and after a visit to the doctor, now she needs to undertake a course of treatment.

She is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some medicine and to pay for her course of treatment.

loans.use: to pay for her course of treatment

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 53 años, es soltero, y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en el cantón Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. 

Es miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que está ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Son 21 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Pecuaria en su mayoría.

Carlos trabaja en la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cacao y crianza de cerdos y pollos para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Carlos los días viernes que es la feria.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, abonos y abonos para alimentar a los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la agricultura. Su meta es mejorar su situación económica para beneficio de la familia.  

Los desafíos que enfrenta es la falta de dinero para tener una casa decente para vivir.
texts.en:
Carlos is 53 years old, single, has four children, and lives in the Ventanas Provincia los Ríos settlement.  He is a member of the “10 de Septiembre” association, located in Lechugalito, a precinct that is part of the Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos settlement.  There are a total of 21 members and it’s mainly a farming and livestock community.

Carlos is a farmer and raises corn and cacao and raises pigs and chickens to improve his family finances.  The biggest harvest is the corn.  He sells his products in the San Carlos los Días market on Fridays.

He is asking for this loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, compost, and animal feed.  This loan will help him buy what he needs for farming.  His goal is to improve his financial situation to benefit his family.  

The challenge he faces is the lack of money to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo operates his own farm to make a living. He has been doing this for more than ten years, and he earns well for the family. He successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC that was used in improving the farm. To purchase fertilizer and new seedlings, Ricardo took out another loan from GDMPC. It is his desire to provide a better living for his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and new seedlings.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita has been selling groceries for more than three years. She earns enough to provide for her family, and she has also successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used for business capital. 

In order to buy more grocery goods for resale, Mercidita is now asking for another loan from GDMPC. She hopes to boost her income and improve her family’s general living condition with the proceeds from the loan.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, 43, lives with her husband and seven children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school, in a rural village of the Moung Russey district in Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 20 years. She is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Touch has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back her past loans. Now she is leading her group in asking for a loan. As the leader, Touch is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to grow more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng, 27, is married, with one son who is still young for school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. The main sources of her family’s income are farming rice and working for others for a fee. Sokheng has been running her business for nine years, earning about 18 USD per day and she is able to save about 7 USD each day.
 
Sokheng is a first-cycled client with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. With this loan, she is going to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
Living in the rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Sreyoun is 42 years old and she has four children, one of whom is still in school. 

To make a living, she has been farming rice and selling vegetables for 23 years. To supplement the family’s income, her husband also works for others for a fee. She is able to earn about US$26 per day, and she manages to save about US$8 each day after her daily expenses. 

This is the second micro loan for Sreyoun with VisionFund. She is planning to buy more vegetables for resale. She hopes to earn more income so she can save enough money to buy a proper motorbike for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Jamin's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of five group leader farmers in Chwele District with Jamin selected as the Kiva representative. Jamin has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 52 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. Jamin also joined One Acre Fund because he makes his payments in installments.

Jamin is a reliable member of the community. He is married with five children. Jamin is 53 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 35 years to support his family. In addition to this, he is very active in his community and is involved in the burial committee. He described his harvest last year as good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.

Jamin first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2007 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Jamin joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. Jamin plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Jamin’s own life was improved because he has more farm training and was able to save money. Jamin’s life has also improved because he has planted trees.

Jamin and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Mario Fausto

texts.es:
Mario un hombre de 30 años él vive y tiene su negocio en el Recinto la Guadalupe es soltero tiene una hija de 10 años, se dedica a la producción de pollos aprendió de este negocio desde muy niño con sus padres ya que el nació y se crio en el campo. 
En esta actividad lo más difícil es cuando los pollos son bebés ya que hay que ponerles mucho cuidado para evitar que se enfermen por los diferentes virus o por el frío. 
Trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias entre su negocio y su trabajo en la finca en la que vive, por lo que no le queda mucho tiempo libre pero cada que puede le gusta hacer deporte y pasar momentos agradables en familia. Tiene muchos sueños que quisiera realizar uno de ellos es comprarse un terreno donde construir su casa propia y tener un negocio más amplio para dedicarse solo a esta actividad, este préstamo ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida he ingresos económicos así podrá estar próximo a cumplir su sueño; este crédito que solicita es para incrementar el número de pollos y compra de balanceado para alimentar a los mismos, agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Mario is a 30 year old man.  He lives and has his business in the Guadalupe precinct.  He is single, has a 10 year old daughter, and raises chickens and learned this business from his parents when he was very young, since he was born and raised in the fields.

The most difficult part of this activity is caring for the chicks because he has to watch them so that they don’t get sick from viruses or from the cold.

He works an average of eight hours a day between his business and on his farm and this doesn’t leave him very much free time but he likes to play sports and spend quality time with his family when he can.  He has many dreams that he wants to achieve; one of which is to buy some land where he can build a house of his own and have a larger business that he can dedicate himself full time.  The loan will help him improve his quality of life and income.  He will use the money from this loan to increase his number of chickens and buy balanced feed for them.  He is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the support and opportunity.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Arelys Concepcion

texts.es: Arelys de  37 años de edad es madre de una niña de tres añitos, quien está al cuido de su abuelita materna, su compañero de Vida se dedica a la Agricultura y le ayuda con los gastos del Hogar, son una Familia muy unida, Arelys trabaja trabaja como oficial de credito en una Microfinanciera, y con el ánimo de continuar  mejorarando las condiciones en su vivienda pretende realizar un anexo donde ya cuenta con una parte de materiales que ah ido comprando poco a poco, pero aun no es suficiente comenzar su pequeño proyecto, por lo que necesita el prestamo para comprar materiales de construcción como, Piedrín,  arena y Hierro, pues con lo que gana no logra realizar de un solo esta inversion.  con esta mejora garantiza mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia.
texts.en: Arelys, age 37, is the mother of a three-year-old little girl who is in the care of her maternal grandmother. Her life partner works in agriculture and helps her with the household expenses. They are a very close family. Arelys works as a credit officer in a microfinance institution and, with the hope of continuing to improve the conditions in her home, she plans to build an addition. She already has some of the materials, which she has purchased little by little, but it is not even enough to start her small project. That is why she needs this loan to buy construction materials like cinder blocks, sand, and iron, since with what she earns she has not been able to make this one investment. This improvement guarantees better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jerardo Ramon

texts.es: Don Jerardo es originario de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada, el cual ha crecido gracias a sus esfuerzos. Esta agradecido con Kiva y Micrédito ya que logro cumplir con la demanda de los clientes y aumentar sus ganancias. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: camisas, pantalones, lencería, faldas entre otros, con el fin de ofertar una diversidad de mercadería. Estima que el crédito le ayudara incrementara sus productos y aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Don Jerardo is originally from the city of Managua.  He is a merchant who sells various products.  His business has grown thanks to his efforts.  Jerardo is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he will be able to meet the demand from his customers and increase his earnings.  

He is requesting a new loan in order to buy shirts, trousers, lingerie, skirts, and other items.  In the end, he wants to offer a variety of merchandise.  He expects this loan will help to increase his inventory of products and improve his sales.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, lingerie, skirts, and other items.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice. She has been farming for more than thirteen years, earning well for the family. Margarita joined GDMPC over a year ago and successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for farm inputs. She took out another loan to purchase fertilizers and organic pesticides. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 56 years old, is happily married and has four kids. She is a farmer and is into corn production.

In 2012, Teresita applied for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Teresita is asking for financial assistance of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase farm inputs for corn production. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for corn production

loans.name: Joann

texts.en: Joann is married, has one child, and manages a hog raising business while her husband works as a private employee. She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to repair her house in order to improve her family's living situation. Joann wants to improve her swine business to provide her family a better living in the future.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is aged 30 and married. She has three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Living in a village in the Damabe district, Yem is growing rice while her husband farms the rice to make a living. They earn about 85,000 Cambodian Riels (KHR) per day, and she can bring home about 45,000 KHR each day after subtracting the daily expenses. 

This is the third loan for Yem with VisionFund. She has completely repaid the past loans, which have enabled her family to buy a plot of farmland. With this loan, she is planning to use the proceeds to plow the field. She hopes to make more crops and to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to plow the field

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Sreytouch, 22, is single and lives in a village of the Stoeng Meanchey district. To make a living, she has been working as a stock controller in a company, and she also farms rice. Her current business earns her about US$15 per day, which helps her to meet the needs of her family.

Sreytouch is applying for a loan in a group with VisionFund. Sreytouch is going to use her portion to pay for her tuition fee to study Management. She hopes to this loan will enable her to keep her in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee to study Management

loans.name: Lucas' Group

texts.en:
Lucas is a member of this group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured here in a group of eight One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 97 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Lucas has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Lucas is married and has eight children. He is 50 years old and is known as a friendly, hardworking and experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group and prayer group. Lucas has been a farmer for 29 years. He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Lucas first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Lucas joined One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers. Lucas plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair the home. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Lucas’s own life was improved because he has more farm training and was able to feed the family.

Lucas and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum. .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo. Actualmente vive en un domicilio en calidad de inquilino, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades y presta servicios como maestro soldador percibiendo un salario mensual fijo. Es una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y para tal efecto solicita un crédito para refaccionar la vivienda donde habita para mejorar las condiciones en las que se encuentra.
texts.en: Jose Luis is 27 years old, single and has no dependents.  He lives in a rented home, has a bachelor’s degree in humanities and works as a master welder for a fixed salary.  He is a hardworking and responsible person who wants to improve his quality of life, so he is asking for this loan to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: Ana Lucy

texts.es:
Ana vive en al ciudad de Pucallpa y tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de comida típica de la su ciudad, lleva trabajando hace 2 año y cree que le va bien porque tiene muy buena sazón y sobre todo es muy amable con los clientes.

Ana esta agradecida con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar mesas, sillas, entre otros  para mejorar su negocio ya que por temporada navideña hay muchas visitas de turistas y de esta manera podría mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Ana lives in the city of Pucallpa and has a small business of selling traditional food in her city.  She has been working for two years and believes she is doing well because her food tastes very good.  Most of all, she is very friendly with her customers.  

Ana appreciates the support the Kiva lenders have offered.  Thanks to their assistance, she will be able to buy tables, chairs, and other supplies for improving her business.  During the Christmas season, there are many tourists who visit, so she will be able to improve her earnings.  Ana continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest wish of having a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is a farmer who currently cultivates his parent's farmland. He is 43 years old and lives with his partner. He has three children who are attending school. 

Ricky's primary source of income comes from his farming business. Aside from farming, he also raises cattle. Ricky aims to have a viable source of income someday but his capital is not enough. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000. This loan will be used to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemical products. He knows that through his requested loan, he could further sustain his crops with complete farm inputs that enable him to keep his crops healthy and earn a greater income someday.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemical products for his farming business

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been running a business purchasing and selling animals for the past two years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Jose Patrocinio

texts.es:
José es casado, de 57 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos: 3 varones y 3 mujeres, el junto a su familia vive en Sololá. Se dedica al cultivo de arveja china y otras hortalizas, esa actividad la heredó de sus padres, porque desde niño los ayudaba a cultivar la tierra. Realiza está actividad porque le gusta estar en contacto con la naturaleza y  además es la fuente de los ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Además de la agricultura, el es conserje en una institución de gobierno en Sololá, lo que también le genera otros ingresos que complementan su presupuesto familiar.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de semilla de arveja y fertilizante. 
El sueño más importante de José es la remodelación total de su casa.
texts.en:
Jose is 57, married, and has six children; three boys and three girls.  He lives with his family in Sololá and raises peas and other vegetables, having learned this from his parents because he helped them work the land when he was a boy.  He does this because he enjoys being in contact with nature and it’s also his source of income to support his family.

Besides farming, he is a concierge at a government agency in Sololá, which also generates other income that supplements his family budget.

He is asking for a loan of Q 6,000 to buy pea seeds and fertilizer.

Jose’s greatest dream is to totally remodel his house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es casado, de 47 años de edad, tiene 8 hijos: 3 varones y 5 mujeres, el junto a su familia vive en Sololá. Desde hace 30 años se dedica al cultivo de cebolla, esa actividad la heredó de sus padres, porque desde niño los ayudaba a cultivar la tierra. Realiza está actividad porque es donde tiene mayor experiencia y es el medio por el cual obtiene los ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de semilla y fertilizante para el cultivo de cebolla. 
El sueño más importante de Victor es mejorar su casa actual y construir otra para que su familia viva con comodidad.
texts.en:
Victor is 47 years old, married, and has eight children (three sons and five daughters).  He and his family live in Sololá.  Victor has been growing onions for 30 years.  He learned this trade from his parents because, as a boy, he had to help them cultivate the land.  Victor decided to continue in this type of work because he has a great deal of experience, which in turn has enabled him to generate income to support his family.  

The loan he is requesting is in the amount of 4,000 GTQ and will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer for his onion crop.  His most important wish is to make improvements to his current house and to build another one so that his family can live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his onion crop.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a widow, who earns a living by raising piglets to resell. She has been doing his for five years, and she earns well for her needs. Now she has started selling hogs in the market, and delivering meat in her village weekly to earn more income. 

Estela has applied for a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy piglets and sell them in two to four months. She wants to improve her business to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat is 60 years old, and married with ten children. Her family lives in a village in the Bati district of the Takeo province. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and raising animals. Having been in this business for 40 years, she is able to earn about 9 USD per day to meet her family’s needs.

Sinat is asking for a loan to pay for her son’s tuition fee to study Electronics. By taking the loan, she hopes to keep her son in school.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fee to study Electronics

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is married, and her husband works in a private company while she cooks snacks to sell.  For eight years, she was able to help her husband to provide her family with her business. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy raw ingredients to cook snacks to sell in their village. She hopes to own a retail store in order to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik is 48 years old, married and the father of three adult children. He has been in the agriculture business for 20 years. Malik earns money by selling milk products and meat to regular customers who are his neighbors. He also provides service on the lands on his own tractor. Today his number of animals is increasing and he applied to VFAC for a loan of 1,300 AZN. With this loan, he wants to buy sheep.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 26 years old, female and married. She has two children three and two years old respectively whom she supports. She runs a grocery business which has lasted for three years now. She earns a monthly income of KES 4350. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and she is taking a second loan from Kadet of KES 20,000, which she intends to use to buy more vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, pepper, omenas (a kind of fish), danias (a kind of fruit) and onions.  She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open a grocery depot and also make sure her children are educated.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, pepper, omenas, danias and onions to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose Hugo

texts.es:
José tiene 54 años, es soltero, y  tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Son 21 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Pecuaria en su mayoría.

José trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra de maiz duro y a la crianza de pollos para incrementar la economía de la familia. Vende los productos en el mercado de Mocache y de San Carlos. 

A José le gusta hacer deporte en la comunidad con los amigos del barrio.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos y para balanceado. 

Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta es tener una vida tranquila.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old, single, and has three children.  He lives in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  

José is a member of the Communal Bank "10 de Septiembre" (September 10th), which is located in Lechugalito, a neighborhood in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  There are a total of 21 members.  They come from a community that consists mostly of farmers and ranchers.  

José works as a farmer, cultivating popcorn kernels and raising chickens so that he can improve his family's financial situation.  He sells his products at the markets in Mocache and San Carlos.  José enjoys playing community sports with his friends from the neighborhood.  

José is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies for his work in the fields, mostly fertilizers and compost, as well as balanced feed.  His goal is to have a financially successful business for the sake of his family.  His challenges include trying to have a peaceful life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and balanced feed.

loans.name: Gladys Milagro

texts.es:
Gladis, necesita capital para invertir en mercadería para su negocio comprara arroz, maíz, frijol, pan, leña y gas propano. Con lo que su negocio de venta de antojitos y tortillas, siga dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y continuar aumentando sus ganancias.
Con el crédito anterior ella compro una variedad de productos los cuales fortalecieron su negocio, aumentaron sus ventas, atrajo más clientes y hoy en día tiene mejores ingresos con los cuales cubre sus gastos económicos.
texts.en:
Gladys needs capital to buy supplies, such as rice, corn, beans, bread, firewood, and propane gas for her food business so that she can continue to provide good service to her customers and increase her income.
 
She used the previous loan to buy a variety of products for her business; her sales increased and she attracted more customers.  Today she has a better income with which she covers her expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan, 44, is from a rural village in the Memot district of the Kampong Cham province. He is married with four children, one of whom is still in school. He and his wife earn a living through growing cassava. Having been in this business for ten years, he is able to earn about 50,000 Cambodian Riels per day to meet his family’s need. 

Chan has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. He has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped him better support his family. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop production from his farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Suliman

texts.en:
Suliman is a hardworking man. He is a 22-year-old who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is an employee for a small company and earns a small salary which is not enough to cover household expenses. He is a very ambitious man whose dream is to improve his living standards. 

He intends to buy some things for his home so he applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy furniture to use for his house. This loan will help him make his family happy.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
A 600 USD loan has been offered to Imelda to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will use the loan to buy additional stock, such as bread, cigarettes, salt, sugar, coffee, oils, eggs and water. 

Imelda has been involving herself in business activities since 2003. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Imelda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, se decidió por otro crédito para invertir en la fruta de temporada y así poder fortalecer su negocio, comprara manzanas, uvas, melocotones, peras y melones. De esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de fruta para comprar con facilidad en un mismo lugar.
Con el crédito anterior compro frutas y verduras, lo que le ayudo a aumentar su clientela, amplió su local mejorar sus ventas y mejorar su economía. Su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Gloria decided to request another loan so that she could invest in seasonal fruit and strengthen her business.  She will buy apples, grapes, peaches, pears, and melons.  This will enable her to offer a variety of fruits to her customers so that they can easily buy in one location.  

With her previous loan, Gloria was able to buy fruits and vegetables, which helped to increase her clientele.  Expanding her shop helped to increase her sales and improve her finances.  Her family is in very good health.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, peaches, pears, and melons.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a 72 year old widow, and a resident of Calaca-an, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She earns a living through selling snacks.

She has been a member of PMPC for 13 years, and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of 5,000 Philippines Pesos to buy additional ingredients for making snacks to sell.

Felisa deeply wishes keep her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making snacks to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel un hombre luchador, él tiene 39 años vive en unión libre con su esposa Lidia tienen 4 hijos el primero tiene 11 años y el ultimo tiene 1 año 3 meses, ellos viven en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos que esta ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha. 
Viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos motivo por el cual el no pudo estudiar, el solo termino la primaria, en la actualidad el lucha día a día para que el futuro de sus hijos se diferente al que paso el, por el trabajo que tiene no pasas mucho tiempo en familia trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias entre su producción de pollos y su trabajo como maestro albañil, Don Angel aprovecha al máximo los momentos que tiene de descanso para pasar buenos momentos en familia; en el negocio de los pollos lo más complicado es el cuidado cuando son bebés por la diversas enfermedades que existen.
Don Angel tiene muchos sueños futuros como lo es tener su casa propia, este crédito le servirá para comprar balanceado y más pollo e incrementar sus ingresos.
Este préstamo ayudara a Don Angel a mejorar su calidad de vida y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos , agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que están brindando a personas como el que por falta de oportunidades no han podido llevar a cabo sus sueños.
texts.en:
Angel is a hardworking man.  He is 39 years old, is in a common law marriage, with his wife Lidia, and they have four children between the ages of 11 years and  a year and three months.  They live in the San Miguel de los Bancos settlement, located in the northwestern part of the Pichincha province.

He comes from a family of limited financial resources so he was not able to attend school.  He only completed elementary school.  Now he works hard every day so that his children’s future will be different.  He works an average of 10 hours a day between his chicken business and working as a master mason, so he doesn’t spent too much time with his family.  Angel takes maximum advantage of the time he has to spend quality time with his family.  The most difficult part of his chicken business is caring for the chicks because of the various diseases that exist.

Angel has many dreams for the future, such as having a home of his own.  This loan will help his buy feed, more chickens, and increase his income.

This loan will help Angel improve his quality of life and provide a better future for his children.  He is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the support that people are giving to people like him who have not been able to achieve their dreams due to a lack of opportunity.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Marissa has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from food vending.



Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rasif

texts.en: Rasif is 33, married and the father of two school children. He has been in the agriculture business for 16 years. Rasif earns money by selling milk products and meat to regular customers who are his neighbors. He also provides service on the lands on his own tractor to earn additional income. Today his number of animals is increasing and he applied to VFAC for a loan of 1000 AZN. With this loan, he will buy one cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow.

loans.name: Elsalina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Elsalina to improve her business. She is married and she has four children. She opened her construction business in 2000 with her own working capital of $800. She will use the loan to buy cement and sand. Elsalina generates a good income from selling her things for the construction. 

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Adrian Arturo

texts.es:
Adrian tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres, en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Adrian trabaja en la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y a la crianza de cerdos para luego venderlos. 

Vende los productos en el mercado de Mocache y San Carlos.

Adrian le gusta hacer deporte en la comunidad. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos balanceados y vacunas para los cerdos.  Su meta es mejorar su situación económica pera beneficio de la familia. Los desafíos que enfrenta es tener una casa decente para vivir.
texts.en:
Adrian is 23 years old and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  He is a member of the Communal Bank "10 de Septiembre" (September 10th), which is located in Lechugalito, a neighborhood in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Adrian works as a farmer, growing corn and raising pigs that he sells at a later time.  He sells his products at the markets in Mocache and San Carlos.  Adrian enjoys playing sports in his community.  

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies, fertilizers, compost, as well as balanced feed and vaccines for his pigs.  His goal is to improve his financial situation for the benefit of his family.  His challenges include having a decent house in which to live.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, fertilizers, compost, as well as balanced feed and vaccines for his pigs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma operates a fruit and vegetable selling business in her village. She is married, and blessed with four children. Wilma has been selling various fruits and vegetables for a year. Income generated by her business has been used to pay school fees for her children, and utility bills. 

Wilma is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippines Pesos, which will be used to buy bananas, tomatoes, apples and eggplants to keep her fruit and vegetable business productive and profitable. She hopes that lenders will continue to extend financial support to her, so she can make a better income to provide her childrens' education.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes, apples and eggplants for her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Augustine's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of three group leader farmers in Chwele District, with Augustine selected as the Kiva representative. Augustine has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 36 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Augustine is a reliable member of the community. He is married with eight children. Augustine is 45 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support his family. In addition to this, Augustine is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group. He described his harvest last year as good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Augustine joined One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Augustine joined One Acre Fund so that he could get new farming methods and send his children to school. Augustine has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Augustine's life because he has more farm training and was able to save money. In the future, Augustine hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to buy a cow.  	

Augustine and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to access hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith’s group has eight group leader farmers and is located in the Kakamega North District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 70 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Judith is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised.
							
Judith is married and has six children. She is 45 years old and is known as reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and the burial committee. Judith has been a farmer for 25 years. Judith described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Judith joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Judith joined One Acre Fund so that she could get new farming methods. Because she is an active community member, Judith has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Judith's life because she has more farm training, and she was able to feed the family. In the future, Judith hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school and to buy a cow.

Judith and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To access hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has three years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.
