She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as flour, buckets, oil, sugar and salt. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Filomena is living in a town near by the school, and her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy flour, buckets, oil, sugar and salt

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 29 years old and he lives in Ijevan in Tavush region. Karen has his own business; he sells flowers and bouquets made of it and he also has a coffee grinder and he also sells ground coffee. He buys the flowers for bouquets every other day at the local wholesale flower market and he goes there very early in the morning in order to manage to buy nice, fresh and not very expensive flowers. In all ,Karen is not satisfied with his flower sale business’ income, since during these cold months flowers do not sell very much. The main financial income of his family comes from the sale of coffee. Karen is married and he has two small children. Karen’s wife tries to help her husband to earn a living and she works at the local school as a teacher.
Karen is asking for a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to buy a new, more powerful coffee grinder and some new assortment of flowers to sell.

loans.use: to buy a new, more powerful coffee grinder and some new assortments of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en: Stellah is 51 years old woman who is married. She has two children, 26 and 21 years old respectively, who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by Kadet officer. She sells milk and has been in this business for thirteen years. In her business, she earns a monthly income of KES 4,550. She is taking her first loan of KES 10,000, which she intends to use to buy a heifer. Stellah will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family is to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a heifer for the production of milk.

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es:
Doña María Valentina es una micro empresaria, vive  en una comunidad  en el oriente de Honduras, es una mujer muy trabajadora y se dedicada a la venta y crianza de cerdos.
Doña María Valentina está  solicitando el préstamo para compra de más cerdos, para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ya que en esta temporada navideña se le vende mucho este producto.
Doña María Valentina espera que esta inversión le ayude a hacer crecer su negocio y a la vez le permita obtener los ingresos suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma.


Trojes, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
María Valentina is a microentrepreneur, she lives in a community in the east of Honduras, she is a very hardworking woman and makes her living selling and rearing pigs.

María Valentina is seeking the loan to buy more pigs to satisfy the needs of her customers as in this Christmas period, this product is in demand.

María Valentina hopes that this investment will help her to grow the business and also allow her to have enough income to satisfy her family's needs. She is very happy about working with Prisma.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business/

loans.name: Zayron Olmedo

texts.es:
Zayron tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre, y tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos, junto a su familia.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Zayron trabaja en la agricultura  y crianza de gallinas para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, arroz y cacao, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos en la casa los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado de Mocache y en la feria de San Carlos.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar fungicidas, abonos, balanceado y vacunas para evitar enfermedades de los animales.  Su meta es mejorar su situación  económica. 

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte en las canchas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Zayron is 40 years old, he lives in a common-law marriage and has three children. She lives in the canton of Ventanas, the Los Ríos province, together with his family. He is a member of the rural solidarity group Aso. 10 de Septiembre which is located in Lechugalito  it is an area which belongs to the Ventanas canton, the Los Ríos province.  

Zayron works in agriculture and rears chicken to increase his family's finances. The crops that earn the most are corn, rice and cocoa, in addition, he also rears chicken and pigs at home. He sells the products at home and in the Mocache market and the San Carlos festival.

He is seeking the loan to buy fungicides, fertilizers, animal feed and vaccines to prevent his animals from falling ill. His aim is to improve his financial situation. In his spare time, he likes playing sport in the community sports fields.

loans.use: to buy fungicides, fertilizers, animal feed and vaccines to prevent animal illnesses.

loans.name: Linda Lisseth

texts.es: Linda, tiene 32 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con su madre y una hermana, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella estuvo trabajando como operaria de maquila y al quedar sin empleo decidió establecer su propio negocio donde vende variedad de productos, en su tiendita tiene ropa nueva, sandalias, lociones  y cosméticos. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería nueva como ropa, zapatos, cremas, desodorantes, lociones, maquillajes y otros cosméticos para vender en esta temporada. Su meta es aumentar el inventario para poder aumentar las ventas y los ingresos.
texts.en: Linda, 32, is single, she lives with her mother and a sister, and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She was working as a machine operator and when she found herself without any work, she decided to set up her own business where she sells a variety of products. In her small store, she has new clothes, sandals, lotions and cosmetics. The loan that she has sought is for 20,000 Honduran Lempiras and she will invest in the purchase of new merchandise such as clothes, shoes, creams, deodorants, make-up and other cosmetics to sell in this season. Her aim is to increase the inventory to grow her sales and her profits.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, shoes, creams, deodorants, lotions, make-up and other cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Marcia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Marcia del Carmen, es una humilde mujer que tiene bajo su cargo a un hijo quien estudia la escuela secundaria, para ella su principal meta es que el culmine sus estudios superiores y sea independiente, María se dedica a comercializar ropa usada y nueva los cuales vende en su casa y por encargo. Su mayor deseo en la actualidad es mejorar su cuarto, el cual es de madera y laminas viejas de zinc, por este motivo acude a solicitar crédito para comprar los materiales y realizar dicha obra, que le permitirá un mayor confort a la familia.
texts.en: Marcia del Carmen is a humble woman with one son who is currently in secondary school.  Marcia's main goal is for her son to finish university and be independent.  Marcia makes a living selling used and new clothing out of her house.  She also takes orders.  Currently one of Marcia's biggest wishes to to improve her room, which is made of wood and old zinc laminate sheeting.  In order to achieve this wish, Marcia has applied for a loan in order to buy the materials to carry out this job.  This work will provide more comfort for the family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and bricks.

loans.name: Virginia Feliza

texts.es: La señora Virginia tiene 36 años casada con tres hijos de las edades de 19, 17 y 15, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado como también venta de leche la señora Virginia vive en la localidad de Batallas,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La señora Virginia va a usar este préstamo para compra de ganado lechero para crianza por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos,  La señora Virginia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar alimento balanceado para sus ganado y así de esta manera poder tener más producción de leche, La señora Virginia es una persona joven con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en: Virginia is 36 years old, married and has three children, aged 19, 17 and 15 years old respectively. Virginia makes a living buying a selling cattle and milk.  Virginia lives in Batallas, in Bolivia, and this will be her first loan with the institution. Virginia will use this loan to buy dairy cattle to raise for her business.  She is applying for the loan in order to increase her income.  The challenge Virginia is facing is to improve her business and her quality of life.  She will use her profits to buy feed for her cattle and, thus, to improve milk production.  Virginia is a young person who wants to get ahead.  She feels happy to have this opportunity to improve her business and, therefore, her income.  This is the only work that Virginia does.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
Jose tiene 42 años de edad, pero tiene el carisma de un joven de 20; cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder trabajar en su pequeño negocio de carpintería el cual ya tiene 3 años de funcionamiento y con el cual puede tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su familia sobre todo porque es padre de 2 hijos.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Hacer crecer su negocio”.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old but has the charisma of a young 20-year-old.  Every day he gets up very early to work at his small carpentry business.  José has had the business for three years and, with it, he can earn an income to cover household costs, which he needs particularly as he is a father to two children.

José is grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have provided, José will be able to buy materials in order to make improvements to his home and, therefore, to improve his family's quality of life.  José will then keep fight to make his dream, of expanding his business, a reality.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 29-year-old married woman from the city of Kutaisi. She lives with her husband and little child. The only source of family income is her husband's job as an artisan. He gets private orders that monthly generate 400 GEL. Lina is unemployed at the moment and has great desire to start her own activity and do her bit for the welfare of the family. With the requested loan she wants to purchase a stock of home products at wholesale prices and then resell them among her friends and neighbors at a good price.  The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $700 for purchasing products. With support from the start-up program Lina will have an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of home products to sell

loans.name: Lernik

texts.en:
Lernik is from the Ajarkut village in the Tavushi region. He has been involved in beekeeping for many years. He also keeps chickens and 4 pigs and he cultivates plum, nut, apple, pear and other types of fruit trees. Lernik lives together with his wife and two children (ages 17 and 1 year old). 

As the only breadwinner in the family, Lernik works hard to make a good income and sustain his family's life. He is now asking for this loan to renovate the agricultural machine that helps him to organize the cultivation process. 

As this is the first loan for Lernik, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Lernik will be very grateful to lenders for their support, as the repair of his cultivator is very important for his agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of an agricultural machine.

loans.name: Omer Group

texts.en:
The Omer group consists of four ladies from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 120,000 YER, which they will use to expand their businesses. 

Shwaya is a married woman and the leader of the group. She sells clothes, incense and perfumes which she has been doing to cover the expenses of her family. She expanded her business after taking the first loan and now she is making an effort to increase her profit.

Shwaya is requesting a loan from AMB of 30,000 YER to help her to buy more clothes, incense and perfumes so as to increase her profit. All members of this group are grateful to Kiva lenders for financing their first loan.

loans.use: to help her to buy more clothes, incense and perfumes so as to increase her profit.

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en:
Rashed is a 21-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. His father works as an employee in a public firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.

Rashed is a student in his second year, studying Information Technology. He loves this specialization. He would like to finish his studies and find a job and help his family with part of their expenses. 

He took a 500 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan he will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily. He appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a 38-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is retail; he also sells produce and does agriculture in order to boost his income. He is facing a challenge of inadequate capital for expanding his business. However, he has a vision of buying a motorcycle for transport. Kenneth has asked for a loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 45 years old. He is married, and he has a one son. Murad is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He  is a Fuzulu refugee. 

He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years. He is very hardworking and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support his family. 

Murad’s income from the business is 130 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat). In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his son will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. 

He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue  in the coming winter, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds to grow more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Suhrob is an ambitious person. He is a smart and kind young man. He is a student in his third year of courses. He studies at the Technologies University, a student of the Economics faculty. He studies well in all of his classes. 

He is from a poor family. His parents do not have the ability to pay his tuition, so he is asking for a loan of 1,050 USD to pay his tuition. He awaits your support. In the future Suhrob is going to be one of the best economists.

loans.use: To pay his tuition.

loans.name: Rda

texts.en:
Rda is a hardworking Iraqi client who is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. He and his eldest child provide the family income together, while the rest continue their studies.

Rda owns a workplace where he sterilizes and distributes fresh water in his neighborhood. He established his business in 2007 and has gained his experience in this field from his brother, who runs a similar business in another city. Rda is well-known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD in order to pay the annual rent on his shop and to buy a big water tank to increase his production. Rda is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide a better income for his family and take care of their needs.

loans.use: to pay annual rent on his shop and to buy a big water tank to increase his production.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 45 years old, is married and has one daughter. She supports her family through the income she earns from making clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Yen intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy fabric, materials and sewing tools. The additional materials will enable her to increase her production for sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric, materials and sewing tools

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is 40 years old and lives with his wife and four children. He has owned a grocery store since 2005. His eldest son receives a disability pension and his three younger children are going to school. 

The house his family lives in has deteriorated, and recently he began a renovation, but due to a lack of money he stopped temporarily. Vidadi is now requesting a loan of 600 AZN to buy some materials for repairs. 

After the full renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air. Vidadi is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction work at home.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo, es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de familiares la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de San Felipe de Seque de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel primaria y trabaja de ayudante de mecanico en un taller   
(reparacion de motor y otros)y recibe un jornal por dichos servicios. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de motor y caja para su movilidad, la cual usa para transportarse a comprar repuestos y algunas veces a efectuar trabajos a domicilio de los clientes.
El sueño de Reynaldo es poder independisarse tener su propio taller asi  poder tener mejores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is single and does not have any children. He lives with relatives in a house in the area of San Felipe de Seque in the city of El Alto. 
He has only an elementary-school education. He works as a mechanic’s assistant in a garage (engine repair, etc.) and receives a daily wage for those services.
He needs this loan to buy an engine and transmission for his vehicle, which he uses for transportation to buy parts and sometimes to do work at clients’ homes.
Reynaldo’s dream is to be able to become independent and have his own garage, and therefore have a higher income and better quality of life.
This is the first time he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy an engine and transmission for his vehicle, which he uses for his job.

loans.name: Yeprem

texts.en:
Yeprem lives in the village of Aghvani in the Syunik region of Armenia. He is married and has a son and a daughter. He has a specialty as a locksmith, but now he works at the factory as a driver. He also has a truck of his own and manages to haul cargo from Kapan to Yerevan and back. 

Yeprem is also engaged in farming. On his farm, he has eight cows and eight calves. His wife sells milk and other dairy products from their house. 

Yeprem wants to increase his farm cattle, since caring for the cattle is hard anyway, but the income is small. He wants to become specialized in farming and to sell a lot of meat near the Christmas holidays.

He asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to purchase four calves and animal fodder for them.

loans.use: to purchase four calves and animal fodder for them

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, 28, is a married man. He has three (3) children, aged 17, 5 and 6 months old respectively, whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and he has a tailoring shop which has lasted for two years now. It is located at Mbarakachembe. In his business, he earns a monthly income of 9550 KES. He is taking his first loan of 30,000 KES, which he intends to use to add stock to his business by buying sewing thread, zips, canvas and other materials. Emmanuel will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to expand his tailoring shop and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy sewing thread, zips, canvas and other materials to make clothes for his customers.

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.ru: Фарходчон просит кредит, чтобы купить крупно рогатых скотов, чтобы начать бизнес животноводства. Он собирается кормить и выращивать их в коровнике. После определенных дней откорма Фарходчон продаст их на рынке родного района Шахритус. Такой деятельностью он хочет занимать много лет. Ранее он занимался продажей продуктов питания. Но сейчас у него большое желание начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Причина, по которой Фарходчон хочет начать такую деятельность является благоприятный климат и чистая природа Таджикистана. Ему не хватает часть суммы для покупки скотов. Фарходчон верит, что он сможет собрать часть недостающей суммы с Вашей помощью. Помогите ему!
texts.en: Farhodjon is requesting a loan to buy cattle and launch his animal raising business. He plans to fatten his animals, keeping them in a cowshed. After a period of fattening, Farhodjon will resell the cattle at the market of his native region Shahrituz. He plans to engage in this line of work for many years. In the past he used to sell food products. At present he has a strong wish to start a cattle business. He reasons that Tajikistan has the right climate and unpolluted natural environment. He still lacks part of the funds needed to buy cattle. Farhodjon trusts that he will be able to raise the missing amount with your help. Please help him!

loans.use: to buy cattle and launch his cattle business.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn is 24 years old. He is a student in his fourth year. He studies at the Technology University in Tajikistan. He lives with his parents in the capital of Tajikistan. His parents are workers. 

He wants to become the best specialist and to earn money for improving living conditions. His parents are poor people and they do not have good living conditions. Huseyn is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to pay his tuition at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay his tuition.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza was born in 1993. She is a smart woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is a student at the Slavonic University of Tajikistan. She is studying her third year courses, and she studies well. She always goes to the library and she reads many books. She has a lot of books. She must pay her tuition and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay her tuition.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is mother of two children. She works at a general store as a saleswoman, and her husband is a taxi driver. They work hard to sustain the family's living and provide good living conditions for their children. 

Julieta's elder daughter is a student at Yerevan State University of Architectures and Construction. Because of the family's current costs, Julieta and her husband aren't able to save money for their daughter's education. That's the reason why Julieta has applied for this loan. It will help her to pay for the university tuition of her daughter. 

The whole family waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of her daughter

loans.name: Quang

texts.en:
Quang is 56 years old and married with four children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. She runs a business of making clothes to earn a living. 

She started her business two years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of fabrics and sewing tools for making clothes. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing tools for making clothes.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 38, is married. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife works as a hired laborer. He earns an income running a store selling soft drinks in front of his house. 

He started this business three years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater quantity of beverages to stock his store and better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beverages to restock his store.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña Ana es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, el cual le ha permitido seguir adelante y mantener un negocio estable. Esta agradecida con Kiva y Micrédito ya que logro comprar mercadería al por mayor e incrementar la clientela. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar pacas de ropas usadas y nuevas al por mayor, con el fin de ofertar una gran variedad de mercadería. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá surtir su mercadería e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Ana is originally from the city of Managua. She works as a vendor selling used clothing, which has allowed her to move forward and keep her business stable. She is grateful to Kiva and Micrédito because she was able to buy wholesale merchandise to increase her customer base. She is requesting a new loan to buy packs of new and used clothing wholesale so she can offer a wider variety of merchandise. She believes the loan will be a great help since she will be able to stock her merchandise and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy packs of new and used clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Narlie

texts.en:
Narlie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy needed spare parts for her tricycle. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her child. The income from her business is helping with their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain their daily needs as well as the education of their child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Narlie dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 32-year-old married man with three children. They live together in Ibb, Yemen. Rashid is happy that he received a Kiva loan that he was able to repay without much challenge. His business of vehicle repair improved after the loan and his life changed after the loan term.

He seeks another loan to expand his business further. He wants to buy tires, tubes, oil and other items necessary to run his tire shop. The challenges he faces in the business include competition. In the future, he plans to rent another shop and open a mechanic workshop. He thanks Kiva lenders for financing the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase tires, tubes, oil and other items necessary for his business.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 25-year-old married father of three living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main businesses are motorcycle transport and dairy farming, enterprises he started with the goal of achieving prosperity and independence. Ronald faces the challenges of unpredictable weather changes and drought.

Ronald is requesting a loan to pay workers for weeding his gardens. He has a vision of buying more land for farming and educating his children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to pay workers for weeding his gardens.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Doña Maura tiene 47 años de edad, madre de 6 hijos quienes dependen de ella y su esposo y en familia trabajan la tierra especializándose en la siembra y cultivo de papa ya que de este rubro dependen sus ingresos y el sustento de su familia. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora con mucha experiencia en dicha actividad ya que en su familia es una vocación y tradición siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Cuenta con un grado de educación de primaria completo gracias a la confianza, apoyo tanto financiero como moral de su madre y su padre a quienes ella agradece el esfuerzo echo en estos años de su vida. En compañía de su esposo y sus hijos se dedican a la siembra de hortalizas como ser: papa, brócoli y coliflor y el terreno que ella en compañía de su pareja de hogar trabaja es propio y está ubicado cerca de su casa de habitación a 20 metros al cual se trasladan caminando diariamente para dar asistencia a sus cultivos involucrándose su familia solamente.
Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla de papa certificada, abono, fertilizantes, foliares que darán una protección a sus cultivos de plagas y ayudaran al desarrollo y crecimiento de los mismos.
Sus sueños es dar a sus hijos una buena educación verlos crecer como personas y como profesionales ya que es lo menos que ellos se merecen. Sus metas son las de poder dar una excelente asistencia a sus cultivos de papa para obtener una buena cosecha y seguir formando y fortaleciendo poco a poco el patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maura, 47, is the mother of 6 dependent children. Her husband and family work on the land, specializing in planting and harvesting potatoes because this work provides their income and sustains the family. She is a homemaker and farmer with a lot of experience because it is her family's profession and tradition. Her parents taught her to work the land at a very early age.

Maura completed one grade of primary education thanks to the trust, support, and financial help of her mother and father, who she thanks for those efforts in her life now. Along with her husband and children, she plants vegetables such as potatoes, broccoli, and cauliflower. The land that she and her husband work on is their own, which is located near their home—20 meters away—which they walk to every day to work on the crops, involving her family.

She is requesting a loan from COMIXUMUL to buy agricultural supplies such as certified potato seeds, manure, fertilizer, and other plant fertilizers that will protect her crops from plagues and will help them to develop and grow.

Her dream is to give her children a good education, to see them grow as individuals and as professionals because they deserve that at the very least. Her goal is to be able to attend to her potato crops well so she will have a good harvest and keep setting up and strengthening her children's estate little by little.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and certified potato seeds for harvesting and to help him.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 24 years old farmer living in the rich highlands of Kericho. She has been a farmer for 5 years and manages to produce and sell milk. She really enjoys dairy farming and you can see in her photo how happy she is with her cow.

The challenge she faces is that dairy feeds are quite expensive. Fridah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the low interest rates and easy mode of loan repayment. She learned how to develop a culture of savings, and working with a microfinance will help her boost her income. Through this loan, she will manage to store water for her farm and personal use in case there is a dry spell. Because of this her crops and livestock will flourish during seasons of dryness. This will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to be able to store water.

loans.name: Edison

texts.es:
Edison, a sus 44 años de edad, sigue luchando para sacar adelante a su familia, motivado por la necesidad de generar ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y luego de quedarse desempleado, decidió iniciar su propio negocio, un alquiler de video juegos en el que ofrece entretenimiento para jóvenes y niños del sector, además vende mecato, dulces y gaseosas, cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado y trabajan todos los días de 11 am a 10 pm, el oficio lo aprendió de un amigo que manejaba un negocio similar y ya lleva 3 años en funcionamiento, pues ha tenido muy buena acogida en el sector.
Su empuje y perseverancia lo impulsan a buscar nuevas alternativas para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, por ello solicita el crédito para comprar insumos y surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, mecato,  dulces, chocolatinas, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de inventario suficiente para satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes y así mejorar la entrada de recursos.
Edison tiene como proyecto a futuro el fortalecimiento y acreditación de su negocio, para dejar un buen legado a sus dos hijos y su esposa y, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Edison is 44 years old. He constantly fights to get ahead with his family. After losing his job, and seeing the need to bring food to the table, he decided to open his own business. He has a video game rental shop, where teenagers and kids from the neighborhood come to play. He also sells snacks, sweets and beverages. Together with an employee, he works every day from 11 am to 10 pm. He learned this activity from a friend who had a similar business. Edison has had his business for three years now and it is very popular with locals.

His resolution and perseverance make him want to look for new opportunities to strengthen his business. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy supplies in bulk (beverages, snacks, sweets, chocolate bars, etc.). This way, he will have enough to fulfill the demand and improve his income.

Edison wants to continue developing his business and increase its popularity in order to leave his two children and wife a good legacy and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk for his rental shop, such as beverages, snacks, sweets and chocolate bars.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 37-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife and four children; two sons and two daughters, in a small simple house in the city. He works as an employee in a private firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Mohammad is a master student studying Arabic language. He loves this specialization. Mohammad would like to finish his study and improve his family's living conditions. Mohammad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his home works and write his reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor, es casado tiene tres  hijos, vive en casa propia  la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Mercedes de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel segundario. Nestor es jubilado (invalides por riesgo comun) tambien trabaja en una empresa construcctora como empleado.Su esposa trabaja en una curtiembre . 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra  herramientas (arco para soldar y otros).
El sueño de Nestor, es poder independisarse tener su propio taller asi  poder tener mejores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Nestor is married and has three children.  He lives in his own house, located in the Mercedes district in the city of El Alto.  He's educated only to the high school level.  He's a pensioner (common risk disability) but also works for a construction business.  His wife works in a tannery.

Nestor needs a loan to buy tools (a welder and other items).  His dream is to become independent and have his own workshop so he can have a higher income and better quality of life.

This is the first time Nestor is seeking a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a welder and other items for his construction work.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Araba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming a entrepreneur. Currently, she sells "banku" (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from fermented corn dough and cassava dough), served with groundnut soup. She primarily sells her banku in Nakwa, located in Ghana's Central Region. She has been in this business for years.

Araba is married to a fisherman and has eight children. She uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Her aim for this loan is to purchase increased amounts of maize and other ingredients, which will help her to improve her overall sales. She plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and other ingredients, which will help her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she grew up in difficult circumstance, Ekua has been a successful fish monger for 10 years.. She specializes in selling smoked fish in her village of Nakwa, located in Mankessim in the Central Region. Married to a farmer and the mother of two children, Ekua normally directs her profits towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Ekua has requested this loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell more smoked fish. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest part of her future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet both rising customer demand and her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell more smoked fish.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is married and has three children, and two of her children go to school. She has one additional family member (her brother). She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family. 

She operates a retail shop and sells her goods to all kinds of people. She has been in this business for two years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from teaching in a kindergarten school. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,700,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, crates of soda and other soft drinks. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She is aspiring to buy a van to ease in transportation and also to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and crates of beer and other soft drinks.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married to a fisherman and together they have one child. 

Currently, she sells provisions in her village of Nakwa located in Mankessim in the Central Region. She has been involved in this business for 21 years. Abena’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses as well as their children’s school fees. She will use the loan to increase her existing provisions capacity. 

With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Abena plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets and supporting her children’s education.

loans.use: to increase her existing provisions capacity.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, she sells fabric and used denim skirts in her village of Nakwa located in Mankessim in the Central Region. She has been doing so for about five years. 

As a single mother with three children, Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of materials, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. 

Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of materials, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Ever José

texts.es: El señor Ever, junto a su esposa han lucha para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el labora como docente para un colegio publico y su esposa es comerciante vende el cafetin del colegio donde trabaja su esposo, entre los dos aportan para la economia del hogar, el credito lo solicta para la compra de Materiales como bloques, cemento, arena ya que hara un anexo en la vida, Agradece el apoyo y confianza que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en:
Ever and his wife work hard to improve their living conditions. He works as a teacher for a public school and his wife works in the cafeteria. They both contribute to the family’s economy.

He is requesting a loan to buy construction supplies, such as bricks, cement and sand to build an additional room. He appreciates the help and support that Kiva and AFODENIC have given him.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build an additional room.

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Bidii is a group of eight group-leader farmers in Kenya's Kakamega North District. Wilson, pictured on the right with his hand raised, volunteered and was selected to be the Kiva group representative. The field officer, also included in the photo, is standing on the left. The individual farmers represented by the group leaders are not pictured here.

Farming inputs will be delivered to Wilson and the 74 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant a quarter acre of maize and a quarter acre of millet or sorghum. Each farmer will receive an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings.

Wilson, 50, has been a farmer for 22 years. He is married and has five children. He is known as hardworking and as an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in such organizations as the savings group and prayer group. He describes his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  	

Wilson joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the long rains 2014 season. He joined One Acre Fund to learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed the family. Because he is an active community member, Wilson has become more involved with the organization as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved his life because he has more farm training and is able to feed his family. He hopes his profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Wilson and the Bidii group will use their Kiva loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. 

One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to access hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 40, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband has been helping her run a food stall, selling meals and noodles to people in their community.

Trang started this business 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying raw food and noodles to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and in sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy raw food and noodles to make meals for selling.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 35 years old, married, and has two sons. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband have been running a business of selling ice cubes for six years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children.

Lan is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of large ice blocks and ice storage and cutting equipment, so that she can produce and sell more ice cubes. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy large ice blocks, ice storage and cutting equipment.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola has been involved in agriculture for eight years and grows mainly corn. She sells her crops to the basic grain dealers located near her place of residence. With the profits she earns from sales, she helps cover family expenses. 

She lives with her husband and a child in her own home in a village. She has additional income from animal husbandry. She feeds cows and horses. 

She is going to develop her business. She is going to make a new sowing and also to buy cattle. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 TJS to buy seeds and cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and cattle.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.en: Sojida was born in 1974. She is a hardworking woman. Sojida is married and has four children. Since her husband’s income is small she decided to organize her own business. So 10 years ago she began her own business selling dried fruit. Sojida sells her goods in a local market where she has her own selling place. She is going to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy dried fruit so as to increase her working capital. From the profit she is going to provide her children with good education. She thanks KIVA and all lenders in advance for their kindness.

loans.use: To buy dried fruit so as to increase her working capital

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.en:
Shamsiya was born in 1983. She is married and has four children. She is also a successful businesswoman. Shamsiya has been busy with her own business more than five years. She sells handkerchiefs and socks. Shamsiya is one of the best business ladies in a local market. Little by little she has developed her business. 

Shamsiya is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy goods for increasing her working capital. In this way she is going to develop her business and improve living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy goods such as socks and handkerchiefs so as to increase her working capital

loans.name: Bolivianitas - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento BOLIVIANITAS-26 Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes todas mujeres, la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Rosa tiene 23 años y dos  hijos de las edades de 5 y 2 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio por la zona de Salas,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de insumos al por mayor como abarrotes, aceite y verduras al por mayor para elaboración de sus comidas, la señora Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y también agradecida por la ayuda a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The "BOLIVIANITAS-26" communal bank is composed of nine members, all of them women. The president of the bank is Rosa who is 23 years old and has two children, aged 2 and 5. She sells meals from her sales post located in her home in the Salas neighborhood. The loan is destined to buy supplies wholesale, like groceries, oil and vegetables in order to prepare her meals. Rosa is a very hard-working person who has worked in this field for many years. She is grateful to the institution for it's support as this is her only way to support her family. She is also happy for the other members of the group as in many cases they support their families by themselves.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make meals.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marylin previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marylin hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of eight children. Eufemia has been in the business for several years now. Eufemia sells various goods to the people in her place. 

Eufemia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, candies, soda, biscuits, snack foods, soap, and toiletries. In this way, she will be able to improve the variety of her merchandise thus attracting more buyers. In the future, Eufemia has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, biscuits, snack foods, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Roque

texts.en: Roque is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and has two young children. Roque has been in the farming business for more than eight years. He is asking for a loan, with which he will buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, which will help him improve his yield and income. In the future, Roque hopes to expand his farming venture and make it a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani, who is from Iraq, is a youth client of 27 years of age, who is married and is a father of a child.

Hani owns a garage, where he repairs all types of vehicles as well as paints cars according to the clients' request. He has been practicing this business since 2008 and since then he has grown with fame and experience. 

Hani is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD in order to buy a motor generator, install a sunshade and a rolling shutter for his shop. Hani is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide a better income for his family and enhance their current life standards.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator, install a sunshade and a rolling shutter for his shop.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lalaine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers. She has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, sardines, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Lalaine would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Milvia Rosa

texts.es: Milvia es originaria de la ciudad de Nueva Segovia, casada y madre de dos hijos. De 47 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta mercadería variada. Negocio que inicio hace muchos años; el cual vendía ropa y perfumes en su ciudad de origen; luego decide venirse a la ciudad de Managua e instalar otro negocio. Poco a poco fue cr4eciendo en su negocio. Actualmente vende de todo (comida, ropa, perfumes, cosméticos). Su meta próxima es comprar pacas de ropas al por mayor para ofertar una variedad de ropa. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como: ropa variada, cosméticos, perfumes, entre otros. Con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que aumentara su inventario y a crecer su negocio. Su plan futuro es tener un tramo para vender en uno de los mercados de la ciudad.
texts.en: Milivia is from the city of Nueva Segovia.  She's 47 and married with two children.  She is a businesswoman and earns her living selling assorted merchandise.  She started her business many years ago selling clothing and perfume in her native city.  Afterward she decided to come to the city of Managua and open another business.  The business grew little by little and nowadays she sells everything (food, clothing, perfume, cosmetics).  Her next goal is to buy bundles of clothing wholesale so she can offer up a variety.  She's seeking a loan to buy merchandise like assorted clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, etc. in order to meet customer demand.  She thinks the loan will be beneficial because she'll increase inventory and grow the business.  Her future plan is to have a stall at one of the city markets.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including assorted clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Ava Group

texts.en:
“Being the eldest daughter-in-law is blessing; at the same time, the responsibility towards the family is headache,” says Reinai, and she sighs.  

She lives with her mother-in-law, two brothers-in-law and her three children. Her husband is a cultivator and during off seasons he takes up all possible work to make an earning. 

Reinai is the profile member for Ava Group. She is pictured with her hand raised. Ava's literal meaning is yellow colour. The group called themselves Ava because yellow colour is the primary colour in their traditional attire. The group is formed by 15 hardworking women who live in the same village, which is about 30 kms from Imphal town in Manipur, which is one of the northeastern states in India.

Reinai runs a cosmetic shop on the main national highway connecting the state and the neighbouring state. The shop is located close to the village where Reinai lives. She opens the shop early in the morning and closes down in the afternoon. She sells talcum powder, sunscreen lotion, shampoo, night creams, small sachet shampoo and other cosmetic products. The shop is close to a college where young girls come for classes and usually purchase cosmetics from the shop. Most of her customers are college girls and young lasses from neighbouring villages. She usually gets the supplies from the capital market and sells them at a little higher price for profit. The generated income is insufficient to support the family because she needs to pay the tax for renting the shop and also purchase supplies for the shop.

With the loan, she will purchase more cosmetic products like good quality foundation cream and other winter creams and moisturisers. She usually purchases cosmetic products with the seasonal change. Reinai says that she will repay the loan on time and will try to manage savings by opening a savings account once she purchases stocks for the shop and sells them out successfully.

She says, “Thank-you so much, Kiva.” She will always remain grateful for the wonderful help that Kiva has shown towards her and the group.
The rest of the members are engaged in weaving, piggery, poultry and other businesses

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of cosmetics for the shop.

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en:
Weedor is 43 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single and has three children between the ages of 16 and 21, all of whom are in school and live at home.

Weedor has been operating a shop where she sells pepper, bitter ball, okra, palm oil, imported oil, and rice. She started this business with money given to her by her sister, and she learned this way of selling from her mother.
 
She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, okra, palm oil, imported oil, and rice for her business. She plans to expand her business and build up her children's education even more.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, okra, palm oil, imported oil, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam is an established client aged 25 years old. She is single and an orphan who has lost her parents and is looking after her siblings all by herself.  She has applied for a loan of UGX.1,000,000 to buy mulch to help her to improve the fertility of her banana plantation. She has a challenge of little business turnover from the banana plantation, so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to buy more mulching materials in order to improve the soil fertility which will translate into higher productivity. In the photograph are Zam (center) her brother (left) and the UGAFODE credit officer (right).

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Coraline

texts.en:
Coraline is 24 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She and her fiance are living together, and  they have a nine-year-old child who lives at home and attends school.

Coraline has been involved in selling candy, biscuits, soap, etc. for three years now. She enjoys selling to customers as it enables her to help her child, and her main challenge is too little income.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more candy, biscuits, soap, etc. for her business; she would like to expand her business since she has more customers than she can satisfy.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, soap, etc. for her business

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Adwoa is a food vendor. She specializes in selling porridge and bread in her village of Nakwa located in Mankessim in the Central Region. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

She is married to a fisherman and has three children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Adwoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of porridge and bread. In the long term, Adwoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of porridge and bread.

loans.name: Ramez

texts.en:
Ramez is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. He works as an employee in a private firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Ramez's wife is a master student studying history. She loves this specialization. Ramez's wife would like to finish her study and improve her family's living conditions.
 
Ramez took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his wife's study. By taking this loan, Ramez's wife will be able to do her homework and write her reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his wife's study.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with her son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

For seven years, she and her husband have run a business of selling incense for people in her community.

Hien would like a loan to purchase a larger quantity and variety of incense to sell at the beginning of new year. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and variety of incense for selling.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 39 years old. He is a married man who has three children, 9, 7 and 4 years old, whom he supports. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by KADET staff, and he is a taking his third loan from KADET of KES 57,000.

Johnstone has a clothes shop that has lasted one year now, and he earns a monthly income of KES.13,530. His previous loan of KES 40,000 was paid back successfully. He will use his loan to buy more clothes. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. 

His hopes and dreams for his future are to open a wholesale shop and make sure his children get better education.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nahshon's Group

texts.en:
Nahshon is a member of Jamii Group in Kakamega North District.  He is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 66 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  

Nahshon has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.	

Nahshon is 60 years old and has been a farmer for 35 years.  Nahshon works as a farmer to provide for his seven children.  The community and other farmers know Nahshon as trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group and prayer group.  Nahshon described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.	

Nahshon joined One Acre Fund in 2009, and he is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Nahshon joined One Acre Fund so that he could get new farming methods.  Nahshon wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers because he is an active community member.  Nahshon has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Nahshon's life because he was able to save money.  In the future, Nahshon hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to save for the future.
  
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Nahshon and the Jamii Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is 42 years old, is married, and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have run a store selling beverages at her house for 20 years. She intends to use this loan to buy many kinds of soft drinks to sell at her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is from Eghegnadzor town. He lives with his mother. 

Edgar became the only bread winner in his family after his father died, and he does his best to provide minimum living conditions for his mother and brother. They own a plot of land, the harvest of which (nut trees) is very small and it is just enough for their family's use. They also have a small farm with three cows, two pigs and 10 chickens. 

Edgar successfully runs his small farm with the help of his mother, who helps him very much. Edgar feels very responsible to take care of their farm and living conditions and he has decided to ask for a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. 

Edgar took a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, he was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So Edgar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: To pay for oxen and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Julissa Marlene

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Julissa, tiene 30 años de edad, está divorciada y de esa relación tiene un hijo de  12 años que  estudia en colegio, ella vive en casa de los padres.
Doña Julissa es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante sola con su hijo se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, joyas de plata, bisutería y varios artículos de bazar, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas que exhibe sus productos, trabaja todos los días ya sea en sus recorridos o en su casa, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad  con la cual trata de que a su pequeño no le falte nada.
Este crédito es para comprar joyas y ropa que es lo mas salida tiene en la actualidad. Lleva más de 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Su sueño es que a  su hijo no le falte nada.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio” [“Women of the New Millenium”] meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal products, which are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is also home of the famous Panama or toquilla [a palm-like plant] straw hats.

Julissa is 30 years old and lives in Montecristi. She is divorced and has a 12-year-old son who goes to school. She lives in her parents’ house.

Julissa is a housewife. To obtain her own resources with which to provide for her son by herself, Julissa works selling clothing, silver jewelry, costume jewelry and other items. She sells door-to-door, and also from her home, where she has some glass cabinets in which she displays her products. She works every day, either door-to-door or in her house. She sells her products on credit and collects payments every eight days. She has been working at this business for three years now, and she works so that her son does not go without.

Julissa is requesting this loan to buy jewelry and clothing that is very popular right now. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than two years, and she likes it because of the help the loans she has received have been to her. Her dream is that her son not go without.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and clothing for her business.

loans.name: Habibatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois inauguré un 14 décembre 2010 regroupe en son sein des femmes très organisées avec une rigueur dans le fonctionnement de leur groupement. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et partagent de liens de solidarité voir parenté très solide. Elles font le petit commerce et diverses activités génératrices de revenu.

Madame Habibatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Agée de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons. C’est une femme qui connait bonne évolution de son activité, elle tient une gargote au village où elle vend le petit déjeuner. Elle est revendeuse aussi de crédit pour appel téléphonique de différents opérateurs.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 30 Kg d’haricot, du café traditionnel moulu, du sucre un sac au moins, une tablette d’œufs, de l’huile et divers ingrédients pour ses préparations.

En plus d’épargner les bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants sur le plan de l’habillement, de la scolarité et sanitaire.
texts.en:
This banc villageois has been created on December 14, 201-. It is composed of women who are very active. They all live in the same village, some are related, and all share a strong team spirit. They work as vendors and have small businesses.
Mrs. Habibatout (standing on the far right raising her left hand) is the star borrower of the group. 29 years of age, she is married and the mother of four children, two of whom are boys. She has been managing her business well. She has a food stand where she sells breakfast foods. She also resells cell phone recharge cards from different operators. With her new loan, she would like to buy 30 kg [66 lbs] of beans, some traditional ground coffee, at least a bag of sugar, a  tray of eggs, oil and various ingredients for her cooking.

loans.use: to buy 30 kg of beans, some traditional ground coffee, at least a bag of sugar, a  tray of eggs, oil and various ingredients for her cooking.

loans.name: Bibirahima

texts.en:
Bibirahima is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1971. Bibirahima is married and has two children. She has been busy with teaching for more than 20 years. She is a teacher in a local school in her region. Bibirahima teaches geography and biology. She is one of the best teachers and has many pupils. 

Bibirahima needs to organize the marriage party of her daughter but she has not enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 2000 somoni for the expenses of the wedding party for her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's wedding party

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in the photo. 

Randa is a 42-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and eleven kids; seven sons and four daughters in a simple house in the city. Randa's husband works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. One of Randa's sons is a student in a local university. He studies Medical Analysis. 

Randa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university costs for her son for this semester. By taking this loan, Randa will enable her son to finish his studies and get his BA degree.

loans.use: to pay the university costs for her son for this semester

loans.name: Muhsidin

texts.en: Muhsidin is married and he is a careful father of four children. His children are adults.  Muhsidin has had his business for more than 25 years. He has a garden. He grows grapes and apples. Muhsidin’s wife helps him with managing the business. Muhsidin sells his harvest to his regular customers. He must care for the grapes and apples trees. He must buy mineral fertilizers and also pay for rental workers but he does not have the money. He is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay for rental workers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and to pay for rental workers

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the spare parts and accessories needed in her business. Her tricycle business has been running for four years now. Her income from her business assists their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elvie dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and so she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and accessories as well as to pay for the maintenance of her motorized tricycle.

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 49 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married, her husband is not working, and they have four children. Only one is attending school and lives at home. 

She has been selling pepper, coal, palm oil, etc. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learn this way of selling from her mother-in-law. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, coal, palm oil, etc. for her business. Her plans is to build her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, coal, palm oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Good Time Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 60-year-old Unice from Mutare. She is married and has three children. She also cares for one other dependent. 

Unice runs a fashion boutique business selling ladies' suits, men`s suits and footwear. The business has been in operation for 16 years. She says one of the main challenges she faces is late payments by her customers. 

Unice has requested a loan of $900 to purchase men`s suits, ladies' suits and footwear to for resale to tobacco farmers. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Unice plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop. 

Unice is a member of Good Time group.

loans.use: to buy men`s suits, ladies' suits and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 30 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and has four children between 2 and 12 years old, and all of them are in school and live at home.

Amie operates a small table where she has sold candy, milk, soft drinks, and cold water for the past two years. She makes a profit and has customers.

Amie is requesting a loan to purchase more candy, milk, soft drinks, and cold water for her business. She plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, milk, soft drinks, and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a single mother who has a hair salon. She branched out into selling clothing and has now opened a bridal section with strong demand and excellent potential. Dalia works hard to ensure a stable home and decent finances. Unfortunately, last year her sister became ill with a terminal disease and most of Dalia’s time was spent taking care of her during her last months. This took an unfortunate toll on Dalia’s business but now she is turning the situation around.

Dalia needed this loan to assist in upgrading the fitting area with a professional mirror, remodeling dresses and renewing advertisement.

Dalia’s business has good potential and she just needs this help to move out of a difficult time. Dalia has enrolled in business and financial training courses to strengthen her business and promise a secure future.

loans.use: To assist in upgrading the fitting area with a professional mirror, remodeling dresses and renewing advertisement.

loans.name: Godswill Group

texts.en:
Shyllah, a member of Godswill group, is 42 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She lives in Mutare. She also cares for two other dependents. Shyllah runs a retail business selling clothes, TVs, and shoes, which she has been doing for one year. The challenge she faces in her business is the high cost of import duties. 

Shyllah requested a loan for $400, which she will use to purchase clothes and shoes to sell. The profits earned from her business will go towards the payment of school fees for her children. In the future, Shyllah plans to have a boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Etna Azucena

texts.es:
