EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Etna, tiene 87 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esta relación tiene una hija mayor de edad  que vive con ella junto a su esposo y sus nietos que son su felicidad.
Doña Etna es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante por si misma y sin depender de nadie, ella se dedica al comercio, vende una gran variedad de productos como  ropa, zapatos, bolsos, cremas, perfumes, carteras, bisuterías y muchas cosas más, la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela que la visitan, su hija le trae mercadería cada vez que viaja a Panamá, lleva más de 20 años con este negocio con el cual sale adelante ella sola.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos,  perfumes, etc. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que ha recibido de la institución. Su sueño es tener salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio" loan group meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and its artisan products which are famous around the country and the world.  It is from here that the famous Panama hat originates.

And it is here that 87-year-old Etna lives.  She is divorced but during her marriage she had a daughter, now an adult.  Etna lives with her daughter, her son-in-law and her grandchildren, who make her happy.

Etna is a woman who has always liked to prosper through her own efforts without depending on anybody.  She has a business and sells a large variety of products such as clothes, shoes, bags, creams, perfumes, purses, costume jewellery and many more items.  Etna makes most of her sales from home as she has a good number of customers who come to see her there.  Etna's daughter brings merchandise every time she travels to Panamá. Etna has had the business for over 20 years and, through it, she prospers alone.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes and other such items.  Etna has been with the loan group since the beginning and she likes the benefits and help she has received from it. Etna's dream is to have good health and to prosper.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes and other such products.

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña, desde hace 10 años tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de cervezas, y bebidas gaseosas con el cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante junto a su familia, Cesar trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día, pero cuando son fines de semana trabaja hasta 12 horas.

Gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva Cesar podrá comprar sillas y mesas para su negocio, ya que actualmente están en mal estado y con esta mejora podrá brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes; así Cesar podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Cesar lives in the district of Tinguiña. For ten years, he has had a small business selling beer and soda, which allows him to have an income in order to get ahead with his family. Cesar works around nine hours per day, but on the weekends he works up to 12 hours. 

Thanks to the support of the Kiva lenders, Cesar will be able to buy chairs and tables for his business, since they are currently in poor condition. With this improvement, he will be able to provide his clients with better service. That way, Cesar can continue fighting to be able to make his dream of having his own home a reality.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Tulkarm city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city.  Mohammad's brother works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. Mohammad is a student at a local university. He studied Business Administration in his last semester. He would like to finish his studies and earn a BA degree and then find a new job in the future.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university costs for this semester.  By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to finish his studies and earn a BA degree. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university costs for this semester

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old, single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Mahmoud's father works as an employee in a local firm, with a low income. 

Mahmoud is a student in a local university. He studies Islamic studies and he is in his third year. He would like to finish his studies and take the BA degree, then find a new job in the future.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to do his homework and easily write his reports. Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon tiene una experiencia laboral de aproximadamente 40 años, realizando la actividad de reparación y compraventa de motores de diferentes electrodomésticos, como neveras, congeladores, licuadoras, taladros, entre otros; aprendió la labor cuando trabajó por 15 años en una empresa y, luego decidió independizarse para generar mejores ingresos. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar motores y metal (cobre), para realizar reparaciones o para revender el metal, así logra capitalizar su negocio para la temporada de fin de año, en la que obtiene mejores utilidades por su labor.
Jhon tiene planeado para un futuro cercano, tener un local más amplio, en el que pueda mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo y le permita mejorar sus ingresos; así estará en la capacidad de disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jhon has forty years experience repairing and buying and selling motors for different types of domestic appliances, such as fridges, freezers, blenders and drills.  He learned this trade during the fifteen years he worked for another business and then decided to start his own business in order to earn a higher income.  Jhon is now applying for this loan in order to buy motors and metal (copper) so that he can repair items or re-sell the metal.  This way he will be able to earn some money during this end of year season and make better profits for his work.  In the near future, Jhon would like to have bigger premises and improve his working conditions.  This will allow him to improve his income and he will be able to enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy motors and metal (copper).

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.en: Jurabek lives with his family in a rural region. He is married and has a child. Jurabek has been busy selling oils for more than 24 years. He has great experience. Jurabek has regular customers. His customers are café cooks. He manages his business alone. His wife is a housewife. Jurabek is the sole breadwinner of his family. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy oils for increasing working capital. He awaits your support and in advance, thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy (cooking) oil

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a merchant  from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a construction worker. Her six children are between the ages of 10 and 22-years-old. Merlinda has operated her sari-sari store business for several years now. 

Merinda is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, toiletries and seasonings. With this, she will be able to improve her stock which will allow her to cater to more buyers.  In the future, Merlinda hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, toiletries and seasonings

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rebecca dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition from other sellers. She will use the KES 5,000 loan to add stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 45 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and has nine children, aged between 9 and 30. The children are in school and live at home.

Kebbeh has been selling rice and soup, from a local restaurant, for the past two years. She learned this trade from her mother. Her main challenge is the high cost of the cooking ingredients.

She’s requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more food ingredients for her business, including rice, pepper, palm oil, fish, and meat. She would like to own her own shop, one day.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients for her business, including rice, pepper, palm oil, fish, and meat.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 31 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She’s single, and has three children between 4 and 13 years old, who live at home and attend school.

Cecelia has been selling clothes for the past five years. She was taught how to run the business by her mother-in-law. Her main challenge is the high cost of clothing. She is happy when she makes more profit; it enables her to help her children and pay their school fees.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business, such as blouses and tee-shirts. She would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business, such as blouses and tee-shirts.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
47-year-old Jennie lives in Gardnersville. She’s a widow and has seven children between 25 and 30. Only four of them live at home and attend school. Jennie has been selling rice, oil, and pepper for the past nine years.  She was taught how to run the business by her mother.  

Her main challenge is the high cost of goods.  She is happy when she makes more profit; it enables her to educate her children, and provides food in the home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper for her business. She would like to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 28 years old and lives in Logan Town. She is married and has three children, ages between 4 and 13; all of them are attending school and live at home. For the past five years, Mercy has been operating a table where she sells palm oil. She has a small amount of capital that she is operating her business with. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Mercy plans to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Fatumatta

texts.en: Fatumatta lives in Logan Town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia.  The living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms, over population, etc.  Fatumatta is 47-years-old and married with six children between the ages of 16 and 30-years-old, four of whom are in school and live at home.  For the past 10 years she has been operating a shop in the local market selling bags of rice, sugar, biscuits, etc.  She started this business with money from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her aunty. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice, sugar, biscuits, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business and help her children with money.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, sugar, biscuits, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Elkin De Jesús

texts.es:
Elkin es un artesano de 60 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo, trabajando arduas jornadas para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Tiene 40 años de experiencia y aprendió el oficio de manera empírica, su labor consiste en vender ropa con telas crudas que él mismo confecciona y tintura con estilos hindúes. Trabaja de lunes a sábado de 9 am a 8 pm, aprovechando que su módulo se encuentra en un parque principal del centro de la ciudad, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa; así genera los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas y tinturas), esto le permitirá capitaliza su negocio y podrá ofrecer más variedad de estilos y diseños para satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes; dando como resultado un incremento en las ventas y en los ingresos que percibe.
Elkin manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando y hacer de su negocio una industria con todos los procesos y acabados de producción y diseño, y as{i tener la posibilidad de comercializar sus prendas a nivel nacional, generando una rentabilidad que le garantice a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Elkin is a 60 year old craftsman. He is married and the father of two children who he has raised with a lot of effort, working long days to provide the sustenance for his family. His work consists of selling clothing with fabric that he has sewn and dyed in East Indian styles. He has 40 years of experience and learned this trade by practicing it. He works from Monday to Saturday from 9 am to 8 pm taking advantage of his stand being in a main park in the center of the city. He also has the help of his wife. Doing this he manages to generate enough money to support his family. 

The loan Elkin has requested will be invested in the purchase of wholesale supplies (fabric and dyes). This will permit him to capitalize his business and be able to offer more variety of styles and designs to satisfy the varied tastes of his customers.  The result will be an increase in sales and revenues. 

Elkin states that his main goal is to continue struggling and to make his business an industry involving all the processes and finishing of production and design. Then he'd have a chance of selling his product on a national level generating a profit that would guarantee a financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabric and dyes).

loans.name: Elshadai Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Abigail from Mutare. She is married with three children, all of whom are attending school.  Abigail runs an agriculture related business (poultry) rearing broiler chickens. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges faced are the shortage of day-old chicks and feed due to high demand. 

Abigail has requested a loan of $600 to buy day-old chicks and feed for her poultry business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will be channeled towards payment of her children's school fees and in turn will improve the family's general welfare. In the future Abigail plans to produce layers and venture into starting a piggery. Abigail is a member of the Elshadai group.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed for the poultry business

loans.name: Blessing Queens Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 26-year-old Moleen from Mutare. She is married with two children and one is attending school.  Moleen runs a fashion boutique business selling ladies suits, dresses and skirts. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenges faced are high competition and high import duty at border posts. Moleen has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes (ladies suits, dresses and skirts) to supply to tobacco farmers. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future, Moleen plans to own a boutique shop in town. Moleen is a member of Blessing Queens group.

loans.use: to buy ladies suits, dresses and skirts for resale

loans.name: Twezimbe Katwe Devt Group

texts.en:
Grace, a member of Twezimbe Katwe Devt Group, is a 50-year-old woman. She has eight children, with ages between 8 and 20 years. Grace also has a motorcycle which generates her some income. She began the business to acquire income to support her family. 

She will use the loan to buy more bunches of bananas and more vegetables to sell to her customers in her stall. She hopes to acquire more profits that she will use to start a retail shop. 

Her challenges are competition and high transport costs. She is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: to buy bananas and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 23-year-old single young man from Deir Elbalah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. He works as an employee in a private firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Ihab is a student in his last year where he studies Accounting. He loves this specialization. Ihab would like to finish his studies and find a job and help his family to improve their living conditions. 

Ihab took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ihab will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily.
 
Ihab appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single young man from Deir Elbalah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. His father works as an employee in a private firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Mohammad is a student in his second year where he studies business administration. He loves this specialization. Mohammad would like to finish his studies and find a job and help his family to improve their living conditions. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan is a 19-year-old single young man from Deir Elbalah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. His father works as an employee in a private firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Kanan is a student in his first year where he studies engineering. He loves this specialization. Kanan would like to finish his studies and find a job and help his family to improve their living conditions.
 
Kanan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Kanan will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily. 

Kanan appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Veronica decided to set up her own small-scale business as a fish monger. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes it to sell in Elmina, located in the Central Region. She is currently looking to expand her business further. Unfortunately, Veronica is limited due to a lack of funding. This loan will help her to purchase an increased amount of fish to resell. Veronica aims to use the profits from her new business to support her husband (who is a public servant) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish to resell.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the farming business for more than four years. This is the source of her income. Marisa works hard in her farm, in order to support her family.

Now, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman from San Miguel, Bohol, and a mother of four children. She is engaged in a food-vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place. Susana has been in the business for several years now.

Susana is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food-vending, like flour, sugar, and milk. 

With this, she will be able to cook more and sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food-vending, like flour, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Josphine's Group

texts.en:
Imani is a group of seven farmers in Kakamega North District with Josphine being selected to act as the Kiva representative.  Josephine is standing on the right with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to Josephine and the 69 other individual One Acre Fund farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings (KES) for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Josphine is a reliable member of the community. She is married with six children. Josphine is 47 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 26 years to support her family. In addition to this, Josphine is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group and burial committees. She described her harvest last year as good. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund to enjoy the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.

Josphine joined One Acre Fund in 2009, and is now enrolling in the 2014 Long Rains season as a group leader. Josphine joined One Acre Fund so that she could learn new farming methods. Because she is an active community member, Josphine has become more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.

Working with One Acre Fund has improved Josphine's life because she has more farm training, and has been able to save money to feed her family. In the future, Josphine hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. 

Josphine and the Imani Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Aitha Group

texts.en:
The Aitha group consists of four females from Hodeidah, Yemen. All members of the group are hoping to earn a good income that will allow them to improve their families' quality of life. 

Fatima, 22 years old, is a single woman who works hard to assist her parents in meeting their expenses. Fatima creates homemade henna items including mixing perfumes and creams which are used by brides for their wedding. She sells her products to retailers, customers and door to door. 

Any shortages of her product items will cause Fatima's business to stop. That is why she has applied for a loan to buy the henna items required to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy the henna items required to continue her business.

loans.name: Vilma Gloria

texts.es:
Vilma es una mejer de 38 años de edad, madre de 2 niños, uno de sus hijos estudia. Ella esta acompañada, el esposo esta e USA, de ella dependen sus dos hijos

Ella vende productos por catálogo, desde hace 2 años, este trabajo lo aprendió por medio de una amiga, quien le inculco a dedicarse a este comercio; antes de este negocio se dedicaba a vender ropa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa y para comprar ropa para la venta. Su vida mejorara,  ya que tendrá una mejor instalación en su casa.

Desea tener en su casa tenga mejores condiciones de vida y que su negocio crezca cada día mas.
texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old and a mother to two children, one of whom is in school. Vilma is married; her husband is in the US and Vilma's children depend on their mother.

Vilma has been selling catalogue products for two years.  She learned this trade from a friend, who encouraged her to start this business.  Before, Vilma sold clothes.

Vilma is applying for a loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to install electricity in her house and to buy clothes to sell.  With this, Vilma's life will improve as her home will be better equipped.

Vilma wants to have better living conditions in her home and for her business to grow all the time.

loans.use: to install electricity in her house and to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help to his family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Domingo would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Domingo hopes to have another unit of tricycle and dreams that his family will always be in good health. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle (motorcycle transport vehicle).

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area good for dairy farming and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to add a stock of cows and buy animal feed. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy animal feed and also pay school fees for her children. This is her third  loan with SMEP DTM.  She also grows crops to earn extra cash.

loans.use: buy animal feed and also pay school fees
